App Dev Team Mgmt (Application Development)

Job Number: 3194188
POSTING DATE: Dec 2, 2021
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Development
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Vice President

DESCRIPTION
Description
Company Profile
Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.
As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.

Technology
Technology works as a strategic partner with Morgan Stanley business units and the world's leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global, complex, and dynamic financial markets. Morgan Stanley's sizeable investment in technology results in quantitative trading systems, cutting-edge modelling and simulation software, comprehensive risk and security systems, and robust client-relationship capabilities, plus the worldwide infrastructure that forms the backbone of these systems and tools. Our insights, our applications and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients' businesses and to our own.

Institutional Securities Technology (IST)
Institutional Securities Technology (IST) is part of Technology. This group is responsible for developing enterprise applications for a diverse set of businesses including Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research, and Global Capital Markets. In addition, IST provides technology solutions for client-aligned groups and company-wide divisions, such as Finance and Operations, post-trade functions and standardized data and enterprise-wide services to provide leverage to the Firm's businesses.

Position Description
Seeking a Vice President in Technology to lead a Business Intelligence reporting space. The candidate will be a Senior Technical Lead with hands-on BI Reporting experience BOXI, Qlikview, Tableau, PowerBI etc. The team is responsible for providing reporting and analytics solutions around client and sales revenue to the Institutional Securities business (IED/FID/FX). The candidate will be based out of New York and will be part of the Client and Sales Revenue division within the Sales and Distribution department. The candidate will run a global team with team members in New York, London and Bangalore. The candidate is responsible to architect the BI solutions based on the client needs and will be directly be interacting with the stakeholders in globally to manage the priority and the delivery of reports and analytical solutions.
Responsibilities -
Managing a team of 8-10 developers, a mix of employees and consultants, spread globally in NYC, London and Bangalore.
Design, develop, and implement cutting edge solutions for business problems in a dynamic financial services environment where client revenues , client profitability and client tiering and sales performance are key to the ever-changing business growth strategy.
Client relationship management, Prioritization and delivery management keeping the environment stable but constantly addressing the changing client needs.
Driving requirements, documenting requirements, designing technical solutions and working with the team to deliver on the above using Agile methodology. Should be proficient in understanding Agile processes and KPI and optimizing for higher productivity.
Drive DevOps adoption and automation across the IT projects aimed at streamlining change management.
Hands on development, coding and code-reviews debugging where needed.
Ensure adherence to established technical standards and guidelines.
Collaborate effectively with cross functional teams including data teams, QA, Production support, controllers, operations etc.
Work closely with QA for assuring high quality products are delivered that meet the business needs, work with production support teams to ensure that the infrastructure/platform is well looked after, kept stable and SLAs for availability are met
Contribute effectively at many different points in a project life cycle as an individual contributor as well as a team lead
Adhere to project timelines, addressing and resolving technical issues
Lead functional/technical group discussions with analysts and developers

QUALIFICATIONS
Qualifications/Skills Required
Degree in Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, or related discipline is required
Experience building SaaS reporting solutions on cloud providers like Azure / AWS / GCP.
Prior work experience with Agile/Devops is preferred
Extensive experience in providing Reporting, Data Visualization, Data Analysis, Business Intelligence solutions like PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview.
Solid experience with SQL and creation of DB objects including stored procs., views, triggers, etc.
Extensive experience in information delivery, involving elements of Data Warehouse design, reporting, analytics, operational data stores, large data volumes etc.
Strong scripting skills in UNIX using Python/Perl/Shell
Excellent problem-solving and quantitative skills
Strong written and oral communication skills

Desirable Skills and Experience
Prior work experience in the financial industry is a plus
Experience in DB2,Tableau,Qlikview,Greenplum
Database optimization skills a big plus
Experience or understanding of Artificial Intelligence (AI),Machine Learning (ML),and Applied Statistics

At Arthur, we are building the first platform for Responsible AI. We work with leaders in finance, healthcare, self-driving transportation, and other leading AI industries. We are backed by the best investors in enterprise software and are growing our team led by industry veterans with deep expertise in ML. We are looking for Machine Learning Engineers to join our diverse and collaborative team!

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Arthur, you'll help build capabilities such as:

Detecting and mitigating issues of fairness and bias in ML algorithms
Data drift detection, high-dimensional density estimation, time series anomaly detection
Large-scale explainability methods for tabular, image, text, and video data


You might have a few of the following:

A Masters or PhD in a quantitative field
At least two years of professional experience in a data science or ML role
Mastery of statistical methods and contemporary ML algorithms
Experience with the usual suspects: Python, Scala, or R; Tensorflow, PyTorch or other DL frameworks.
Experience deploying ML models to production and thinking deeply about model risk management.
Software engineering best practices, version control, containerization
ML publications, technical blogging, and/or open source projects
Experience with public cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience in a product-drive data science role

You'll probably like working with us if you:

Enjoy elevating your colleagues and succeeding together
Take pride in sharing your knowledge with others
Prefer to push yourself outside of your intellectual comfort zone
Like costume parties

We offer

Working with a fast-growing and passionate team, lots of opportunity to take ownership with projects and shape our product roadmap
The opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a rapidly growing startup
Generous equity and a full benefits package
A culture that empowers great people to accomplish great things
Flexibility to work out of our NYC or DC offices

About The Position
Location: New York area or DC area
Who are we?
 We make the invisible visible. Deep digital investigation platforms for your most complex challenges.
Voyager Labs enables investigators and analysts to collect and analyze massive amounts of complex digital unstructured data and acquire actionable, previously unattainable insights. Leading government and law enforcement agencies, as well as private sector clients, use our cutting-edge AI technology in the worldwide to gain a vital edge in the battle against crime, fraud, terror, trafficking, internal threats and other risks.
Each of our employees has the chance to both make the world a better place and grow and develop his/her skills in a growing, dynamic and fast-paced environment.
This is an excellent opportunity for experienced Talent Acquisition professional to lead our growth in US and grow our amazing team.
In this role you will be able to provide your know how and experience in building our recruiting and onboarding processes in US to grow our strong team of sales, pre-sales, marketing and operations professionals both in DC as well as in our NYC site as well as remotely.
In This Job You Will
Provide full lifecycle recruitment for our USA based positions on a national level; from opening the position, through sourcing and HR interviews, until hire and onboarding
Proactively focus on direct sourcing, referrals, employer branding and other strategies to ensure a consistent top-of-the-funnel pipeline of qualified candidates
Engage and maintain a relationship with recruitment agencies
Build strong relationships with candidates and maintain a positive candidate experience
Work closely with hiring managers
Conduct phone and HR interviews
Collaborate with our HR team, located in our HQ
Manage the recruitment process using our ATS (Comeet)
Requirements
5+ years of recruiting experience within the US in a high-growth high-tech company
Demonstrated success with direct sourcing and doing what it takes to find the right candidates
Experience recruiting for business oriented roles, such as Sales Directors
Ability to build trust with the candidates and with the hiring managers
Experience working with an ATS (Comeet – advantage)
** The employment can be done as a FTE or consultant
Voyager Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

JobTitle: Assistant Professor in Mechanics and Materials - Binghamton...
Content_text:
Location: Binghamton, NY Category: Faculty Posted On: Thu Sep 23 2021 Job Description:

The Department of Mechanical Engineering at the State University of New York at Binghamton invites applications for a tenure-track faculty position at the assistant professor level in the areas of Mechanics and Materials. The department is particularly interested in a candidate whose research intersects with the fields of AI, machine learning, advanced manufacturing or soft materials. The position will start effective Fall 2022.
The Department of Mechanical Engineering has 20 faculty members, with undergraduate and graduate enrollments of approximately 400 and 110 students, respectively. The Department of Mechanical Engineering and the Watson College of Engineering and Applied Science are dedicated to the goal of building a diverse and inclusive teaching, research, and working environment. Potential applicants who share this goal, especially underrepresented minorities, women and persons with disabilities, are strongly encouraged to apply. Additional information about the Mechanical Engineering Department at Binghamton University can be found online at http://www.binghamton.edu/me/.
Job Requirements:
Candidates must have a PhD in Mechanical Engineering or a closely related field. The successful candidate is expected to develop a research program capable of securing competitive external research funding. The candidate must also have the potential for quality teaching at both the undergraduate and graduate levels and is expected to address teaching needs in the above areas.
Additional Information:
The State University of New York is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. It is the policy of Binghamton University to provide for and promote equal opportunity employment, compensation, and other terms and conditions of employment without discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, religion, disability, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military service member status, marital status, domestic violence victim status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, or arrest and/or criminal conviction record unless based upon a bona fide occupational qualification or other exception.
As required by title IX and its implementing regulations, Binghamton University does not discriminate on the basis of sex in the educational programs and activities which it operates. This requirement extends to employment and admission. Inquiries about sex discrimination may be directed to the University Title IX Coordinator or directly to the Office of Civil Rights (OCR). Contact information for the Title IX Coordinator and OCR, as well as the University's complete Non-Discrimination Notice may be found here.
Pursuant to Executive Order 161, no State entity, as defined by the Executive Order, is permitted to ask, or mandate, in any form, that an applicant for employment provide his or her current compensation, or any prior compensation history, until such time as the applicant is extended a conditional offer of employment with compensation. If such information has been requested from you before such time, please contact the Governor's Office of Employee Relations at (518) 474-6988 or via email at info@goer.ny.gov.
Binghamton University is a tobacco-free campus effective August 1, 2017.

Director/Senior Director, AI and Deep Learning
Company Description

Butterfly Network's mission is to democratize healthcare by enabling universal access to superior medical imaging. We reinvented ultrasound technology by creating the world's first handheld, single-probe whole-body ultrasound system: the Butterfly iQ. This innovative technology reduces the cost of the traditional ultrasound system by miniaturizing it onto a single semiconductor silicon chip.

Butterfly harnesses the advantages of AI, cloud and mobile / edge computing to deliver advanced imaging that is easy-to-use and built for the digital era.The Butterfly iQ and next-generation Butterfly iQ+ have received CE Mark and FDA clearance, and are being sold in hospitals and clinics around the globe.

Joining Butterfly Network is the opportunity to redesign the future of healthcare through the power of technology. Embark on a journey with us to maximize global impact, motivated by the idea that our products will change the lives of millions along with the people you love.

Job Description

You will lead the Deep Learning team at Butterfly developing AI products and services while driving Butterfly's trusted AI strategy in both cloud and edge computing. As the head of DL and AI you will have demonstrable experience and credibility developing applied DL models, product development in the field of AI and managing complex AI deployments and production environments. Further, you will represent Butterfly as a world class subject matter expert in strategic partnerships and customer facing engagements.

As part of our team, your core responsibilities will:

Grow, lead and retain the high performing DL team at Butterfly
Drive the development of DL models, products, services and production environments
Drive the DL infrastructure using a DevOps mindset and strong collaboration with our platform teams.
Manage a funnel of AI products through Butterfly's regulatory framework strongly collaborating with our regulatory and quality teams
Perform a broad variety of tasks in support of the role and responsibilities
Qualifications

Baseline skills/experiences/attributes:

6+ years hands on experience developing machine learning applications
4+ years leading applied AI / ML / DL development teams in a strong customer value focussed company
Expertise in python, tensorflow or pytorch; experience with C++, relational databases, modern cloud computing platforms
PhD in Machine Learning / Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent technical experience

Ideally, you also have these skills/experiences/attributes (but it's ok if you don't!):

Experience working in healthcare or other highly regulated environments
Experience leading technical due-diligence / managing integrations with 3rd party organizations
Experience mentoring junior and mid-level teammates and carving out paths towards engineering career progression
Ability to partner with cross functional teams to translate requirements into well designed solutions and to make deeply technical topics accessible to non-technical stakeholders
3+ years of hands on experience integrating models into highly scalable production runtimes such as in the cloud or within native iOS/Android application

You Deeply Identify with Core Butterfly Network Values:

Efficient & Speedy - you get work done in a fraction of the time as industry peers
Intellectually Curious - you are thoughtful & inquisitive; people enjoy working with you because they learn from you
Mission-Driven & Committed - you are passionate about the company's purpose and are immensely productive
Team Oriented - you celebrate and take joy in the success of others on the team

 Additional Information

We offer great perks:

Fully covered medical insurance plan, and dental & vision coverage - as a health-tech company, we place great worth on our teams' well-being
Pre-tax commuter benefits - we make your commute more reasonable
Free onsite meals + kitchen stocked with snacks
401k plan - we facilitate your retirement goals
Flexible Paid Time Off - recharge and come back ready to make an impact
Beautiful office overlooking the Flatiron building in NYC
Competitive salaried compensation - we value our employees and show it
Equity - we want every employee to be a stakeholder
The opportunity to build a revolutionary healthcare product and save millions of lives!

For this role, we provide visa assistance for qualified candidates

Butterfly network does not accept agency resumes.

Butterfly Network Inc. is an E-Verify Company.

Butterfly Network is an equal opportunity employer. Regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or Veteran status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Butterfly Network requires as a condition of employment proof of vaccination for COVID-19 subject to accommodation for sincerely held religious beliefs and/or disability.

We are:
Accenture’s Oracle practice, and we make the new happen now. Every day, we imagine the future and bring it to life using design thinking, agile development methodologies, and new smart tech like IoT, automation, and AI. We even built our own platform, myConcerto, that mixes the best parts of Accenture and Oracle to help companies come into their own as digital leaders. Ready to find genius answers to seriously hard business challenges and work with some of the best Come join a team that feels personal even though it’s over 54,000 strong. As a Global Cloud Elite and Platinum member of the Oracle Partner Network with over 145 awards, we’re proud the industry is taking notice of our work, too. Visit us here to find out more about Accenture's Oracle practice (https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/oracle-index.)
You Are:
A transformation maven with the skills to help clients meet the challenges of digitization. Your human superpower? Using your know-how, creativity, and analytical powers to solve clients’ most complex business problems to help their companies do more. You’re as comfortable leading projects and teams as you are diving into the details of workstreams and configuring Oracle solutions. Or you specialize in one or the other, our practice covers the functional & process side of Oracle as well as the technical development & technical architecture. Additionally, you have the communication and people skills to inspire teams to bring their A-game.
The work:
Help clients understand leading business processes so they can transform their business with Oracle
Spot strategies, risks, and options, and then recommend approaches that sidestep problems and help clients and functions meet their needs
Lead, coach and advise a small project team in addition to managing their performance (depending upon the structure of a project)
Give clients options for designs using prototypes
Set up, document, and test the Oracle system; understand and apply Oracle methodologies
Work with clients and stakeholders to make sure they get where they want to go
Gain the trust of your client, teammates, and managers to make sure projects get delivered
Keep growing your skills to help your team with business development and sales efforts
Stay in the know on leading industry trends and Oracle features to give your clients the best solutions for their need
For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.
Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts

Basic Qualifications:
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with Oracle RMB (Revenue Management & Billing)
Minimum of 2 years of experience with functional testing for Oracle RMB applications
Minimum of 1 Full life cycle implementation Oracle RMB
Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years' work experience). If Associate's Degree, must have equivalent minimum 6-year work experience.
Bonus points if:
You’re an ace at managing and delivering projects
You’re great at working creatively in a problem-solving environment
You’ve gained the trust of your clients and partnered with them to: design business process, lead key configuration workshops, identify GAPs, identify RICEW, and design functionality and test plans, and perform testing.

ExlService.com, LLC - New York, NY

Title: Assistant General Counsel

Duties: The Assistant General Counsel (multiple openings) at ExlService.com, LLC in New York, New York will advise senior management on outsourcing, analytics and software transactions, including providing advice and guidance on complex contract issues and appropriate risk allocation for strategic and core business transactions. Review and draft master services agreements, statements of work, amendment agreements, and related agreements. Negotiate with clients' internal counsel, or external counsel to finalize documents and close deals. Act as main legal coverage for all Australian law issues: including reviewing/drafting the above-mentioned agreements for Australia clients and assisting on Australian law issues. Balance business and contract goals against legal, business, policy and reputational risks; use judgment to make reasoned decisions to take appropriate risks. Responsible for administration of all U.S. affiliate and subsidiary entities. Coordinate with other in-house counsel as member of a larger team. Provide advice and guidance on compliance issues related to sourcing and procurement matters. Assist commercial business department in adopting and executing best practices for negotiation and review of vendor agreements. Defend positions and views to business team members, as well as counterparties. Ensure that business teams understand the implications of contracts from an end-to-end perspective. Work on company-wide internal projects including designing and implementing the company's AI Bias policy and framework. Assist with mergers & acquisition activities. Telecommuting available.

Minimum Requirements: Requires a Juris Doctor (J.D.), plus five years of professional legal experience advising and counseling international organizations on transactional contract issues. Must include 5 years of transactional experience with each of the following: (1) negotiating and drafting legal documents for commercial transactions; (2) managing cross-functional projects, including working with different stakeholders; (3) managing a legal team to support business deals; (4) delivering verbal and written communications to clients, senior managers, and executives. Must also include 2 years of experience with (5) negotiating and drafting commercial contracts under Australian law. Must be licensed to practice law in the State of New York.

Send resume and cover letter to us.careers@exlservice.com. Must cite job title and code 1774 in response.

JobTitle: Head of WW Solutions Architecture, Engineering and Construct...
Content_text:
Must have a minimum of 7 years of experience in senior technical leader positions.
Practical experience transforming, designing and implementing Enterprise systems at scale.
Technical knowledge of enterprise IT is required, including: global infrastructure, tiered application architectures, data center operations, software license management, etc. with ability to go deep on technical aspects to understand current and future customer needs and present AWS technical benefits.
Technical knowledge of common enterprise application and commercial software used across the Industry, including systems that are used for logistics, exploration, data lakes and automation across the Engineering & Construction Industry value chain.
Strong understanding of Enterprise systems, high scale data movement, storage and analytics techniques, digital customer experiences.
Must have a demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations, with customers, SIs and ISVs.
Strong understanding of advanced analytic techniques such as machine learning models, deep learning, artificial intelligence and the application of these analytic approaches to Engineering & Construction workloads.
Able to work in a diverse team

Would you like to own driving the Engineering & Construction Industry strategy for the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Solutions Architecture teams, and work with the world’s largest and most creative companies using our Cloud platform to solve their most challenging problems? Are you passionate about applying the next generation of cloud-based compute and storage services within the Engineering & Construction industry (including all aspects of Operators, Engineering & Construction equipment providers and Technology suppliers). Come join us!
At AWS we are building a cross-functional team of global technical leaders passionate about growing technology adoption of cloud computing by engaging directly with technical leaders, C-level executives and influencers at all levels across the industry. We are seeking individuals with the business background, technical depth, Executive experience and communication skills needed to tackle the complex challenges of our Engineering & Construction industry customers face as they make the journey to the cloud. We’re hiring highly passionate experts in Cloud computing to work with our Solutions Architects and Business Development teams on key customer and partner engagements.
You will possess a technical background that enables you to drive an engagement and interact at the highest levels within our customer teams. You possess the presence and wherewithal to easily communicate the benefits of cloud computing to a variety of technical and business audiences. You also demonstrate the ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of global businesses, and are deeply familiar with complex, legacy IT environments, compliance and regulatory requirements and with Industry workloads (including 1) Automation, robotics and operational hardware, 2) Digitally enabled workforce, 3) Integrated enterprise, platforms and ecosystems, and 4) Next-generation analytics and decision support) and commercial ISV solutions that support these workloads. Your knowledge of data and how to leverage advanced AI/ML will solve complex Industry challenges. Your understanding of the broad Engineering & Construction industry ecosystem makes you stand out from your industry peers.

Roles & Responsibilities


Together with the Business Development team and the broader AWS team including Partners, Professional Services and Marketing, you will develop the technical elements of the AWS Engineering & Construction industry strategy for AWS, and plan to engage customers and partners in selected segments within the Industry.
You will engage with Business Development leaders, Solutions Architects, Account Managers, Professional Services, Marketing and Partners to define a solution engagement strategy for AWS operational geographies and key accounts.
You are responsible for partnering with local domain experts across the globe to identify the most critical technologies for multiple Industry use-cases, including software solutions and best-practices architectures, to guide AWS solution and service strategies.
You will establish technical credibility in sales cycles, personally and through the broader technical team to drive discussions with CTOs, CIOs, Chief Architects, Senior Developers, etc. from both customer and partners.
Demonstrate thought leadership in the Engineering & Construction space, and credibly represent AWS at Global industry events, conferences, symposiums, etc.

·
Must be able to travel approximately 30%

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Technical degree highly desired; or equivalent background, with AWS Certification preferred.
International industry experience and knowledge.
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skills.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit US Disability Accommodations.

New York University: NYU - NY: Tandon School of Engineering
Location
Brooklyn, New York
Open Date
Nov 17, 2021
Description
The NYU Center for Responsible AI (NYU R/AI) is looking for a full time Research Scientist to join our growing interdisciplinary team and contribute to the Center’s applied research, public engagement, and educational activities. This position is a one(1) year position, with an opportunity to renew subject to availability of funds.
The Research Scientist will engage in original interdisciplinary research. In addition to taking on a leadership role in ongoing projects, the research fellow will enjoy the intellectual freedom to engage in research activities of their choice, within the scope of R/AI’s broad responsible data science and AI agenda. They will also work closely with Prof. Julia Stoyanovich to develop and execute on a robust public education and public engagement strategy. Examples of activities currently underway include a public education course that we plan to offer at scale in the immediate future; comic book series for which we are looking to achieve broader reach; curriculum development and dissemination for data scientists, and industry and government practitioners; and a growing portfolio of participatory design work.

Qualifications
Required qualifications:
MA or PhD (preferred) with expertise in STS or related field;
Excellent communication skills;
Demonstrated program coordination experience, ideally in an academic setting.
Application Instructions
Please apply through Interfolio with:
CV or resume;
Brief cover letter, explaining your interest and fit for the position;
3 reference letters, submitted by recommenders (not by the candidate).

HiredScore brings deeply integrated big data and workforce intelligence solutions to the global Fortune 500. By leveraging data from companies' Human Resources Data ecosystem, HiredScore enables HR departments to automate and augment their hiring process, enriching recruiters' decisions with smart insights and candidate prioritization grades of A, B, C, or D.
HiredScore's Artificial Intelligence Engine uses past company hiring data, global hiring data, and other data sources including labor market data, employee performance data, and CRM data, to revolutionize the end-to-end recruiting workflow as well as integrate seamlessly with other HR Systems such as chatbots, assessment tests, video interviews, and other automation tools. We work hard at HiredScore, led by the fearless vision of CEO and Founder Athena Karp, to bring to life the next generation of hiring practices and our vision of the Future of Work.
HiredScore's mission is to bring data science into the Human Resources domain.
We are looking for a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join a small super HR team, in charge of delivering the best HR Practices, Recruiting process, and Welfare support to the company's employees. This role will be a strategic business partner to our hiring managers while sourcing creatively for top talent and advocating for an exceptional candidate experience.
Roles & Responsibilities:

Partner closely with a business area to execute on their talent strategy by mapping out a sourcing strategy and an effective hiring process so they can meet their hiring goals.
Work as a collaborative member of the HiredScore recruitment team by collaborating on projects that may focus on implementing processes and/or building talent-related programs.
Ensure candidates have a positive experience regardless of the outcome of the hiring process.
Strategize and leverage “out-of-the-box” methods to source exceptional talent and contribute to developing a strong employer brand.
Consult with hiring teams to determine hiring priorities and define job descriptions and levels for new roles as we build out scaling teams.
Coach and train hiring teams on interview best practices.
Provide reports and metrics on recruitment activities and utilize data to identify trends and opportunities to identify opportunities and use as a tool to influence hiring trends.
Utilize Comeet, LinkedIn Recruiter, and other technical sourcing tools.
What You Need:

At least 3 years of full-cycle recruitment experience in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Experience recruiting for Sales, Customer Success, and any client-facing functions is highly advantageous.
Ability to consult and establish credibility with stakeholders to influence talent decisions.
Strong communication, interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
The ability to work through solutions and collaborate within a matrix organization.
Demonstrated ability to source candidates with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
Adaptability and resilience to flow with our ever-changing business needs and navigate day-to-day challenges.

Vimeo is looking for a Data Scientist to join the Video Insights team.

Vimeo's platform provides the highest quality video tools for filmmakers, businesses, and video lovers around the globe. Video Insights team delivers services and products that help Vimeo users make effective videos, by applying Artificial intelligence (AI) technologies connecting between video content and it's online performance .

It is a great opportunity to join a core founding team and take part in shaping the AI movement within Vimeo.

What you'll do:
Work closely with Researchers, Data Analysts and Product to build tools that provide insights on how content of videos is correlated against relevant video performance metrics.
Analyze diverse datasets and implement statistical and machine learning models to extract actionable insights on user and content behavior as well drivers of key business and product metrics
Be part of a cross-functional team, providing the best practices in data science for the team and across the organization.
Partner with relevant teams to deploy outcomes, as well as monitor KPIs and model performance in production.
Skills and knowledge you should possess:
3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist, with a M.Sc/B.Sc in a relevant quantitative discipline.
Experience with Hypothesis testing, A/B testing, Bayesian inference, time series modeling, linear and non-linear regression, clustering and classification, as well as statistical and machine learning methods.
Ability to understand and work with weakly defined problems, refine definitions and come up with actionable solutions.
Fluent in Python especially with the standard third-party libraries (numpy, scipy, sklearn, statsmodels, pandas, matplotlib, etc.), SQL, large scale systems.
Experience in working with large data sets.
Good communication skills and ability to work in a cross-functional team.
Bonus Points:
Experience with Deep Learning Frameworks such as TensorFlow, Pytorch.

About us:

Vimeo (NASDAQ: VMEO) is the world's leading all-in-one video software solution. Our platform enables any professional, team, and organization to unlock the power of video to create, collaborate and communicate. We proudly serve our growing community of over 230 million users — from creatives to entrepreneurs to the world's largest companies.

Vimeo is headquartered in New York City with offices around the world. At Vimeo, we believe our impact is greatest when our workforce of passionate, dedicated people, represents our diverse and global community. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer where diversity, equity and inclusion is championed in how we build our products, develop our leaders, and strengthen our culture.

Learn more at www.vimeo.com
Learn more at www.vimeo.com/jobs

5 years of experience in customer-facing digital innovation or equivalent consultative-selling role
Deep experience of business development in enterprise technology
Good understanding of public and hybrid cloud platforms, and the technologies customers are using to drive and deliver digital innovation
Familiarity with Amazonian innovation principles and mechanisms, notably customer obsession and working backwards
Experience with user experience, service design, design thinking or related
Experience with training, enablement and accreditation
Passion for enterprise market – deep understanding of how enterprises operate and the characteristics of large and global businesses
Ability to multitask and manage portfolio of projects - work prioritization, planning, collaboration, and management
Operational excellence mind-set and experience. Data driven. Excellent problem-solving skills. Adept at simplifying complexity and developing scalable propositions
Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results. Ability to effectively lead and work with a variety of organizations, management levels, cultures, and personalities
Exceptional interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills. Experience communicating with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple teams
Education – BA or above required; additional qualifications in relevant areas highly desired

Would you like to help our customers innovate like Amazon – and deliver breakthrough experiences for their end customers? Would you like to pioneer the use of cloud services to help drive innovation? Would you like to be part of building a fast-growing program to worldwide scale?

As a business development manager for Digital Innovation, you will have an exciting opportunity to lead customer engagements and shape and deliver the Digital Innovation program, working with other Americas BDMs, Americas sales leadership, and worldwide program leadership. Your primary responsibility will be to identify, develop, and lead engagements with Enterprise customers – engaging line of business and C-suite leaders, qualifying opportunities, leading innovation engagements inspired by Amazon mechanisms like Working Backwards, and driving executive engagement, resultant prototypes and scaled solutions. In addition, you will build and participate in mechanisms for tracking engagement impact for customers and for AWS, and use your experience to help improve our engagement model.

You must be comfortable working in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial enterprise technology sales environment, and working with cross functional teams as many parts of the program will have interdependencies with other teams within AWS. Typically, cross-functional collaboration includes sales leadership, industry business development teams, solutions architecture, marketing, partners, professional services, and sales enablement.

The right candidate will have experience delivering Digital Innovation engagements for enterprise customers. This includes demonstrated experience in identifying and developing customer-centric digital innovation opportunities, a proven track record of leading and driving multiple simultaneous projects to meet customer business objectives, excellent project management skills, a customer-obsessed and collaborative approach, strong data and metrics bias, a good understanding of cloud solutions, and a passion for helping customers drive business growth using cloud technologies.

Role & Responsibilities

Work with sales leadership to identify and qualify customers for the Digital Innovation program
Develop C-suite and line-of-business relationships with leading innovators within customer organizations
Deliver high quality engagements using Amazonian innovation mechanisms like Working Backwards to identify specific end-customer problems or opportunities and articulate in a press release
Facilitate Working Backwards workshops with customer executive groups
Lead and coordinate translation of those solutions into working cloud prototypes, working with relevant engineering and services teams, and partners where appropriate
Build value propositions/ business cases
Train & enable local sales teams to help qualify customers, and – in some cases – lead elements of the digital innovation engagement
Effectively track and articulate the value of engagements underway, and major wins
Share knowledge effectively across the WW team
Help develop and improve the Digital Innovation engagement model based on engagement experience
Work with the Partner team to identify, engage and enable partners who can accelerate our approach to digital innovation
Conduct customer briefings, present at customer events, further AWS solutions-led thought leadership in the innovation domain
7+ years of relevant work experience in enterprise markets. Breadth and depth in multiple industry markets and industry ecosystems
Strong business and financial acumen and negotiations skills
Deep knowledge of Amazon leadership principles and innovation mechanisms
Published thought leadership in digital transformation
Good working knowledge of AWS Services – especially higher level services that are the focus of customer innovation (AI/ML, IoT, etc.)
MBA or equivalent

This position must be located at one of our Northeast AWS corporate offices.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation/ Age.

At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar New York is on the lookout for a talented Physics Programmer who possess a passion for developing cutting-edge physics and collision systems, using them in creative and novel ways. This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar's studio in Manhattan.

WHAT WE DO
We iterate toward the perfect blend of realism and fun in how games feel to play by utilizing the core physics engine.
We implement a variety of physics-based systems including, but not limited to vehicle dynamics, water, destructible objects and rope.
We support the design, AI and gameplay teams to be able to use the physics systems in order to create novel new mission, AI and gameplay mechanics.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Support and collaborate with other departments such as design, animation & AI, to implement complex game features.
Help maintain existing vehicle systems and expand them to support new features throughout the lifetime of our projects.
Work with artists to create new interactive objects and vehicles for the game.
QUALIFICATIONS
Physics, mathematics, computer science or equivalent degree.
2+ years game programming experience.
Ability to work with artists, designers, coders and other content creators to make sure they can get the most out of our technology.
SKILLS
Demonstrable experience in C/C++.
Knowledge of rigid, multi body simulation and Newtonian mechanics.
Strong maths skills (linear algebra, trigonometry, matrix/quaternion math).
Strong multi-threaded programming skills.
Excellent problem-solving skills with an emphasis on debugging C++ code.
PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.

A video show reel or C++ code samples demonstrating your creativity and flair for gameplay programming, preferably with an emphasis on utilizing physics.
Knowledge of vehicle dynamics.
One shipped title; preferably on the Xbox and/or PlayStation consoles.
Familiarity with existing physics engines.
HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a resume and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race.

We are seeking a Gameplay Programmer to join our talented team, with team members based in New York City, Montréal (and some fully remote), working on our new action-RPG title.

As a Gameplay Programmer, you will work closely with our designers to develop an outstanding game experience through features such as melee combat, player mechanics, and enemy AI. You will be instrumental in delivering our gameplay vision. If you have a passion for gameplay mechanics, this role is for you!

Responsibilities

Develop gameplay and combat features using Unreal Engine 4
Develop tools used by designers to deliver our gameplay goals
Work with our gameplay team to maintain stability and performance
Participate in defining our game design

Qualifications

Minimum 3 years of professional experience of programming games
Strong modern C++ skills
Gameplay or AI programming experience
Good understanding of game design
Authorized to work in either the US or Canada

Bonus Points

Experience with Unreal Engine 4
Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
At least one shipped AAA game

Benefits

Competitive salary
Among Industry leaders in PTO and work life balance
Flexible Work-From-Home options
Comprehensive family health coverage

Ironclad is the #1 contract lifecycle management platform for innovative companies. Every company, in every country, in every industry runs on contracts, but managing these contracts slows companies down and costs them millions of dollars. L’Oréal, Staples, Mastercard, and other leading innovators use Ironclad to collaborate and negotiate on contracts, accelerate contracting while maintaining compliance, and turn contracts into critical carriers of operational business intelligence. It’s the only platform flexible enough to handle every type of contract workflow, whether a sales agreement, an HR agreement or a complex NDA.Ironclad’s innovation and work culture has been recognized by Forbes’ 50 Most Promising AI Companies in 2021, Fortune’s Best Small & Medium Workplaces 2021, Fast Company’s 2020 Best Workplaces for Innovators, Glassdoor’s best Machine Learning startup, Enterprise Tech 30 List, and is backed by leading investors like Accel, Y Combinator, Sequoia, and BOND. For more information, visit www.ironcladapp.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.The Recruiting Team @ IroncladWe work in a highly collaborative environment, and strive to foster a positive, inclusive culture. Recruiting top talent is one of Ironclad's highest priorities, and we are looking for a Recruiting Coordinator to help us deliver a top-notch candidate experience. At Ironclad,* Recruiting Coordinators* are strategic partners to Recruiting and the company at large. As an expert on all things candidate experience, systems, and process, you will be called on to partner across the company to help craft the best possible experience for candidates, interviewers, and hiring partners.Ironclad's values Intent, Empathy, Integrity, and Drive inform everything we do. As a Recruiting Coordinator, you will be an ambassador for our culture and values and will represent them in your interactions with candidates and teammates alike. If these values resonate with you, and you’d like to join us on our mission to build the product that legal teams love, let’s talk!What you'll be doing: Manage interview scheduling & logistics while maintaining a bird's-eye view of daily, weekly, and quarterly scheduling logistics landscapePartner with the Recruiting Team, hiring managers, and teams across Ironclad to provide an exceptional candidate experienceChampion operational excellence, always looking for ways to increase efficiency, improve processes, and help our recruiting process scale through systemsAnticipate & proactively work to solve problems and smooth out any logistical challengesSupport operational goals and programs on the Recruiting Team; we are looking for someone who is interested in digging in and exerting ownership on short & long-term projects in addition to day-to-day candidate scheduling and logistics work.What we are looking for: Administrative, project management, or coordination experience. Experience at a high-growth startup a plus.Excellent judgement & problem solving abilityOutstanding written and verbal communication skillsAble to balance multiple priorities while maintaining an excellent quality of workInterest in joining and contributing to a supportive and collaborative teamThrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment – looking for a high degree of ownershipExperience with and aptitude for learning business software (i.e. Google Apps, Applicant Tracking Systems or similar)Experience with heavy calendar management is a bonusPursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction recordsJob Type: Full-time
