Responsibilities for this Position:

GDMS has an immediate opening for a Rescue 21 Field Support Representative (FSR) to support U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) Sector Buffalo. The selected candidate will use a company-supplied vehicle to maintain Sector Buffalo Sector, Station, and Remote Fixed Facility (RFF) equipment as assigned.
Imagine building your career by developing the solutions that support the mission of our nation’s service members, intelligence analysts and first responders. That’s the challenge that’s waiting for you at General Dynamics Mission Systems. Here you have the opportunity to redefine innovation and excellence for the world. Are you ready? Then make a career move that makes an impact at General Dynamics Mission Systems.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.
Rescue 21 FSRs work from their home using GDMS supplied vehicles, tools, test equipment, and regional depot spares to provide preventive and corrective maintenance response for the Rescue 21 equipment within their assigned Area of Responsibility (AOR). The primary responsibility of this role is for the equipment and system support of the Rescue 21, Buffalo – East AOR. This AOR includes the Rescue 21 communication and direction-finding system equipment at sites along the shoreline from Buffalo, NY along Lakes Erie, Ontario, and the St. Lawrence Seaway. This FSR will provide emergency repair response coverage and total system preventive maintenance coverage which will regularly require 2 to 6 hours of driving for site access. The FSR must also be willing and able to travel up to 25% of the time outside of the normal AOR to support other GDMS FSR's throughout the continental U.S., Hawaii, USVI, Puerto Rico, and Guam. The successful candidate will have a detailed knowledge of electronic and electro-mechanical system interoperability and the ability to document failures and corrective action in accordance with established procedures and methods. This FSR will regularly act independently to perform preventative and corrective maintenance at assigned Rescue 21 customer sites.
As a Senior Advanced Field Support Representative, you will install and repair equipment, instruct customers in equipment operation, provide technical assistance and check equipment for malfunctions, conduct technical seminars and training for customer or company personnel, complete informal on-the-job training for other field service staff members and customers, and provide over-the-shoulder/refresher training to users in the field as required. We’ll rely on you to diagnose and repair mechanical, hardware, software, and systems failures using established procedures. You’ll be expected to interface with customers, military personnel, government dignitaries, external consultants/experts, and all levels of employees throughout GDMS, including executive management.
The selected candidate should be located within or willing to relocate to an area within a 45-mile radius of Batavia, NY. This area includes the metro areas of both Buffalo, NY and Rochester, NY.
What you’ll experience:
Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered
What you bring to the table:
Minimum of 25 weeks of military technical training school, along with an additional 6 years of related experience is required. OR, 2 years of directly related non-military technical trade school or the equivalent experience, along with an additional 6 years of related experience is required. Industry certifications are highly preferred; field service or technical activity is preferred. OR, Bachelor’s degree in a technical field or the equivalent experience, along with an additional 2 years of related experience is required. Industry certifications are highly preferred. Field service or technical activity is preferred.
Ability to travel within assigned AOR on a moment's notice as needed and up to 25% of the time outside of assigned AOR.
Exceptional communication skills
What sets you apart:
Creative thinking with the ability to multi-task
Commitment to ongoing professional development
Ability to work independently / self-motivated
Company Overview:

General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 12,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran
As a contractor to the Federal Government, General Dynamics Mission Systems must comply with the federal mandate requiring our workforce be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 by January 4, 2022, with only very limited exceptions for medical reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs.

About Enstoa:

Enstoa is a global thought and practice leader in the digital transformation of managing construction and facilities for health care, natural resources, real estate, and public infrastructure. According to the G20-backed Global Infrastructure Hub, the world needs $94 trillion spent on infrastructure by 2040. This demand with constraints like a labor crunch and increased regulatory requirements are creating massive challenges for company executives. These forces are inspiring many to take a fresh look at how the built environment is developed and operated.

Enstoa gets it and has achieved something rare. As the only company that focuses exclusively on accelerated digital transformation for the built environment, Enstoa introduces entirely new ways of working—ways that can eliminate time and cost from the process. Ways that empower the people who create and maintain the built environment to spend less time chasing down information and more time using it. Enstoa's success is based on use of multidisciplinary project teams which combine built-environment subject matter expertise together with expertise in organizational change, system implementation, integration, data modelling, data analysis and AI/ML.

Responsibilities:

You will help Enstoa win work by helping our teams develop new, distinctive and innovative approaches to proposals that clearly articulate how Enstoa creates value and impact for clients.
As a creative thought leader, you will raise the game on Enstoa's proposals. You'll work closely with colleagues to develop creative, persuasive, and effective proposal communication and experiences. You'll help teams develop and articulate clear, strong value propositions to show how Enstoa is truly different.
Although this role will require significant writing, information coordination is a key skill we're looking for. You will need to collaborate with multiple teams to get the information you need, establish detailed production schedules (especially for proposals), ensure the tone is appropriate for the document, and verify that formatting is consistent. Writing is just one activity that leads to the final product, and these other activities are just as important.
You will manage the end-to-end process of creating new proposals and corporate documents, as well as editing existing documents. The following are among the most important types of documents you'll author and edit, although there will be other types of documents that will require your skilled hand:
Proposals
Client case studies
Employee biographies
Corporate policies and procedures
You will need to balance the art of professional writing with the science of project management. This includes:
Before writing the document, identifying the scope of the document, the intended audience, and the tone we want to convey.
Collaborating across functions to gather the information needed to author or edit documents. Capture, shape, and synthesize information to reflect a cohesive message, written in one voice
Coordinate with external creative agencies that may be leveraged for content, design, or other assets
Writing with precision, succinctly, and with the appropriate amount of context given the intended audience.
Ensuring the written and visual tone of the document are aligned both with how we want to covey the information and represent Enstoa to ensure a consistent story is told from start to finish.
Verifying the formatting of the document is consistent and correct.
You will establish information management practices to ensure documents are accessible. This includes
Establishing a taxonomy of documents including, but not limited to, case studies, employee bios, SOW content library, standard agreements, and order forms
Ensuring documents are appropriately stored in our document library
Appropriate meta data is captured for documents
You will also manage proposal creation. Proposals often have many detailed requirements from the client and specific deadlines, and the management of proposal authoring requires the following activities in addition to the items described above:
You'll make Enstoa's proposals visionary and distinctive by advising on the best media, structure, style, messaging and content.
Reviewing Request for Proposals and extracting the requirements for a complete, compliant proposal
Establishing and managing the schedule and milestones for proposal production, including:
Identifying the activities and information required of other teams, assigning to them tasks with clear deadlines.
Scheduling and leading proposal production coordination meetings.
Engage with pursuit teams strategically, posing questions that encourage a team to consider all aspects of the client's position, and draw out essential messaging.
Write executive summaries that articulate our strategic messaging in a compelling and persuasive manner
Translate technical information and business jargon into clear, consistent, and grammatically correct content
Ensuring we establish—and communicate in the proposal—conditions and qualifications of our proposal. It's equally as important to communicate what is out of scope as it is to communicate what is in scope.
You'll assemble the proposal components and conduct final editing, and proofing to ensure high quality is always maintained.

Who you'll work with:

Enstoa works for clients around the globe. When we're preparing proposals to pursue new work, you'll partner with our delivery teams in North America, Europe, and the Middle East.

Experience:

3-6 years of experience in a business communications-related field

Qualifications:

Skilled strategic writer passionate about influencing business audiences
Demonstrated experience create compelling and crisp written content
Knowledge and experience of competitive proposal/bid processes ideally in a professional services context
Ability to absorb new information and concepts rapidly, and grapple with a wide range of complex business issues
Outstanding editing and persuasive writing skills
Strong critical reasoning and problem-solving skills
Excellent influencing and interpersonal skills
Good presence, credibility and confidence in working with senior colleagues
Empathy and ability to represent the client's perspective in a proposal situation
Flexibility and the ability to gracefully navigate ambiguity, deadline pressure and conflicting requests
Team orientation with a strong sense of commitment to team members and client impact
Sensitivity to and discretion in handling confidential information

Benefits and Perks:

At Enstoa, we strive to constantly improve our processes and work environment. We value collaboration, teamwork, and positive working relationships. We cultivate talent within our organization and we want your career to grow and thrive here! Some of the benefits and perks we offer include:

Generous PTO and Sick Leave Policy
Flexible Work Environment and Telecommuting Options
Opportunities for Training, Career Development, Continuing Education and Professional Certifications

JobTitle: Crypto Quant trader/ NFT Trader / Crypto Portfolio Manager
Content_text: To strengthen its team, a quantitative hedge-fund is looking for a senior crypto quantitative portfolio manager and NFT traders who will focus on further development and realization of the company's technology and product strategy.We offer you the opportunity to join at a acceleration phase potential for partner level compensation (equity and revenue share). This is your opportunity to rapidly grow, professionally and personally.Responsibilities:The main responsibility of the role will be to research, design and implement new quantitative trading strategies. This will entail generating alphas from a variety of traditional and alternative datasets using rigorous scientific methods. To be successful in this role, the ideal candidate will need to build a deep understanding of the underlying datasets and be able to apply the latest research in statistics, machine learning and AI. The candidate will use the team’s custom research infrastructure for simulation, back-testing, and validation of the proposed models.Qualifications:The ideal candidate will be excited about working in a collaborative team environment, with an emphasis on team performance. We also require the following:· MS/PhD in a technical discipline with a focus on Financial Mathematics, Statistics, Artificial Intelligence or related fields· 5+ years’ experience in quantitative investment research in Medium Frequency Equity Trading and/or Equity Markets is required· Excellent written and verbal communication skills to report research results/methodologies required· Research publications focused on equities trading, or articles in top-tier Journals focusing on any of the above topics is a plus· Strong programming skills with the ability to explore large datasets requiredJob Types: Full-time, Contract, CommissionSchedule:8 hour shiftSupplemental Pay:Bonus payCommission payWork Remotely:Yes

Pega Developer

Job Number: 3167544
POSTING DATE: Mar 1, 2021
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Development
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Vice President

DESCRIPTION
Firm-wide Business Process Management Community of Practice, part of Operations and Compliance Technology area, is looking for a Pega lead developer. The COE team provides BPM services and tools to the entire Firm and is responsible for all aspects of Pega platform support and common design and implementation standards. In addition to full end-to-end implementations the Community of Practice the development team provides internal consulting services to other technology teams across the Firm assisting them with their BPM Platform design and workflow implementations. The Workflow Orchestration area that houses the Community of Practice also has several development teams providing Pega transformation solutions supporting Operations.

Person selected for the role will act as a hands-on Delivery Manager working directly with business users to implement new and reengineer and automate existing processes. The person will play a role of a senior technologist on the team and may manage global teams on project or permanent basis.

The candidate needs to have experience with creating reusable components / assets / adapters, upgrading and maintaining the Pega shared platform, setting standards for Pega / BPM development. The position requires a strong and proven ability to collaborate with partners across the Firm, and track record of working with various on-shore and off-shore delivery partners.



Vice President
Experience: 10+
Responsibilities-Mandatory
1. Architecting and designing business applications using Pega and other Pega frameworks
2. Provide thought-leadership to client across business and technical project dimensions solving complex business requirements
3. Manage a team for deliveries, initiatives and architectural decisions
4. Accountable for ensuring the business and technical architecture of the delivered solution matches customer technical and functional requirements, and commits to Customer Success (realization of business benefit)
5. Participates in the development of additional consulting opportunities within the user base
6. Well experienced with design application and Infrastructure using various Application Servers, Databases, Security Managers etc.
7. Expertise on various integration technologies like SOAP, REST, MQ, TCP, HTTP
8. Strong understanding on Application Security
9. Well versed with SDLC, Agile, CD&CI methodologies
10. Ability to execute development of Re-usable Assets, Code Reviews and IT Governance for Pega Practice
11. Strong Project Management skills to execute and deliver projects.
12. Must have designed and developed atleast 5+ projects on Pega 7 or Pega 8
13. Knowledge and expertise on recent trends like Cloud, AI/ML, Microservices etc

QUALIFICATIONS
Qualifications
10+ years of IT experience with n-tier, database and client server design/development
6+ years of experience with Pega BPM (atleast as Lead System Architect role for 5+ projects)

Nice to have:Knowledge/Experience of: Microsoft d365, Microsoft Power Apps, other BPM platforms.

About Pagaya

Shape the Future of Finance

Pagaya is building a leading artificial intelligence network to help our partners grow their businesses and better serve their customers.

Pagaya powers a leading artificial intelligence network that enables banks, fintechs, merchants, lenders, and other B2C businesses to provide their customers with greater access to financial services. We help partners grow their customer base while managing risk, all with a seamless customer experience.

Pagaya’s network enables our partners’ customers access to credit across Auto, Credit Card, Personal loans, and Point of Sale markets. We are also developing products in insurance, real estate, and more. Our network is fully automated and operating at scale - with the support of the Pagaya network, our partners have processed millions of applications, with a new application typically analyzed every second.

Let's create better outcomes together!
About the Role

Pagaya works with leading consumer financing companies across multiple industries to extend credit by leveraging our powerful AI and technology. This role will support the Partnership Management team in reviewing, troubleshooting and resolving API based transactions with partners and using transaction data to help drive the growth of partnerships. This individual will be focused on timely and accurate issue identification, resolution and communication to partners with oversight from the Partner Manager.

Responsibilities

Debugging of API Responses: Real time support of requests related to Pagaya’s API response to inbound applications
Internal support enhancement: Be a part of consistent efforts to improve internal tools, and enhance API flexibility
Partner communication: Engage with senior team members to communicate with partners across various asset classes
Organizational Infrastructure: Consistent communication with development and research team members to understand the constantly evolving capabilities of Pagaya’s offering
Data analysis/reporting: Utilize institutional tools to present and analyze data (looker,logz.io,etc)

Requirements

3+ years of experience in trade support, transaction support or tech support, ideally in financial services
Highly organized with a proven ability to manage high urgency situations and multiple simultaneous tasks to successful completion
Experience troubleshooting technical issues and convert that into external communication
Expertise supporting the development processes, communication standards, tools and reporting
Proven ability to think analytically and strategically to assess problems and opportunities
Experience working with an external partners
Ability to understand complex issues, and communicate them in a simple, understandable way.
Strong ability to collaborate with global stakeholders across a cross-functional organization with particular focus on technology and product

Our Team

Pagaya was founded in 2016 by seasoned research, finance, and technology entrepreneurs, and we are now 500+ strong in New York, Los Angeles, and Tel Aviv.

We move fast and smart, identifying new opportunities and building end-to-end solutions from AI models and unique data sources. Every Pagaya team member is solving new and exciting challenges every day in a culture based on partnership, collaboration, and community.

Join a team of builders who are working every day to enable better outcomes for our partners and their customers.

Our Values

Our values are at the heart of everything we do. We believe great solutions are built through a great community.

Continuous Learning: It’s okay to not know something yet, but have the desire to grow and improve.
Win for all: We exist to make sure all participants in the system win, which in turn helps Pagaya win.
Debate and commit: Share openly, question respectfully, and once a decision is made, commit to it fully.
The Pagaya way: Break systems down to their most foundational element, and rebuild them unique to Pagaya.

More than just a job

We believe health, happiness, and productivity go hand-in-hand. That's why we're continually looking to enhance the ways we support you with benefits programs and perks that allow every Pagayan to do the best work of their life.

We are focused on building the world’s first Software-Defined, Input-to-Outcome platform by understanding documents, extracting structured and unstructured data, and automating business processes end-to-end - and we’re looking for amazing people to join us.
Machine Learning (ML) sits at the core of our efforts to automate the future work. We turn ML lab experiments into enterprise-ready AI solutions to solve complex machine perception and natural language understanding problems.
This is an opportunity to work on the full lifecycle of an AI solution - you will research cutting-edge techniques in Natural Language Processing, implement them in a fast-growth AI startup environment, and ensure thеy are integrated in a reliable and scalable way to bring real value to customers.
Responsibilities
Follow NLP research and apply it to create technologies for business automation
Own ML models end-to-end, from collecting training data to deploying in production
Lead the planning, design, and implementation of the ML projects
Serve as a mentor to junior team members and a standard-bearer for engineering best practice
Manage the collaboration and communications with project stakeholders
Qualifications
Minimum 3 years of industry experience in Machine Learning or related fields
Solid understanding of Math and CS fundamentals related to Machine Learning algorithms
Practical experience in modern NLP technologies (applying ML research to real-world projects)
Previous experience in leading multi-person projects and building end-to-end Machine Learning systems
Experience with one or more general purpose languages (Java, C/C++, Python, etc.)
Team player with strong communication skills
BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field

JobTitle: Moody’s Data Science Development Program– Full Time
Content_text:
Role/Responsibilities
Moody’s is searching for new graduates to join our Data Science Development Program. We’re looking for motivated, passionate, and leading individuals to join our teams- who are at the forefront of transforming data, using the most advanced technologies and techniques, to create impactful insights and innovative solutions for our clients and our communities.

The Moody’s Data Science Development Program is a 2 year development opportunity that affords recent graduates the opportunity to work at the intersection of finance and technology; gaining in-depth domain knowledge, applying their skills, and developing new techniques to help solve real-world industry problems. Participants will gain exposure to the different business’ at Moody’s and play a vital role in modeling, visualizing, and interpreting critical data to help us continue to use data and technology, together, to transform and create new standards for our industry. You’ll work with accomplished individuals, who share advanced degrees, certifications, and professional designations in fields such as data science, machine learning, AI, predictive analytics, mathematics, computer science, economics, and engineering.

How the program works:
The program consists of 2, 12-month assignments, which may be rotated throughout our San Francisco and/or New York, offices.
Participants will have the opportunity to interact with senior Data Science and Technology leaders and participate in various key Data Science initiatives. Assignments span across all of the Moody’s lines of business, providing program participants with a broad set of experiences and opportunities within our firm. Participants will engage in collaborative learning, have guided support from mentors, and be part of our cross-functional professional and social network; building a solid foundation to become future leaders of the company.
This full-time position as a Moody’s data scientist provides a competitive salary, long-term incentive awards, and on-the-job training with real-world projects in a variety of disciplines. To determine assignments, participants will work with a dedicated Program Director who will discuss individual preferences and interests. These preferences are taken into account when assignments are determined, along with the needs of our business.
Rotational assignments vary in terms of the technology skills required, and may include assignments in: Analytical Tools and Solutions, Emerging Technologies, Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) & Climate Risk, Business Intelligence, Enterprise Applications Systems, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, NLP, Data Science, and Data Engineering.
Qualifications
Completing a PhD or Masters Degree in Data Science, Data or Business Analytics, Operations Research, Applied Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or Computer Science (with a focus on machine learning or AI), or a related quantitative discipline by June 2022Understanding of Finance/Capital Markets a plusAchieved exceptional academic performanceRelevant experience (including projects and internships) demonstrating skills in research and analysis, and have experience analyzing large, complex, multi-dimensional datasets with a variety of tools.Have a deep understanding of data science applications, techniques, or deep learning frameworks such as: statistical and predictive modeling concepts, new machine-learning approaches, NLP, data mining techniques, and optimization algorithms and applicationsPrograming knowledge in one or more of the following: Python, R, SAS, SQL; preferred: AWS, Elasticsearch, GitHub, Docker or relatedUnderstanding of existing & emerging technologiesDemonstrated leadership aptitude, learning agility, and adaptabilityAbility to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize tasks accordingly

Working at Moody's
Moody's (NYSE: MCO) is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions. Our data, analytical solutions and insights help decision-makers identify opportunities and manage the risks of doing business with others. We believe that greater transparency, more informed decisions, and fair access to information open the door to shared progress. With over 11,000 employees in more than 40 countries, Moody's combines international presence with local expertise and over a century of experience in financial markets. Learn more at moodys.com.
Entity
Moody’s Analytics provides financial intelligence and analytical tools supporting our clients’ growth, efficiency and risk management objectives. The combination of our unparalleled expertise in risk, expansive information resources, and innovative application of technology, helps today’s business leaders confidently navigate an evolving marketplace.
MIS Culture of Excellence
At MIS, our workplace culture supports our mission to be the Agency of Choice for our customers, employees and future employees. Our Culture focuses on Excellence and embodies behavioral qualities such as Integrity, Responsiveness, Collaboration, Respect and Passion. Our people are our core asset and we look beyond outcomes to ensure that behaviors and interactions matter.
EEO Policy
Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender, age, religion, national origin, citizen status, marital status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody’s also provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with applicable laws. If you need to inquire about a reasonable accommodation, or need assistance with completing the application process, please email accommodations@moodys.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only, and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.


For San Francisco positions, qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. For New York City positions, qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment consistent with the requirements of the New York City Fair Chance Act. For all other applicants, qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment consistent with the requirements of applicable law.

JobTitle: Prototyping Engagement Manager, AWS Global Financial Service...
Content_text:
Bachelors, Masters or Ph.D. in Engineering, Computer Science or other relatable technical discipline

7+ years experience in software, hardware or integrated systems design and delivery

5+ years of proven experience in delivering highly complex, cross functional, multi-discipline technology or engineering programs

3+ years of demonstrable experience using modern Agile development and delivery methodologies, but also willing to be flexible in how these are applied in specific situations

Job summary
The AWS Global Financial Services Acceleration Team members are hands-on builders showcasing the art of the possible to the world's largest financial institutions.

Prototype Engagement Managers (PEM) collaborate with Prototyping Architects (PA) to qualify and deliver complex multi-week customer engagements - ensuring the quality bar stays high. The PEM also analyzes engagement metrics to help us see around corners and continually improve our ability to serve our customers.

Key job responsibilities

Proactively identify prototyping opportunities with customers, account teams and business development. Ideally, PEMs dive deep to understand the customer's business as well as their technical architecture to identify opportunities or gaps that require use of emerging services.
Establish the scope and define a working setup in collaboration with technical as well as business stakeholders of a prototype. This includes work on feasibility studies as well as driving the business aspect of a potential prototyping result. This also includes qualifying the engagement to ensure that the investment of an engagement is likely to return a positive business result in the long run for the customer and Amazon.
Execute prototyping engagements in collaboration with Prototyping Architects and the account teams. This execution phase as well as all other phases of prototyping include hands-on technical work with architecture teams, service teams and PAs to develop working, production-scale prototypes with customers. Hence, PEMs have to directly contribute to customer solutions and continuously learn capabilities of existing or new services.
Capture learnings as well as customer feedback from engagements and drive those learnings into the wider organization to improve services and products. PEMs also participate in awareness campaigns as well as spreading technical as well as procedural know-how derived from their engagements internally as well as other customers.
Working alongside Prototyping Engineers and Solutions Architecture leadership, support customers in the exploration, ideation, engineering and delivery of leading edge cloud based innovation across an extensive breadth of technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Big Data, Analytics, Internet of Things, computer vision and augmented/virtual reality
Qualify, execute and deliver strategic innovation and prototyping outcomes for a range of customers across a broad range of industries and verticals
Create, articulate, and position an innovative and compelling vision and value proposition such that customers realize the financial, technological and transformational value of innovating, prototyping and engineering on the AWS platform
Help customers structure their technical and organizational resources to ensure the maximum benefit can be derived from innovation, prototyping and the adoption of the AWS cloud
Develop extensive executive and senior technical relationships within client organizations; being viewed as a trusted advisor for innovation and cloud technology

A day in the life
PEMs identify opportunities for complex on-site engagements with customers and then execute them end-to-end in collaboration with all parts of the organization, particularly the PAs and SAs. The PEM shows aptitude in working with customer business stakeholders of all levels as well as their senior technical staff during the inception as well as the execution of a prototyping engagement without supervision or guidance. As such, the PEM plays a vital interfacing role between the customer and other parts of the organization such as service or marketing teams. Additionally, a PEM should participate in activities around sharing best practices, evangelism, generating technical content etc. to help scale the organization as a whole. This includes authoring presentations, demos, workshops for internal and external use.

About the team
The GFS Acceleration Team are senior and principal level solutions architects with 10+ years of software development and architecture experience. We dig into the hardest problems from globally significant financial institutions and show rather than tell how to solve them. However, we need someone with organizational and program management skills to take our game to the next level. In this role you'll be hands-on with projects using AWS analytics, AI/ML, security, and management and governance services. Oh yeah, and we have a lot of fun doing what we do!

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Hands-on experience with AWS

Experience working on software projects in the financial services industry

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Description
SHIFT: Day Job

SCHEDULE: Full-time
This position may be located near any Anthem office.
Responsible for directing foundational and strategic compliance responsibilities with consistent excellence that support the team and management.
Primary duties with expert skill level and tasks with the most advanced complexity and broad/enterprise scale may include, but are not limited to:
Directs projects, initiatives, regulatory sanctions, executive-sponsored initiatives, regulatory audits or exams, internal audits, accreditations, on-site reviews, risk assessments; audit planning, conducting mock audits, conducting audit training, managing audit evidence preparation, assessing audit preparedness.
Leads compliance monitoring to identify process gaps, validate compliance levels, map processes, draft corrective actions/remediation plans, oversee implementation of corrective actions, prepare reports/presentations.
Leads complex investigations and documents findings.
Develops strategic plans, makes recommendations to leadership; designs/implements annual compliance plan.
Develop strong relationships with key leaders to identify and address compliance risks and failures and manage action plans designed to fully mitigate risk(s).
This position will support the IT and Digital practices. Additional knowledge and skills related to:
Artificial Intelligence (AI)
Machine Learning (ML)
Data Science
Cloud Computing
Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Information Security
Qualifications
Minimum requirements:
Requires a BA/BS and minimum of 8 years health care, regulatory, ethics, compliance or privacy experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
Preferred qualifications:
Strong leadership/managerial skills and ability to motivate/coach other staff strongly preferred.
Ability to travel may be required.
MS/MBA/JD or professional designation preferred.
We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.

NYC-Remote is Possible*About the Role: *Are you a quality assurance practitioner with a passion for customer experience and an unrelenting desire to automate everything? Are you ready to join a high-performing startup team building the future of the deskless workforce and multi-modal voice assistants? If so... we can’t wait to have you join our team!RAIN is looking for a Senior Quality Assurance professional, with experience in software test automation, web application testing, and user interface testing. You will be the first hire in a high-performing QA team that will work in lockstep with product development to produce high-quality, performant, and consistently excellent software solutions for the deskless workforce.The ideal candidate is able to bootstrap a QA practice from the ground up, including software systems, processes, and practices. This candidate will be expected to grow into a leadership role as we build the team and will be a key contributor to the product development process and quality practice.*What You’ll Do: *Drive the creation and execution of test strategy, test plans, test cases as well as utilize automated tools to optimize the software testing life cycle.Develop and implement quality standards.Analyze product backlogs, create and execute test cases, document results, manage priorities, and maintain continuous communication with all stakeholders.Measure, interpret and report testing results, and be a vocal proponent for quality in every phase of the development process. Review user interfaces for conformity and functionality.Perform exploratory testing, automate repetitive tasks and work side by side with software development engineers to deliver high quality products.Efficiently execute test cases across all functional and UI areas of our products.Review requirements, specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback.Ensure overall product quality for all aspects of the product, including data, APIs, and web applications.Research and evaluate new testing technologies and tools.*What You’ll Bring: *7+ years of hands-on experience in web application quality assurance and automation.A solid understanding of a product’s lifecycle as well as how technical systems work and interact.Track record for being a stalwart advocate for quality.Strong analytical skills and attention to detail while staying focused on the big picture.Burning desire to inject quality into the software development process from concept through delivery.Able and willing to initially work at many levels, wearing many hats, while helping to bootstrap and grow the quality team.A solid understanding of test repository or defect tracking systems.Experience using and iterating on CI/CD workflows (Jenkins, CircleCI, Github).Experience in testing and test automation for consumer-facing applications and devices.Our office is located in NYC with remote team members across the country. Currently, we all are working remotely and will be flexible for the future.*Salary will be evaluated commensurate with experience and location*We are not able to provide sponsorship for this role.*Who We Are: *RAIN is a leader in Voice and Conversational AI. We help businesses navigate voice technology. We combine strategy, technology, and creativity to drive growth for our clients. We’re guided by the belief that technology is, by definition, an extension of humanity, and that great ideas come from a desire to enhance the lives of real people.At RAIN, we want to work with people of different backgrounds and walks of life. We want individuals who can bring diverse perspectives and experiences to our culture and company. We believe that transparency builds trust, so we default to disclosure in our communications. We believe in a safe, welcoming, and inclusive environment.Restless & Ready. These are the two attributes that mark the talent thriving at RAIN. We look for people who don’t fit the traditional mold, with skill sets you don’t often see in traditional consulting. Said differently, we’re always keen to add more unicorns to the stable. We look for people motivated by big ideas and determined enough to make it a reality.*What We Offer: *We genuinely care about our employees’ happiness and engagement.Comprehensive Benefits Package: Health, Dental, Vision, and Health Savings AccountGenerous Paid Time Off that increases with tenure and seniority.Mental Health/Wellness perks. Including 2 RAIN Check Days – for those days when you just need to take a rain check from work, we get it.Volunteer Days.401k plan with employer contribution.Short/Long Term Disability.Fully stocked kitchen (when in the office).Commuter subsidy (when in the office).Challenging problems to solve and an awesome team to collaborate with every single day.Work culture focused on innovation and creation of lasting value for our clients and employees.* Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes. *RAIN is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to fair and equitable hiring practices. All hiring decisions at RAIN are based on strategic business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications. All candidates are considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexuality, national origin, age, disability, genetics, or any other protected status.Job Type: Full-time

JobTitle: Senior Solutions Architect - Amazon Connect - Global Partner...
Content_text:
·

5+ years of experience as a contact center technology architect, enterprise IT Architect or senior contact center developer working with leading contact center technology platforms and applications, such as Amazon Connect, Avaya, Cisco, Genesys, Verint, NICE, Salesforce, etc.
Bachelors degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or similar fields; in lieu of degree, we will also consider additional work experience
2 years experience with AWS or another hyperscale provider
2 years experience in troubleshooting and debugging performance issues in telephony or networking

Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for a world class candidate for the role of Partner Solution Architect, Amazon Connect within our Global Systems Integrators (GSI) Channels & Alliances business function.

You will have experience working for a global systems integrator, a large IT consulting firm, or a Fortune 1000 company. By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with key accounts, you will be responsible for optimizing their Amazon Connect contact center and customer experience practices and service delivery on AWS. Amazon Connect is a Cloud Contact Center As A Service offering that was launched by Amazon approx. 4 years ago and has been met with strong customer sales success across all geographies and multiple vertical industry segments.

As an Connect Partner Solution Architect, you will help to build/increase Amazon Connect customer satisfaction, and related services’ revenue growth, through the technical engagement of our AWS Global SI partners. Your goal will be to ensure assigned partners’ ability to deploy Amazon Connect reliably, at scale, using AWS-preferred best-practice implementation methodologies based on your deep technical understanding of Amazon Connect.

You should have deep technical experience working with technologies related to Cloud Contact Center, CRM, ITSM, WFM/WFO and Analytics applications/services.

You should have communication skills and be very technical, with the immediate ability to establish domain expertise with AWS customers and partners at any level, from executive to developer. Previous experience with AWS is desired but not required, provided you have experience scripting, coding, and building contact center that run in virtualized environments. You will get the opportunity to work directly with senior developers and consultants at both top global and/or national consulting partners and Amazon Connect and related AI/ML and other service teams, and the Amazon Connect GSI team.

Key Responsibilities:

Provide architectural guidance and best practices to the partners and internal teams about Amazon Connect services.
Thought Leadership – Craft & develop compelling audience-specific messages and tools (product videos, customer success stories, demos, white-papers, presentations, how to guides etc.)
Present AWS services and technologies through forums such as AWS Blogs, White-papers, Reference architectures and Public-Speaking events such as AWS Summit and User-Group events.
Develop and nurture an AWS internal community of Contact Center related Subject Matter Experts along with partner capabilities
Collaborate with AWS business development, professional services, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and effectively use AWS services, esp. communicating and evangelizing new Amazon Connect service features and enhancements to assigned GSI partner practice teams
Serve as a key member of the partner business development team helping to ensure customer and partner success on the AWS platform. Act as a technical liaison between partners, service engineering teams and support.
Assist global system integrators and earn the trust of customers by delivering multi-day technical workshops, lead white boarding sessions, executing on Proof of Concepts, and contributing to the construction of performant, scalable, secure, and highly available AWS solutions

Position may be located in New York, Dallas, Chicago, or any other east coast / central AWS office. Relocation offered from within the US to any of these locations. Up to 30% travel (Post COVID-19 Travel Restrictions)

Work/Life Balance
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive and Diverse Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

·

AWS Certifications; AWS Solutions Architect Associate/Professional
Presentation and written communication skills to include high degree of comfort with technical and executive audiences and experience speaking publicly in front of large audiences
Experience working with Data Engineering and Data Science teams
Experience with software development with relevant experience and passion for getting hands dirty with code/scripting (e.g, python, java, c#, .NET, Node.js)
Experience building integrations across WFM, CRM, Unified Communications, and contact center solutions
Experience in Providing guidance on the people, organizational, security and compliance aspects of transforming the contact center to the Cloud

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Soho, New York | Claims Experience | Full-time

We’re looking for a highly motivated individual to join our Claims Experience Operations team. Do you approach everything you do with positive energy and a can-do attitude? Are you a natural self-starter who loves taking ownership of your work? If so, this one’s for you.

In this role, you will be responsible for all aspects of vendor payments; maintenance and updates to our home grown claim system; and other operational processes that ensure our Claims Experience team runs smoothly. You’ll also help with the production of critical internal management and regulatory reports, as well as collaborate with members from other functions such as Finance.

Requirements
1+ years of professional work experience in a dynamic environment
Solid Excel skills and experience using G-suite products required
SQL experience is a bonus
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Attention to detail, impeccable organization, and the ability to multitask
You’re an all-around team player and fast learner who loves to get shit done!
About Lemonade
Lemonade is a licensed insurance carrier offering renters, homeowners, car, pet, and life insurance insurance in the United States, contents and liability insurance in Germany and the Netherlands, and renters insurance in France. We’re powered by artificial intelligence and behavioral economics, and driven by social good.
A Certified B-Corp, Lemonade donates unused premiums to nonprofits selected by its community as part of our annual Giveback program. We incorporate our values into everything we do—from our business model to our office culture.

Role/Responsibilities
The Role / Responsibilities:

The Director – Customer Engagement & Innovation, will play a pivotal role within the Customer Experience
& Innovation team to establish Moody’s Analytics as the innovation partner of choice with customers.
