JobTitle: Executive Director, Access Center Client Services
Content_text:
Requisition no: 519398
Work type: Full Time
Location: Other NYC Locations
School/Department: Faculty Practice Organization
Grade: Grade 108
Categories: General Administration
Job Type: Officer of Administration
Regular/Temporary: Regular
Hours Per Week: 35

Position Summary

The Executive Director of the Access Center Client Services provides strategic leadership to assure the execution of an organizational consumer access service for the clients served within the access center. Under the supervision of the COO of ColumbiaDoctors, this role will assess, evaluate, and design strategies that proactively address improvement opportunities and transformation efforts needed in order to achieve the organization’s mission and vision, and strategy. As part of an enterprise collaboration with NYPresbyterian Hospital and Weill Cornell Medicine, the Executive Director will serve as a strategic partner and work to assure the strategy of the system-wide initiative aligns with the vision and provides operational excellence that assures efficient and effective consumer services. The Executive Director will coordinate and manage the operational functions of the Columbia Access Center spheres (NJ and Midtown locations) and provide leadership, direction, and support to the management team and the Access Specialists in each of the locations. This role will assure that the management team promotes staff development, will lead and direct the managers and administrative staff to ensure the safe, effective, and fiscally responsible operation of the center.

The Executive Director will work closely with the Director of the Contact Center Support Functions to assure that training curriculum and training needs, quality and business intelligence analytics and clinical content are consistent, and regularly reviewed and refreshed as needed. In addition, they will collaborate closely with the directors of the East campus and NYP access center spheres to align to principles, guidelines, and standards set by the governance structure.

In order to ensure the delivery of exceptional customer service to our patients, practices, and physicians they will develop and maintain regular meetings with the Clinical Chairs and Department Administrators to assure service levels are met and exceeded.

The ideal candidate will have experience in access center operations as well as customer service. They will be able to apply continuous improvement methodologies and strategies and have specific expertise in operational and/or system processes in call centers in order to deliver high customer service and timely access to care to patients. The Director will collaborate with the leadership in ColumbiaDoctors FPO and the clinical departments to support the execution of effective and high-quality service.

Responsibilities

Access Center Operations

Provides leadership and direction for the access center sphere in compliance with all local and enterprise policies and procedures
Oversees the evaluation and coordination of a System-wide process to improve patient access, including the development of policies and procedures to align, integrate and standardize referral programs, tele-fulfillment, contact centers, and find-a-doctor application strategies.
Ensures operations management team and staff implements solutions that improve customer service, increase technical expertise, enhance the quality of work, and increase efficiency. Ensures staff engagement, training, and that staff are well equipped to perform requisite job responsibilities.
Always maintains patient privacy and confidentiality according to HIPAA requirements, and successfully completes all required trainings.
Participates in establishing short and long-term goals for the expansion and optimization of the access center.
Reports to enterprise-level operations management leader on the performance of individual access centers at regular intervals.
Responsible for ensuring access center is meeting, and ideally exceeding service levels, and providing an excellent customer experience.
Provides supervision, leadership, and direction to Assistant Directors, Managers, and staff.
Conducts staff meetings to communicate issues or changes in policy/procedures, and maintains accessibility for one-to-one communication
Oversees escalated complaints or inquiries regarding the access center operations from customers.
Works collaboratively with account management team and physician practices to ensure access center performance and goals are met.
Serves on Boards and Committees. Represents Columbia at industry planning associations and related activities.
Responsible for departmental operating budget and managing within established guidelines
Performs all duties inherent to managerial/leadership role. Participates in recruitment/hiring, training/development, evaluation, and termination of assigned staff according to organizational policies and procedures.
Ability to set and meet deadlines, prioritize work and be able to work independently.
Responsible for evaluation, development, and implementation of processes to ensure KPIs are met and customer inquires are resolved or escalated appropriately in a timely manner.
Responsible for other duties as assigned

Strategy

Provides strategic leadership and operates as an expert on consumer access to Senior Leadership team in support of business goals and objectives for Enterprise
Understands customer segmentation and priorities.
Keeps abreast of changes and advancements in contact center models, technology, and the use of artificial intelligence.
Assures alignment with the overall strategy and vision for ColumbiaDoctors.
Assures alignment with digital strategy for self-service appointment bookings
Create dashboards or other reporting structures to keep Leadership informed of progress or status.
Proactively identify continuous improvement opportunities and lead the design and execution of mitigation actions

People

Develops a high-performing team and creates a continuous learning environment.
Manages resources as assigned.
Cultivates an outstanding relationship with providers and the clinical department’s leadership.
Acts as mentor and coach to more junior roles across the organization by representing the organizational strategy, mission, and vision.
Collaborates, and builds strong relationships with peers in FPO’s other business units (People & Organizational Development, Access & Patient Experience, Practice Operations, HIM, Quality & Patient Safety, and Revenue Cycle), EpicTogether and with clinical department leadership to develop new improvement opportunities and initiatives.
Constantly review, and if necessary, redefine access center and clinical departments’ roles and responsibilities to secure, in collaboration, high standards on patient experience and patient access

Compliance

Assures KPIs and service metrics are monitored and met.
Conducts assessment when metrics are not met and implements action plans to address.
Tracks and reports issues
Compliance with all federal, state, and city regulations and laws.

Financial

Manages to budget, projects and forecasts future needs
Review costs and chargeback models to identify cost efficiencies for the organization and clinical departments.

Minimum Qualifications

Master’s Degree in management/business administration, public health, or hospitality management
Minimum 10 years of related experience
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
Demonstrated ability to work accurately and efficiently in multiple systems.
Excellent interpersonal skills, written and verbal communication skills.
Effective in a fast-paced environment and demonstrates strong problem-solving skills.
Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner and ensure understanding of information by patients and customers is required.
The ability to perform tasks with accuracy and a minimal error rate is required.
The ability to work with minimal supervision is required.
Ability to work collaboratively with a culturally diverse staff and patient/family population, demonstrating tact and sensitivity, is required.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word & Excel) or similar software and an ability and willingness to learn new systems and programs are required.
Must successfully pass systems training requirements.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with customer relationship management tools
Experience with large-scale organizational change efforts

Other Requirements

Accountability & Self-Management

Advanced

Adaptability to Change & Learning Agility

Advanced

Communication

Advanced

Customer Service & Patient-Centered

Expert

Emotional Intelligence

Advanced

Problem Solving & Decision Making

Advanced

Productivity & Time Management

Expert

Teamwork & Collaboration

Advanced

Quality, Patient & Workplace Safety

Expert

Leadership Competencies

Business Acumen & Vision Driver

Advanced

Performance Management

Advanced

Innovation & Organizational Development

Advanced

Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran

Columbia University is committed to the hiring of qualified local residents.

Applications open: Oct 13 2021 Eastern Daylight Time
Applications close:

Are you seeking opportunities at the intersection of large-scale language technologies and responsible AI? Do you want to be a member of an interdisciplinary team of researchers, data & applied scientists, and software engineers? Do you embrace complex sociotechnical challenges? Microsoft Research is looking to hire a senior applied scientist for a new initiative on the fairness of large-scale language technologies, including large-scale language models such as Microsoft’s Turing models or OpenAI’s GPT-3. As a contributor to this initiative, you’ll conduct “deep dives” in partnership with Microsoft product teams who wish to be proactive and strategic about identifying, measuring, or mitigating potential fairness-related harms caused by large-scale language technologies (e.g, stereotyping, demeaning, or erasing groups of people). Successful candidates will have experience working with language technologies and will be passionate about prioritizing diversity, inclusion, and fairness.
We have locations in New York, NY; Redmond, WA; Montreal, QC; Cambridge, MA; and Cambridge, UK.
#Research
Responsibilities
You’ll be a member of an interdisciplinary team of world experts on the fairness of AI systems.
Your work will reflect the understanding that fairness a sociotechnical challenge.
You’ll collaborate with Microsoft product teams on identifying, measuring, or mitigating fairness-related harms caused by large-scale language technologies. You’ll work with them to develop and use methods that are appropriate for their systems, use cases, and deployment contexts.
You’ll package your work into practices and resources that other teams can use.
You’ll learn new skills and apply them as needed: You might be asked to learn about a new fairness measurement method from a research paper and implement it. Or you might be asked to prepare a case study and Jupyter notebook that walks practitioners through the process of mitigating fairness-related harms caused by large-scale language technologies.
You’ll work with stakeholders with a variety of backgrounds: some technical, some non-technical.
You’ll present your work to internal and external stakeholders, including Microsoft leadership.
Qualifications
Required qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, linguistics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
3+ years of experience working with language technologies. This can include product experience, industry research, open-source contributions, or academic research (but not coursework).
Experience putting responsible AI principles (e.g., fairness, transparency) into practice.
Familiarity with recent advances in natural language processing and machine learning.
Coding skills in a general-purpose coding language (e.g., Python, Java, Scala, C#, or C/C++).
Preferred qualifications:
Master’s degree or PhD in computer science, linguistics, or a related field.
Good communication (including writing) skills that demonstrate the ability to keep teammates and other stakeholders (e.g., product teams, leadership, customers, users) informed.
Experience working at the intersection of large-scale language technologies and fairness.
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks and transformer-based language models.
Experience working productively on an interdisciplinary team spanning multiple roles.
Experience working with stakeholders with a variety of technical and non-technical backgrounds.
Ability to learn independently in new domains, including by reading academic papers.
Ability to work independently and ramp-up quickly on complex and unfamiliar codebases.
Strong intellectual curiosity and passion for tackling real-world challenges.
Track record of prioritizing diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

NYC-Remote is PossibleAbout the Role: RAIN is a leader in Voice and Conversational AI. We are looking for a full-time Strategic Finance Manager who can create systems from the ground up and set the foundations for a successful Finance department by structuring processes and guide best practices. You will be responsible for financial tasks at RAIN, ensuring we use capital and resources efficiently and effectively.You will report to RAIN’s CEO, Nithya Thadani.Being a Strategic Finance Manager means to us that in this role, you will help the product team develop, track and deliver against operational goals, design and implement key cross-functional initiatives, and perform root cause analysis to diagnose challenges. You will manage multiple fundraising investments and the necessary due diligence. You will prepare analysis on forecasting, growth and churn strategy, demand generation, process improvement, capacity planning, all in partnership with product leadership.As the Strategic Finance Manager, you will have high visibility across the entire company and be a pivotal contributor to the design and management of financial processes while directly contributing to RAIN’s day-to-day operational success. The position is also responsible for assisting RAIN in other operational processes related to the product department.What You’ll Do: Own RAIN’s financial planning, modeling, and analysis and work with our leaders to automate processes and institute best practices.Monitor and report on RAIN’s budget, cash position, and monthly burn with analyses on key drivers and areas for improvement.Develop and maintain weekly, monthly, and quarterly revenue reporting and forecasting for the organization to provide accurate analysis and sales forecasting used for company financial planning; and identify significant changes and trends that will materially impact our growth trajectory.Help to architect the information flow and methodologies needed for dynamic business growth.Create a Robust FP&A process that will allow us to accurately estimate true costs of initiatives and directionally estimate ROI.Manage all investor activity and create and maintain a trackable database.Assist with developing and operationalizing GTM strategy.Assist in creating financial reports and presentations for the Board and external investors.Help to update and manage our compensation plans to fully align with business objectives.Support the business with critical decision-making as you build analytical models to monitor dynamic cash inflow and outflow.Work with the product team and CEO to grow revenue, improve margins, and size new market opportunities.What You’ll Bring: 5-7 years of proven experience in Finance, Revenue Operations, Sales Operations, or a related function with a demonstrated history of improving productivity by providing data-driven insights for strategic planning and sales enablement.3+ years of data analytics or business operations experience.Must have relative experience working in a high-growth company or startup.Experience managing fundraising investments.Bachelor’s degree; Advanced degree in finance, business, and/or marketing a plus.Proficiency in understanding all components of business financials and KPIs, operating models, interaction models, process, technology, people systems, and how to assess business opportunities.Have worked closely with a product team before and have implemented processes that improved how they build and ship products.Strong understanding of working with current and future cash positions.Ability to analyze complex sets of data and present it in an easy and digestible manner – identify actionable insights that drive results.Expert Excel/Google Sheets and modeling skills.Experience working with relational databases (e.g., SQL)Ability to drive successful end-to-end business results.Excellent communication and critical thinking skills.Robust business and financial acumen and innovation/change management skills.Strong influence skills and ability to identify, prioritize, and implement high-impact initiatives.Ability to learn systems and processes quickly and teach others as well.Knowledge of segmentation, statistical procedures, and financial analytic tools are a plus.Ability to thrive in an ambiguous, fast-moving, and continually evolving high-growth environment. You like building the plane while flying it!Your interpersonal skills are off the chart! You’re able to communicate well with internal customers and stakeholders, set appropriate expectations, and build relationships of trust with diverse teams even in remote settings.Our office is located in NYC with remote team members across the country. Currently, we all are working remotely and will be flexible for the future.*Salary will be evaluated commensurate with experience and location*We are not able to provide sponsorship for this role.*Who We Are: *RAIN is a leader in Voice and Conversational AI. We help businesses navigate voice technology. We combine strategy, technology, and creativity to drive growth for our clients. We’re guided by the belief that technology is, by definition, an extension of humanity, and that great ideas come from a desire to enhance the lives of real people.At RAIN, we want to work with people of different backgrounds and walks of life. We want individuals who can bring diverse perspectives and experiences to our culture and company. We believe that transparency builds trust, so we default to disclosure in our communications. We believe in a safe, welcoming, and inclusive environment.Restless & Ready. These are the two attributes that mark the talent thriving at RAIN. We look for people who don’t fit the traditional mold, with skill sets you don’t often see in traditional consulting. Said differently, we’re always keen to add more unicorns to the stable. We look for people motivated by big ideas and determined enough to make it a reality.What We Offer: We genuinely care about our employees’ happiness and engagement.Comprehensive Benefits Package: Health, Dental, Vision, and Health Savings AccountGenerous Paid Time Off that increases with tenure and seniority.Mental Health/Wellness perks. Including 2 RAIN Check Days – for those days when you just need to take a rain check from work, we get it.Volunteer Days.401k plan with employer contribution.Short/Long Term Disability.Fully stocked kitchen (when in the office).Commuter subsidy (when in the office).Challenging problems to solve and an awesome team to collaborate with every single day.Work culture focused on innovation and creation of lasting value for our clients and employees.* Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes. *RAIN is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to fair and equitable hiring practices. All hiring decisions at RAIN are based on strategic business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications. All candidates are considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexuality, national origin, age, disability, genetics, or any other protected status.Job Type: Full-time

Who we are:

Tractable accelerates accident & disaster recovery with artificial intelligence. Our proprietary AI analyzes photos of damage to people's cars and homes to get them back to normal faster after a road accident or natural disaster. Growing exponentially across 14 countries, we've processed $1B+ in auto accidents and accelerated recovery for over a million households, equipping 20+ of the global top 100 insurers

What will you do:

We are looking for a dynamic and entrepreneurial Desktop Motor Engineer / Vehicle Damage Assessor to join our team. We want people who want to build the next great company, and particularly those who fully understand the critical role technology is going to play in vehicle damage assessment in the coming years.

Responsibilities

Make fair and accurate appraisal decisions to train our AI in collaboration with our Product and Research teams
Establish & develop the required processes to help the AI learn
Use your expert input to make the AI more efficient and accurate
Train the AI on the latest repairing guidelines
Develop a comprehensive set of guidelines and training materials for the AI
Ensuring that your expertise and insights are shared effectively across the company and closely integrated with all of Tractable's product development
Help and support our US business development team to increase our presence in the North American market
Collaborate with new prospective customers to understand their standards in detail and help train the AI accordingly
Work in multiple projects at the same time

What will you need to succeed:

Extensive knowledge of vehicle repair techniques
Thorough understanding of automobile terminology and vehicle construction
Working experience of estimating systems is preferable
5+ years of experience of vehicle estimating (or three years if you have been a hands-on panel beater) ideally within an Insurance company
You will also need to be flexible and willing to learn new things every day. AI and Technology change every day and we want someone who is willing to learn on the go
Relevant automotive motor engineering qualifications a bonus (ATA VDA, IMI, etc)
This role is preferably based in our New York office


What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits
Equity stake in a fast-growing business
Participation in bringing AI to the real world
Opportunities to expand and grow through training and guiding mentors

Description:
Funnel is disrupting the entire leasing experience for renters and property management teams. We’re renter-centric: we believe all renters should have the most seamless, simple, and personalized journey to find their next home. We provide leasing, operations, and communication tools that are intuitive and obliterate repetitive tasks—driving more efficient leasing.
Funnel is in the process of transforming the real estate industry through cutting-edge technology built, sold, and supported by the most passionate people you’ll ever meet. We are looking for an equally ambitious product manager to join us.

This is an early-stage role with high impact and visibility that will require working closely with customers, engineering, design, marketing, and sales. We’re looking for a product manager who has experience with both defining the product strategy and driving execution. You will build the roadmap for both greenfield initiatives and collaborations across existing product teams. The right fit will have great attention to detail but balance it with the ability to ship and learn quickly.
What we expect in this role:
Your goal will be to apply new technology to the age-old real estate business. Utilizing machine learning and marketing automation, you will build tools that make the rental process better for landlords and consumers.
Develop a clear product roadmap based on market and user research — with the business cases and data to back it up.
Collaborate with engineers, designers, and stakeholders with deep real estate industry experience to launch products that our clients and consumers will love.
We are an early-stage. You must be willing to work on resolving the smallest bug one day and contribute to the strategy of the overall organization the next.
What we think you will need:
3+ years experience in product management or related field
Strong technical background, either from academic, engineering, or hands-on product development experience
Passion and excitement for helping consumers and understanding their needs
Strong written and verbal communication skills with a talent for the articulation of customer problems
Whatever-it-takes approach to ensure that your product and team are successful
You will really impress us if you have:
Mobile or payments experience
Previously worked in real estate or prop-tech
Familiarity with machine learning and AI
SQL familiarity and expertise with Periscope, Looker or a similar BI tool

We are:
The Accenture Products and Platforms (APP) group in Accenture Technology. APP operates a portfolio of product-mindset business units inside Accenture – each with a shared mission to codify industry and functional knowledge into valuable and differentiated software assets for sale to Accenture clients. APP teams overlay Pragmatic Institute methodology frameworks, and Agile methodologies to create value and deliver excellence. APP solutions accelerate time-to-value, ensure customer satisfaction, and drive productive, long-term client engagements. APP offers unique and rewarding opportunities and software career paths within Accenture for those interested in building world-class re-usable software that addresses the needs of the most sophisticated Global 2000 clients. In this position, you will be working within Accenture Products and Platforms (APP) for INTIENT – Accenture’s premier and most high-profile Industry cloud solution for Life Sciences and beyond. Accenture is committed to delivering on the promise of technology and human ingenuity, and INTIENT is the realization of this with capabilities that support improved efficiencies in drug development, and better experiences and outcomes for patients - improving the lives of millions of people. As an Product Manager you are a central player in this narrative and brand promise.
 You are:
A professional who develops and implements a product strategy, product roadmap and release plans. You conduct market research to develop a market-wide understanding of buyer/user problems and corresponding requirements. You provide thought leadership and sales support, differentiating our competitive position while ensuring ongoing alignment with the global market, the industry and foundation programs. You work with stakeholders to leverage tech and industry partnerships to provide leading edge software products. You enjoy partnering with Software Engineers and Data Scientists to bring contemporary cloud-based solutions to clients. You have experience in the Retail industry.
The work:
Drive market-relevant enhancements into the Intient software offering: identify and prioritize key enhancements which should be considered when deciding the features to be built for each release. Focus will be on functionality, enhancements to the User Experience and leverage of AI/ML models. Output will be Value Propositions related to these key enhancements, along with detailed requirements to be provided to functional leads.
Assist Sales Teams in Software Sales Engagements: support Sales Teams as they engage with potential customers in the sale of that software. Primary activity includes reviewing RFPs, providing key insight as to what exists in the software and to what degree it is flexible to meet a requirement. Where functionality is not available, assist in responses that provide some indication as to when such functionality might become available.
Manage Requirements backlog and help document epics & user stories, and other requirements with ongoing management of their relative prioritized ranking in the backlog.
Assist with Acceptance testing of features where applicable.
Deep-Dives with Clients/User Personas regarding our software solution and the top functionality topics that are being considered over the next 3+ releases.
Work with internal and external ecosystem players including Cloud providers, and internal Accenture experts in Cloud, Analytics and Life Sciences, to ensure solution meets the needs of the market and differentiates Accenture.
For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.
Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.

Here’s what you need:
At least 5 years of working in the Life Sciences Industry
At least 2 years of working experience in Product Management role
Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 8 years) work experience
Bonus points if:
A desire to be a continuous innovator
You are certified in the Pragmatic Marketing Framework
You have experience working in a Consulting or Services company
You have working experience on BI and Analytics systems
You have certifications on one or more of the major Cloud providers
What We Believe
We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.
Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here

If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at +91-XXXXXXXXXX, send us an email or speak with your recruiter.
Other Employment Statements
Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.
Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.
Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.
The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.

Who we are:

Tractable accelerates accident & disaster recovery with artificial intelligence. Our proprietary AI analyzes photos of damage to people's cars and homes to get them back to normal faster after a road accident or natural disaster. Growing exponentially across 14 countries, we've processed $1B+ in auto accidents and accelerated recovery for over a million households, equipping 20+ of the global top 100 insurers

What will you do:

We are looking for a dynamic and entrepreneurial Desktop Motor Engineer / Vehicle Damage Assessor to join our team. We want people who want to build the next great company, and particularly those who fully understand the critical role technology is going to play in vehicle damage assessment in the coming years.

Responsibilities

Make fair and accurate appraisal decisions to train our AI in collaboration with our Product and Research teams
Establish & develop the required processes to help the AI learn
Use your expert input to make the AI more efficient and accurate
Train the AI on the latest repairing guidelines
Develop a comprehensive set of guidelines and training materials for the AI
Ensuring that your expertise and insights are shared effectively across the company and closely integrated with all of Tractable's product development
Help and support our US business development team to increase our presence in the North American market
Collaborate with new prospective customers to understand their standards in detail and help train the AI accordingly
Work in multiple projects at the same time

What will you need to succeed:

Extensive knowledge of vehicle repair techniques
Thorough understanding of automobile terminology and vehicle construction
Working experience of estimating systems is preferable
5+ years of experience of vehicle estimating (or three years if you have been a hands-on panel beater) ideally within an Insurance company
You will also need to be flexible and willing to learn new things every day. AI and Technology change every day and we want someone who is willing to learn on the go
Relevant automotive motor engineering qualifications a bonus (ATA VDA, IMI, etc)
This role is preferably based in our New York office


What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits
Equity stake in a fast-growing business
Participation in bringing AI to the real world
Opportunities to expand and grow through training and guiding mentors

Description:
Funnel is disrupting the entire leasing experience for renters and property management teams. We’re renter-centric: we believe all renters should have the most seamless, simple, and personalized journey to find their next home. We provide leasing, operations, and communication tools that are intuitive and obliterate repetitive tasks—driving more efficient leasing.
Funnel is in the process of transforming the real estate industry through cutting-edge technology built, sold, and supported by the most passionate people you’ll ever meet. We are looking for an equally ambitious product manager to join us.

This is an early-stage role with high impact and visibility that will require working closely with customers, engineering, design, marketing, and sales. We’re looking for a product manager who has experience with both defining the product strategy and driving execution. You will build the roadmap for both greenfield initiatives and collaborations across existing product teams. The right fit will have great attention to detail but balance it with the ability to ship and learn quickly.
What we expect in this role:
Your goal will be to apply new technology to the age-old real estate business. Utilizing machine learning and marketing automation, you will build tools that make the rental process better for landlords and consumers.
Develop a clear product roadmap based on market and user research — with the business cases and data to back it up.
Collaborate with engineers, designers, and stakeholders with deep real estate industry experience to launch products that our clients and consumers will love.
We are an early-stage. You must be willing to work on resolving the smallest bug one day and contribute to the strategy of the overall organization the next.
What we think you will need:
3+ years experience in product management or related field
Strong technical background, either from academic, engineering, or hands-on product development experience
Passion and excitement for helping consumers and understanding their needs
Strong written and verbal communication skills with a talent for the articulation of customer problems
Whatever-it-takes approach to ensure that your product and team are successful
You will really impress us if you have:
Mobile or payments experience
Previously worked in real estate or prop-tech
Familiarity with machine learning and AI
SQL familiarity and expertise with Periscope, Looker or a similar BI tool

We are:
The Accenture Products and Platforms (APP) group in Accenture Technology. APP operates a portfolio of product-mindset business units inside Accenture – each with a shared mission to codify industry and functional knowledge into valuable and differentiated software assets for sale to Accenture clients. APP teams overlay Pragmatic Institute methodology frameworks, and Agile methodologies to create value and deliver excellence. APP solutions accelerate time-to-value, ensure customer satisfaction, and drive productive, long-term client engagements. APP offers unique and rewarding opportunities and software career paths within Accenture for those interested in building world-class re-usable software that addresses the needs of the most sophisticated Global 2000 clients. In this position, you will be working within Accenture Products and Platforms (APP) for INTIENT – Accenture’s premier and most high-profile Industry cloud solution for Life Sciences and beyond. Accenture is committed to delivering on the promise of technology and human ingenuity, and INTIENT is the realization of this with capabilities that support improved efficiencies in drug development, and better experiences and outcomes for patients - improving the lives of millions of people. As an Product Manager you are a central player in this narrative and brand promise.
 You are:
A professional who develops and implements a product strategy, product roadmap and release plans. You conduct market research to develop a market-wide understanding of buyer/user problems and corresponding requirements. You provide thought leadership and sales support, differentiating our competitive position while ensuring ongoing alignment with the global market, the industry and foundation programs. You work with stakeholders to leverage tech and industry partnerships to provide leading edge software products. You enjoy partnering with Software Engineers and Data Scientists to bring contemporary cloud-based solutions to clients. You have experience in the Retail industry.
The work:
Drive market-relevant enhancements into the Intient software offering: identify and prioritize key enhancements which should be considered when deciding the features to be built for each release. Focus will be on functionality, enhancements to the User Experience and leverage of AI/ML models. Output will be Value Propositions related to these key enhancements, along with detailed requirements to be provided to functional leads.
Assist Sales Teams in Software Sales Engagements: support Sales Teams as they engage with potential customers in the sale of that software. Primary activity includes reviewing RFPs, providing key insight as to what exists in the software and to what degree it is flexible to meet a requirement. Where functionality is not available, assist in responses that provide some indication as to when such functionality might become available.
Manage Requirements backlog and help document epics & user stories, and other requirements with ongoing management of their relative prioritized ranking in the backlog.
Assist with Acceptance testing of features where applicable.
Deep-Dives with Clients/User Personas regarding our software solution and the top functionality topics that are being considered over the next 3+ releases.
Work with internal and external ecosystem players including Cloud providers, and internal Accenture experts in Cloud, Analytics and Life Sciences, to ensure solution meets the needs of the market and differentiates Accenture.
For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.
Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.

Here’s what you need:
At least 5 years of working in the Life Sciences Industry
At least 2 years of working experience in Product Management role
Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 8 years) work experience
Bonus points if:
A desire to be a continuous innovator
You are certified in the Pragmatic Marketing Framework
You have experience working in a Consulting or Services company
You have working experience on BI and Analytics systems
You have certifications on one or more of the major Cloud providers
What We Believe
We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.
Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here

CompanyLocation: New York, NY 10041 (Financial District area)+3 locations
Content_text:
The Team: The Data Science/AI/ML team is a newly formed innovation and deployment team within S&P Global Ratings that will be responsible for building and executing a bold vision around using Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, knowledge engineering, and human computer interfaces for augmenting various business processes.
The Impact: This role will have a significant impact on the success of our data science, AI, and Machine Learning projects ranging from choosing which projects should be undertaken, to delivering highest quality solution, ultimately enabling our business processes and products with AI and Machine Learning solutions.
What’s in it for you: This is a high visibility role with an opportunity to make a very meaningful impact on the future direction of the company. You will work with senior leaders in the organization to define, build, and transform our business.
Responsibilities: As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will serve as a resident expert and lead strategic projects, be responsible for building AI/ML and data-science-based solution design and scalable and sustainable implementations, while providing mentorship and guidance to machine learning engineers. You will need to work closely with internal stakeholders and users, and identify opportunities that lead to business impact and ultimately drive the Data Science, AI, and Machine Learning vision.
Qualifications: BS (or higher) in Computer Science, engineering, mathematics or related discipline or 7+ years of relevant professional experience in Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence with a solid foundation in software engineering, excellent design principles, best-in-class code habits, and experience working on advanced models. You will have experience in project leadership and defining strategic direction in engineering activities that maximize successful outcomes.

Experience working with business stakeholders and users, providing research direction and solution design and writing robust maintainable architectures and APIs.
At least 3 years of experience designing/building data-intensive solutions using distributed computing.
Experience developing/deploying ML solutions in a public cloud (AWS/Azure/Google Cloud) platforms
Proficient programming skills at a high-level language (e.g. Java, Scala, Python, C/C++, Perl, R)
Solid knowledge of at least one machine learning research frameworks
Project-based experience with some of the following tools:

o Applied machine learning (e.g. libSVM, Shogun, Scikit-learn or similar)
o Statistical data analysis and experimental design (e.g., using R, Matlab, iPython, etc.)
o Information retrieval and search engines, e.g. Solr/Lucene
o Distributed computing platforms, such as Hadoop (Hive, HBase, Pig), Spark, GraphLab
o Databases (traditional and noSQL)

Ability to quickly, efficiently, and effectively define and prototype solutions with continual iteration within aggressive product deadlines.
Demonstrate strong communication and documentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.

Preferred Qualifications: You are a Software Engineer with Data Science experience or a Data Scientist with Software Engineering experience. You have deployed advanced models in production environments. You have created models that drive performance in complex situations and have helped to define and implement best practices and standards. You are comfortable collaborating with and educating other Machine Learning Engineers on the team.

Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only):
S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $82,600 - $230,200 . Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location.
In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive bonus/a sales commission plan.
This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires .

JobTitle: Solution Consulting Product Specialist, Acorn AI
Content_text:
Dassault Systèmes (DS), with 35 years of experience transforming the way products are designed, produced and supported has combined with Medidata, developers of the world’s most-used platform for clinical development, commercial and real world data. Our Life Sciences sales and marketing teams bring together all of Dassault Systèmes Life Sciences capabilities in one go-to-market organization, providing our clients with Life Sciences domain focus and expertise to accelerate their business. As one organization we are leading the transformation in Life Sciences. Unique in the industry, we provide our clients with an integrated business and scientific platform from discovery and preclinical development, through clinical trials, all the way to manufacturing and commercialization. Discover the future of Life Sciences: Life Sciences & Healthcare Industry Solutions
We know that diverse teams win and are fully committed to selecting leaders and employees that represent the markets in which we operate. Dassault Systèmes Life Sciences & Healthcare, led by Medidata co-founder Tarek Sherif, has global operations and employees in the US, Europe and Asia.
Your Mission
Work as a member of the Medidata pre-sales organization as a subject matter expert for our Acorn AI offering. As a pre-sales Acorn AI Product Specialist you will work collaboratively with the Sales Organization in developing client strategies and preparing and delivering presentations leading to adoption of the Medidata platform. The Acorn AI Product Specialist will serve as a trusted advisor and will be required to have the executive presence and ability to communicate effectively to all levels within any Life Science organization.
Maintain an expert level understanding of all of the capabilities in our Acorn AI offering including but not limited to detailed product functionality, underlying technology, client usage, service delivery, product roadmap and competitive landscape
Support Acorn AI customer engagements in collaboration with other Solution Consultants across multiple sales theaters
Develop and distribute product messaging and collateral for use by the Solution Consulting Team
Develop standardized templates for value messaging, business cases to use for Acorn AI partner proposals
Provide solution assurance to proposals from a product perspective
Execute Client discovery sessions and synthesize outcome based presentations
Work closely with Product Development on client feedback, prioritization and roadmap of new functionality
Work closely with Professional Services to understand and articulate client adoption scenarios and paths and aid in the scoping of engagements
Work closely with Partner Team to help define delivery and adoption scenarios involving direct to Partner or Sponsor/Partner engagements
Assist with completion of application and/or technical RFI/RFP responses
Competencies and Experience
Deep understanding of how data & analytics can be used to solve both scientific and operational problems in clinical trials
Expert level knowledge of the Life Sciences industry focused on electronic data collection and clinical data analytics technologies
Comprehensive knowledge of existing landscape of Life Science technologies, software and service providers
Understanding of system validation within the context of data-based processing and AI based analytics
Extensive knowledge of data science concepts and core operational tasks including data wrangling, modelling, visualisation, pre-processing, learning techniques, parameter specification, validation, bias, mathematical and statistical concepts
Knowledge of clinical data standards including those specified by CDISC
Experience working with data scientists and data science teams
Experience in working with and presenting to customers
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills
Strong client discovery, analytical and technical skills
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Self-motivating, able to assume responsibility and work autonomously in a professional manner
Preferred Education
Bachelor's degree required in the Life Sciences, Business or Computer Science preferred; or equivalent years of experience

JobTitle: newSolution Sales Director-Smart Buildings (New York City, NY A...
Content_text:
Solution Sales Director-Smart Buildings (New York City, NY Area) - WD30131900335
What you will do
The Solutions Sales Director position is part of our Building Technology & Solutions business with Johnson Controls.
Our digital technology business is growing at a very fast pace. Our teams are outcome-based sellers developing our Open Blue solutions that link building, Information Technology/Business Systems and Specialty systems into a single converged network to achieve our customers’ desired business outcomes. Our digital solutions will reduce our customers’ capital and operating costs and improve the functionality of the building by providing an intelligent communications network to exchange data, automate actions and provide critical information required to optimize systems and people performance throughout the life cycle of the building.
The digital solutions team provides the missing “technology solution” piece and supports the local market’s channel efforts to identify, propose, sell and deliver new construction; prime retrofit and technology refresh scopes of work. We help sales deliver Internet of Things (IoT) outcomes through systems integration, design-assist, and converged technology solutions, producing smarter buildings.
How you will do it
Under general direction, you will conduct solution based sales of advanced solutions, to strategic major accounts You will work with account managers and selling teams in key verticals to identify, qualify, and close opportunities. Knowledge in software as a service sales, cloud -based products, enterprise software analytics, and use of advanced data analytics/AI. Skills required for the role include consultative selling at the executive level, differentiating offerings from competitors, and understanding complex sales processes. Drives pipeline growth and maturation. Educates the field resources and directly sells solutions. Responsible to use evaluation criteria account opportunities to improve efficiency and hit rates. Provides input & feedback into future offering development & refinement. Identifies tangible outcomes through use cases to improve value proposition (i.e. savings achievement from previous wins, customer ROI) for target verticals. Works with the Advanced Solutions Digital development team to drive customer satisfaction and future offering refinement.
Responsibilities
Directly responsible for exceeding sales plans on a monthly, quarterly, and yearly basis for Advanced Solutions Digital offerings.
Provides accurate and timely monthly forecast and tracked using approved systems.
Develops and presents your monthly business review of KPIs for your assign areas of responsibility.
Teams with local market sales teams to uncover customer needs, provide additional value, and align Advanced Solutions offerings to pain points for assigned accounts. Actively looks for enhancement, upgrade and white-space opportunities to improve sales and account wallet share.
Responsible for providing business and technical expertise to qualify opportunities and position Advanced Solutions Digital offerings with our customers. Comfortable working with and understanding needs of multiple departments and levels within the customer’s organization.
Participates in strategic account reviews for your assigned areas and channels to pinpoint solution opportunities.
Position may expand to include maintaining a working knowledge of industry trends in Data Science, Data Analytics, IoT, Enterprise Software Integration, and Software as a Service business models.
Brings Digital Solutions subject matter experts into opportunities, as necessary, to demonstrate solution with customers.
Provides input & feedback into current and future advanced solutions offering development & refinement, including voice of customer and voice of BSNA organization. Identification of new solution for unmet customer needs by working with BWSI Ecosystem Team and partners to fulfill customer requirements when our Global Products team is not able to address defined needs
Actively participates in industry professional groups and speaking engagements.

Qualifications
What we look for
Bachelor’s degree, Master’s preferred.
Prefer 10 years plus of demonstrated success in enterprise B2B software sales, data analytics, IT or other technology solutions sales..
Demonstrated consultative selling skills and ability to connect innovative solutions to customer needs.
Strong business acumen demonstrated, including business case development, strong rhetorical skills, natural teaming and collaboration skills, achievement oriented and highly savvy in technology and digital information.
Candidate should be adaptive, agile and demonstrate curiosity and willingness to learn.
Experience working in a large corporation , matrixed organization.
Willing to travel as needed within the US
Where legally permissible, if hired, candidate is required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 no later than his/her start date, unless candidate has a valid medical condition or sincerely held religious belief precluding he/she from receiving the vaccine.
Who we are
Johnson Controls International plc. is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, genetic information, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information, please view EEO is the Law. If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please visit www.johnsoncontrols.com/careers.

Job Sales & Marketing
Primary LocationUS-NY-New York
Organization Bldg Technologies & Solutions

Founded in 2015, Bowery Farming is on a mission to democratize access to high-quality, local, safe and sustainable produce. Bowery builds smart indoor farms near cities, growing fresher, pesticide-free Protected Produce with bold flavor in precisely controlled environments, 365 days a year. At the heart of each farm is the proprietary BoweryOS, which integrates software, hardware, sensors, AI, computer vision systems, machine learning models and robotics to orchestrate and automate the entirety of its operations. As a result, each farm creates far less waste and uses a fraction of the water and land compared to traditional agriculture.About The Role: It’s an exciting time to join Bowery! We’re searching for a VP of Strategy to lead a small team and identify a wide range of strategic opportunities to fuel our growth and expansion. Reporting directly to our Founder & CEO and working closely with our Exec Leadership Team, you will lead a team to:Explore and evaluate a wide range of strategic opportunities, partnerships, and expansion opportunities, then prioritize areas based on resourcing, relative impact, and importance*Within strategic areas, your team will explore various possibilities and ultimately recommend the best path(s) to achieve the desired outcome*Finally, once priorities are set and options selected, you will play a critical role in the setup and handoff for execution, including participating in negotiations, helping to set up an initial roadmap and resourcing needs, etc.What You’ll Do: Collaborate with senior management to evaluate & prioritize strategic opportunities and build effective short and long term plans.Play a critical role in building Bowery’s external partnerships from discovery to negotiation through to effective implementation.Analyze the success of & identify opportunities for both current and new products and initiatives (i.e.SWOT).Work cross-functionally to develop new business opportunities by leveraging existing relationships and also pursuing new partnerships.Who You Are: Able to formulate and articulate strong, data-based opinions based on research, experience, and exploration, but also able to flex and adjust as new or different information surfacesVery strong in both quantitative and qualitative analysisCapable of diving into a new business, learning, and building expertise and credibility quicklyExperienced in strategic planning, business management, and financial decision-making / P&L managementWilling to challenge the standard thinking with new ideas, new approaches, and new solutionsYou have exceptional creativity and problem-solving skillsComfortable with public speaking and communicating both verbally and in writing.Ability to multitask with research projects, data analysis & coordination with the executive team and cross-functional peersStrong decision-making skills and the determination to see projects through to the endDemonstrated skills in leadership, management, and collaborationSelf-directed and able to work independentlyExperience hiring, training, mentoring, and managing a teamWho We Are: Bowery is a place where everyone is welcome, included and empowered to reach their full potentialWe live our shared values every day in both big and small ways: opt-in, think wildly different, break barriers together & be kind to the coreWe are a mission-driven team of unconventional thinkers, problem-solvers, optimists and activatorsWe share a passion for giving back more to the planet than we take, growing deliciously abundant food without abundant harmWe are excited to hear from you!Based in New York City, Bowery is the largest vertical farming company in the United States, serving major e-commerce platforms and more than 850 grocery stores in the Northeast and Mid-Atlantic regions, including Albertsons Companies (Safeway and Acme), Amazon Fresh, Giant Food, Walmart, Weis, Whole Foods Market, and specialty grocers, with produce that's harvested year-round at peak freshness, delivered within days of harvest. Bowery has raised $472 million from leading investors, including Fidelity Management & Research Company LLC, Temasek, GV (formerly Google Ventures), General Catalyst, GGV Capital, First Round Capital, and individuals including Henry Kravis, Jeff Wilke, as well as some of the foremost thought leaders in food, including Tom Colicchio, José Andrés and David Barber of Blue Hill. For more information on Bowery and its products, please visit www.BoweryFarming.comPress kit: https://boweryfarming.com/press/We celebrate unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures that enrich the workplace. Join us in creating an inclusive work environment that is free of bias and discrimination, where everyone can be their authentic self. We strongly encourage people from all walks of life and underrepresented backgrounds to apply and join the Bowery Farming team. We are an equal opportunity employer.Job Type: Full-time

JobTitle: Telco, Media & Entertainment - AI and Data Transformation Ma...
Content_text:
Telco, Media & Entertainment - AI and Data Transformation Manager

Our Telecommunications, Media and Technology (TMT) industry clients include some of the most valued companies in the U.S. and many of the world's top global brands. We are poised to help clients shape their evolving business models, scale and transform their operations, modernize their processes and technologies, and constantly improve their customer experience. Our Telecommunications, Media & Entertainment sector includes the world leaders in telecommunications, media, entertainment, sports, business information services, and digital platform companies - for search, social, marketing, analytics, etc.

The team
Analytics & Cognitive
In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.

The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting enterprise programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets.

The Analytics & Cognitive team works with our clients to:

Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance and the integration of structured and unstructured data to generate insights leveraging cloud-based as well as client-owned platforms
Deploy automation and cognitive and science-based techniques to manage data, predict scenarios and prescribe actions
Drive operational efficiency by maintaining their data ecosystems, sourcing analytics expertise and providing As-a-Service offerings for continuous insights and improvements

Work you'll do
At Deloitte you will manage and deliver components of client engagements that identify, design, and implement technology and creative business solutions for large companies. Key responsibilities will include:

Architect, Position, Design, Develop and Deploy enterprise solutions which include components across the Artificial Intelligence spectrum such as Chatbots, Virtual Assistants, Machine Learning, and Cognitive Services
Manage teams in the identification of business requirements, functional design, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures.
Formulate planning, budgeting, forecasting and reporting strategies.
Manage full life cycle implementations.
Develop statements of work and/or client proposals.
Identify business opportunities to increase usability and profitability of information architecture.
Experience with program leadership, governance and change enablement.
Develop and manage vendor relationships.
Lead workshops for client education.
Manage resources and budget on client projects.
Assist and drive the team by providing oversight.
As a Manager, you will lead and deliver small or components of large, complex client engagements that identify, design, and implement creative business and technology solutions for large companies.

Manager level responsibilities include:

providing service excellence by identifying key client business issues, determining client needs by supplementing the standard assessment techniques and tools with innovative approaches, evaluating and validating analysis and developing recommendations for the client in the context of the overall engagement.
You will be expected to implement and oversee the quality of deliverables and effectively manage the team and day-to-day relationships to ensure exceptional performance. Managers participate in the development and presentation of proposals for business development activities.

Qualifications:

6+ years of experience working directly with, or serving clients in, Telecommunications including service providers, carriers, networks and broadcasters, infrastructure and equipment manufacturers. Or Media including internet, film/movies, electronic games, music, newspapers, publications, radio, television. Or Entertainment including professional and semi-professional sports clubs, leagues, and major sporting events and companies that produce or organize and promote live events. Industry experience is a must.
6+ years of relevant work experience within consulting or acting as an internal consultant serving within industry.
6+ years of experience delivering AI and data transformation projects
6+ years of experience with data modernization and transformation using cloud-enabled platforms
Expertise in defining AI and Data strategy
Experience architecting, designing, developing and deploying enterprise solutions, based on client or business vision, which include components across the Artificial Intelligence spectrum such as Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning and Data Science
4+ years of experience leading and managing project teams
Ability to travel up to 50% (While 50% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)
Immigration: Limited sponsorship may be available

Preferred:

Strong experience running pursuits
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a concise and actionable manner
Ability to work independently, manage small engagements or parts of large engagements.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint) (US Practitioners)
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment

JobTitle: Associate Partner, Supply Chain Transformation and Operation...
Content_text:
Introduction
As an Associate Partner, you will support IBM’s consistent growth by pairing your operational domain knowledge with your business development, sales, account management, and delivery skills. Picture yourself collaborating with a highly motivated, highly successful team with a proven sales record in IBM and partner’s technologies, both established and emerging. If you are ready to transform the operations of our largest clients through process transformation, organizational design and system integration, we are ready to offer you a best in class career

Your Role and Responsibilities
For this role, you should have end-to-end understanding of all, and in-depth multi-project knowledge and experience with at least some of the following supply chain processes:
Demand Planning
Supply Planning
Distribution Planning
Sales & Operations Planning/Integrated Business Planning,
Inventory Optimization
Sourcing & Direct Procurement
Production Planning and Scheduling
Product Lifecycle Management
Warehousing & Logistics
Supply Chain Network design
Additionally, you should have a working knowledge of supply chain adjacent functions such as Business Forecasting and Planning, Order Management, Indirect Sourcing and Procurement, Inventory Control and Material Management, Accounts Payable/Accounts Receivable and other operations, reflecting how they interact with each the Supply Chain and each other, key performance metrics, and how each function contributes to overall company performance.


Projects may range from detailed advisory for improving a single supply chain process, such as S&OP, to broad Operations Strategy projects focused on new operating models in support of digital transformation, new business strategies or new business models. Projects encompass business process, technology, skills development, network design, organizational design and performance metrics. In all cases, an ability to connect-the-dots and develop and deliver transformation plans and business cases will be critical.

This is not an ERP implementation role but may involve making the business justification for or defining the to-be operating model resulting from implementing SAP, Oracle or Microsoft Dynamics. Understanding of how ERPs influence each of the business functions is critical, but knowledge of any specific ERP is not.

Associate Partners are expected to contribute to the growth of intellectual capital within their practice area and to support the development of other consultants through participation in mentoring or coaching activities. They are expected to establish trusted long-term relationships with clients through engagement activities. They must also develop strong and trusted relationships with Project Managers and other team members on complex services engagements across service lines including ERP Implementation, Cloud Strategy and Migration, Application Management and Business Process Outsourcing.

This position requires the skills needed to develop value propositions and client provocations leading to the development of innovative client engagements, teaming with our experts in industry verticals and exponential technologies. Associate Partners are expected to identify new business opportunities at both established and emerging clients and to help win that business for IBM. Must be familiar with typical contractual requirements and be capable of drafting and reviewing responses to Requests for Information (RFI), responses to Requests for Proposal (RFP), IBM contracts, and IBM statements of work.

This position is required to be client-facing, with the primary requirement to drive pipeline expansion and delivery of large transformational plays in the supply chain and operations areas spanning across strategy, process, AI and analytics and supply chain solutions. The candidate is expected to support bid and proposal activities and participate in related Sector, Solution Area, or Community activities. As a delivery executive / subject matter expert, the candidate is expected to drive client billable engagements.

Global knowledge-sharing and management is key to IBM’s success. Individuals will participate in, and/or be responsible for the creation, harvesting, protection and reuse of IBM’s intellectual capital in the supply chain and associated domains. They will participate actively in knowledge sharing activities like communities of practice, forums, conferences, or other knowledge exchanges.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

12+ years of increasing responsibility and track record of success in a consultative or industry relevant role for Industrial Sector clients, which includes verticals in Electronics Manufacturing, Automotive, Aerospace & Defense, Industrial Products, Chemicals and Oil & Gas
3-5 years’ experience with one or more with widely used Supply Chain commercial software, such as o9, Kinaxis, OMP, Blue Yonder, SAP IBP or Oracle ASCP
Client relationship management and account management skills with experience in selling and delivering mid-to-large size deals
Excellent people management skills with strong focus on quality delivery
Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
N/A
About Business UnitIBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

As the health and safety of our candidates and our employees come first, we're excited to provide virtual experiences for interviews and new hire on-boarding. Currently, reopening of offices is planned for January 2022.
Who we are:

Dataminr puts real-time AI and public data to work for our clients, generating relevant and actionable alerts for global corporations, public sector agencies, newsrooms, and NGOs. Our leading AI platform detects the earliest signals of high-impact events and emerging risks from vast amounts of publicly available information. Our real-time alerts enable tens of thousands of users at hundreds of public and private sector organizations to learn first of breaking events around the world, develop effective risk mitigation strategies, and respond with confidence as crises unfold.

Dataminr is making its mark for growth and innovation, recently earning recognition on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, Forbes AI 50 and Forbes Cloud 100 lists. We also earned accolades for 'Most Innovative Use of AI' from the 2020 AI & Machine Learning Awards.

Join our team and help the world manage risk in real time. You'll work with 800+ talented people across eight offices, united by our passion to collaborate, make a difference, and have fun while doing it!
Sales at Dataminr:

In a fast-moving world, there's nothing more important than having real-time information at your fingertips to help you identify and mitigate risk, assess a crisis situation, and craft an effective response.

Being part of Sales at Dataminr means you'll have the opportunity to create a positive and meaningful impact for your clients. Here's what you can expect:

A comprehensive sales training and methodology program to set you up for success
Ongoing training and learning opportunities so you're always on top of the latest sales trends and best practices
Exposure and access to sales leadership for guidance, mentorship, and learning opportunities
A strong sales culture of individual goals within a tight-knit team environment where your whole self is accepted

Who you are:

You're a team player and love building relationships with prospective customers. You're a highly motivated, self-starter with the ability to multi-task within a fast paced environment. You're coachable, bring a positive attitude and are eager to excel in a sales career.

As an SDR, you'll be focused on targeting prospects who represent our ideal customer profile, conducting research and setting up qualified meetings for our Account Executives. You'll prospect into enterprise-level, senior strategic buyers and helping to bring a cutting-edge AI product to market. You'll contribute to the achievement of business results by tactically generating new market interest and exceeding team goals.

Responsibilities:

Build rapport and initiate conversations with potential clients via phone and email outreach
Introduce qualified prospects to the Account Executive team to convert into valuable customers
Build, maintain and exceed a pipeline of qualified sales leads around forecasted goals and defined objectives
Strategize with top-producing Account Executives and Sales Managers to improve performance, processes and procedures
Engage executives in targeted prospect accounts
Leverage CRM (Salesforce.com) to prospect

Desired Skills and Experience:

0-2 years of experience
Prospecting experience into Fortune 500 or 1000 companies a plus
Ability to use interpersonal and active listening skills in order to build relationships
Ability to establish clear value propositions via excellent communication skills in these forms: customer conversations; company and product presentations; written communications such as email and proposals
Strong time management and research skills
Must be able to work autonomously and collaborate in a team environment
Experience with Salesforce or similar CRM a plus

Why you should work here:

We recognize and reward hard work with:
company paid benefits for employees and their dependents, including medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance
401(k) savings plan with company matching
flexible spending account for out-of-pocket medical, transit, parking and dependent care expenses
We want you to be your best, authentic self by supporting you with:
a diverse, driven, and passionate team of coworkers who want you to succeed
individual learning and development fund and professional training
generous paid time off; including sick leave and 100% company paid parental leave
remote working friendly perks such as expanded telehealth options for mental and physical well being, virtual yoga, meditation and health and fitness app reimbursements

…and this is just to name a few!
