JobTitle: Wealth Management Associate Alternative Investments Product...
Content_text:
Wealth Management Associate Alternative Investments Product Management

Job Number: 3186842
POSTING DATE: Dec 2, 2021
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Other
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Associate

DESCRIPTION
Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.

Operations is one of the largest divisions in the firm and has diverse responsibilities, including correctly settling and recording millions of transactions per day, identifying and mitigating all operational risks, developing strong client relationships and partnering with technology to realize the full potential of IT and e-solutions. Throughout, the Operations department continually seeks ways to improve while actively supporting the development of new businesses, structures and markets.

Global Wealth Management Operations provides brokerage, investment and financial services to hundreds of thousands of individual investors. We apply our expertise in serving institutional clients to create new opportunities for people to achieve their personal financial goals. Morgan Stanley has one of the largest retail brokerage networks, with numerous worldwide representatives and retail locations. Our services are tailored to each client's investment objectives, risk tolerance, and financial needs. Products include mutual funds, stocks, bonds, and alternative investments where appropriate, as well as banking, mortgages, insurance and annuities.

Alternative Investment (AI) Operations supports the operational processing for ensuring clients who look to invest in the funds offered by MSSB Alternative Investments Group are able to do so in accordance with the terms and time frames set forth by the fund. Similarly, the AI Operations group supports ensuring clients who look to redeem out of or transfer their AI position do so in accordance with the funds cutoff. The products offered are Hedge Funds, Funds of Funds, Exchange Funds, Private Equity, Real-estate Funds as well as Custom Portfolio of funds.


Alternative Investments Product Management is the relationship manager to the fund managers and Financial Advisor teams. Team members maintain an understanding of the funds on the platform to provide insight regarding any product related questions. There is on-going exposure to Senior Management, Fund Managers, Legal, Compliance, Sales, Product Development/Origination and GIMA.

Responsibilities:
Product Management specific responsibilities:
Partner closely with proprietary and third party alternative investment on-platform fund managers to assess and communicate post-sale fund performance, business development updates, fund investment pipeline, strategic investment opportunities and market outlook for Private Wealth/Financial AdvisorsFinancial Advisor coverage based on a specific geographical locationWork closely with Internal & External Sales, Product Development/Origination, Legal, Compliance and Operations to formulate and deliver product updates/enhancementsMaintain all fund material on the internal alternatives website to ensure the most recent reporting and information are available to Financial AdvisorsDraft and send field communications regarding fund updates and developmentsHost fund update calls with fund managers and Financial AdvisorsPublish documents to a portal for Financial Advisors and investors

General responsibilities:
Maintain relationships with Fund Managers and Business PartnersProvide premier operational services to Financial AdvisorsAbility to multi-task between high volume of Financial Advisors requests/calls and other tasks/projectsAd hoc projects and reports required by management

QUALIFICATIONS
Qualifications / Requirements for role:
4-6 years of experience in financial services industryAlternative investment experience is requiredClient service experienceExcellent communication and verbal, written and listening skillsAbility to multitask under tight deadlinesSelf-motivated with a high degree of attention to detailAbility to adapt in fast paced environment with focus on innovation and flexibilityTeam player with the ability to work effectively in a team or independentlyDemonstrated relationship building skills with stakeholders, peers and all levels of managementProficient in the Microsoft suite of products (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access)Ability to work with large data sets in Excel

About AI4ALL

AI4ALL is a national nonprofit that fosters the next generation of diverse leaders in artificial intelligence. AI4ALL has empowered over 15,000 people in all 50 states and globally with AI education. Eighty-one percent of alumni in AI4ALL Changemakers in AI are interested in a career in AI after completing the program, and many are already making significant impacts in the field, from educating their peers to winning "best paper" at top AI conferences. In 2021, AI4ALL Summer Programs will run at 15 top universities around North America. Over 4,000 high school teachers and students have used AI4ALL's free AI curriculum through AI4ALL Open Learning. Additionally, AI4ALL College Pathways now operates at four universities, increasing access to AI careers for college students not already on an AI pathway.

By telling a new story about who can be a leader in AI, we're creating tomorrow's AI leaders and changing technology's future. AI4ALL has received funding from Melinda Gates/Pivotal Ventures, Google.org, Prudential Financial, Microsoft, EY, and The Micron Foundation, among others and has been featured in the New York Times, TIME, CNN, The Washington Post, USA Today, and The Atlantic.

About the Opportunity

AI4ALL is seeking an experienced CEO to lead the organization in its next stage of growth and evolution in its 5th year. Reporting to the Board of Directors, the CEO will lead an outstanding organization of 20+ engaged staff, more than 20 University Partners, and an annual operating budget of $4M. Following a legacy of strong relationships and an excellent reputation in the community, this is an exciting opportunity to be at the helm of an organization shaping the future of artificial intelligence at a national level. The ideal candidate is an expert at fundraising and relationship building, inspiring and supporting a high performing team, and providing strategic leadership as the organization continues its transformational impact in nurturing the next generation of diverse leaders in AI.

Key Responsibilities:

Fundraising & Development

In collaboration with the CFO, Board, and Corporate Partnerships team, creates a sustainable business model, growing and leveraging the strong foundation of existing revenue streams and creating new opportunities for funding.
Cultivates strong and sustainable relationships with foundations, corporations, major donors, and prospects, taking a leadership role in developing donor engagement strategies.
Oversees stakeholder engagement and relationships including the AI4ALL Advisory Board of key leaders from artificial intelligence, diversity and inclusion and education.

Organizational Leadership & Strategy

Working closely with the Board and executive team, finalizes and implements the strategic plan that aligns AI4ALL's core values, mission, vision, and long-term goals.
Working closely with the CFO and leadership team, guides and oversees the overall functioning of the organization including programs, operations, partnerships, and finances.
Stewards a high-functioning, inclusive, and supportive workplace environment and culture, developing the leadership team while retaining, supporting and recruiting excellent talent.
Tracks goals and metrics closely to ensure programmatic quality, rigor and impact.

Board Collaboration and Management:

Works closely with Board leadership to support Board recruitment, engagement, and cohesiveness.
Collaborate with the Board Chair and Board members to create a strategic vision and plan and prepare for Board meetings and retreats to drive AI4ALL's strategic vision for the organization.
Update the Board on organizational metrics, successes and challenges while collaborating with Board committees to drive forward key objectives.

Communications and Partnerships:

In coordination with the Communications Director, ensure organizational communications strategy aligns with AI4ALL brand and values.
Acts as a spokesperson for the AI4ALL mission and vision with key audiences, including AI researchers, AI industry leaders, higher education institutions, and at key conferences and events around the country.
Initiates, develops and maintains excellent relationships with key constituencies including corporations, university foundations, and community and education partners.

Qualifications:

Prior experience as a CEO, Executive Director, or member of the senior leadership team of an organization with a comparable degree of complexity or operating budget.
A minimum of 8 years' experience in management and leadership positions.
Demonstrated fundraising success with a track record of raising multi-millions annually from a combination of major donors, private foundations and corporate partnerships in particular.
Ability to steward a strong, supportive organizational culture and inspire employees to work towards a common vision.
An entrepreneurial business mindset with a proven track record leading a growing team towards ambitious outcomes.
Deep commitment to the principles of equity, inclusion and diversity and experience working with a diverse community of stakeholders.
Passion for the mission of diversity in AI and the power of education to impact lives.
Bachelor's degree minimum

Location preference: Flexible, but with strong preference for SF Bay Area or New York City

How To Apply:

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, pregnancy, medical condition, disability, or sexual orientation. As an equal opportunity employer that values the organizational benefits of a diverse staff, AI4ALL is committed to identifying and developing the skills and leadership of people with a variety of backgrounds and attributes.

AI4ALL has retained Schaffer&Combs, a certified B Corporation, to support this search. In order to apply, please submit a current resume and thoughtful cover letter that explains your interest and outlines your relevant skills and experience.

Please refrain from contacting AAI4ALL directly. All inquiries should be directed to Schaffer&Combs at ai4all@schaffercombs.com . Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis until the position is filled.

Who we are

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specializing in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organizations. We are proud to say that we're enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients' specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we've acquired with our 300+ client base around the globe.

We have 800 employees across 16 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: state of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

What you will be doing: Key responsibilities

Having recently opened our first office in the United States, we are looking for a Partner to join Artefact's U.S.'s consulting practice and grow our footprint within the U.S. market.

Your role will encompass:

Building Artefact's U.S. presence and serving in a top leadership capacity for the U.S. office. Acting as the primary sparring partner for the U.S. Managing Partner.
Creating real impact with clients. Winning consulting engagements and overseeing their delivery, transforming data into added value and making sure our clients reap all the benefits.
Bringing your industry expertise to help both our own and our client teams develop themselves.
Leading and supporting our clients' top executives (CMO, CDO, sometimes directly the CEO) with transformation of their business and making sure Artefact is their preferred partner in this endeavor.

Among your responsibilities as Partner, you will:

Develop client portfolio

Build a commercial strategy to develop the U.S. client portfolio through personal/industry contacts, events, cold calls, etc.
Monitor and grow Artefact U.S.'s commercial pipeline
Build thoughtful, attuned proposals supporting prospective client needs

Deliver the highest standards of quality on your projects

Pilot multidisciplinary teams (consultants, data scientists, strategic planners, media traders)
Ensure the highest level of quality of output to your clients
Accountable for the success of the projects from a client and team perspective

Develop our Global Knowledge platform

Bring / build a functional, technical or industrial edge from a thought leadership perspective and from an offer and services perspective
Provide expert-level, public-facing thought leadership on behalf of Artefact, on topics relevant to our business (data marketing, AI, data transformation, etc.)
Ensure the spread of Consulting Department knowledge across the company at local and global level (in coordination with the Consulting Practice)

Lead & develop the U.S. consulting team

Ensure the best allocation of consultant resources to clients and projects (staffing)
Develop consultants' expertise through training and best practice sharing with the other countries (digital ecosystem, consulting hard skills, soft skills, etc.)
Communicate the department's successes and results at the country level (ex: through events and PR)

What we are looking for

Demonstrated success in your first 12+ years of career at a top consulting, media, or technology firm (or in-house in a related capacity) and have 8+ years of experience managing projects and/or clients.
Ability to serve as a thought leader on topics at the intersection of data, marketing, and technology; expertise in one or more industry verticals (e.g. CPG, financial services, healthcare, telecom).
Business development mindset, with experience building, growing, and managing a roust book of business

Why you should join us

Artefact is the place to be: come and help build a data-services unicorn
Progress: Artefact USA is a start-up within a larger established scale-up
Culture: Innovation, Collaboration and Action are deeply embedded in our daily work
Entrepreneurship: you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won't give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

#LI-OM1

JobTitle: R&D FLARE Research Lead in Quantum Computing and Quantum Com...
Content_text:
R&D FLARE Research Lead in Quantum Computing and Quantum Communication
Description
JPMorgan Chase's Future Lab for Applied Research and Engineering (FLARE) conducts research in cutting-edge emerging technologies, specifically Quantum Computing and Quantum Communication. Our firm is seeking a passionate technologist to contribute to applied research and development of novel solutions in these fields. As a member of the FLARE R&D team, you will work closely with internal project teams, other researchers, and external communities alike to advance these research focus areas in a way that is beneficial to the technical teams in the company. You will also contribute to the firm's intellectual property by patent applications and scholarly articles.
The Purpose of Your Role:

To contribute to the conception and delivery of novel solutions to problems faced by internal project teams
To advance the field of Quantum Computing, in the areas of algorithms and applications (such as Artificial Intelligence, Optimization and Finance), including building prototypes
To advance the field of Quantum Communication, specifically in the area of Quantum Key Distribution, including building prototypes and proofs of concepts
To be part of technical partnerships with external organizations, such as academic institutions and leading technology firms
To contribute to JPMC's IP by pursuing necessary protections of generated IP
To help establishing JPMC's reputation in the scientific field via publication of select results in prestigious venues

The Expertise We Are Looking for:

Industrial research experience within a technology R&D organization, innovation lab, academic institution, or equivalent
Strong knowledge in one or more of the following disciplines: Quantum Computing, Quantum Communication
If applying for the field of Quantum Computing, strong knowledge in the areas of quantum algorithms and applications is also required, specifically in the areas of optimization, finance, and machine learning
If applying for the field of Quantum Communication, strong knowledge in the areas of cryptography and networking is also required
Excellent programming skills in languages such as Python, C, C++ and Java
Experience in technical writing in a scientific or technical field, as well as grant applications or research proposals
Working knowledge of common research evaluation frameworks and techniques
Strong passion, awareness and familiarity with emerging technology paradigms
Strong written and visual presentation skills
Ability to work through ambiguity and multiple priorities
Prior hands-on experience as a researcher and developer in a lab is preferred
Familiarity and or experience in financial services is preferred
A Ph.D. or M.S. degree in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering or Computer Science is required, with particular focus on Quantum Technologies (Quantum Computing, quantum algorithms, quantum applications, and/or Quantum Communication)

Travel Requirements

Up to 10% of travel across strategic hubs, external partner sites, as well as industrial and academic forums
JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.
The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. These requirements may include sharing information in the firm's vaccine record tool, vaccination or regular testing, mask wearing, social distancing and daily health checks. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

AI Engineers is a multi-disciplinary, ENR-500 company with several offices in the U.S as well as an international office. We provide Bridge, Transportation, Construction, Site/Civil, Water/Wastewater, Building Systems, Design-Build as well as Survey and Mapping services to a host of public and private clients. The company’s internal management is based on the concept of AGILITY to maximize client service and employee engagement.
AI Engineers strongly believes in the implementation of New Technology in all aspects of the A/E/C industry. The firm regularly deploys drones, laser scanners, BIM, artificial intelligence, wireless sensors, and a host of other cutting-edge resources that capture reality. The collected data is visualized with powerful software and creates accurate virtual representations of physical assets with digital twins, which are placed in augmented reality for easy interaction. New Technology enables the traditional services to perform work better, faster, and more cost effective.
To keep pace with our growth, AI Engineers is seeking a dynamic, motivated and career focused individual to join our multi-faceted Marketing Team at our regional office in New York City, NY.
Qualifications:
Min. 5 years of prior experience with the architecture and/or engineering industry is required.
Experience with preparing responses to RFPs and RFQs, especially NY agencies such as NYSDOT, NYCDOT, NYCSCA, NYCDDC, etc. is strongly preferred.
Experience in desktop publishing including Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office is required.
Data driven and detail oriented with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong organizational and time management skills, and the ability to work independently in a deadline driven environment.
Strong coordination skills with Project Managers, Technical Leaders as well as outside team members (Prime Consultants, subconsultants, Contractors, etc.).

Job Description/Duties & Responsibilities:
Supporting the company’s efforts in projecting quality, consistency, and innovation through all marketing activities across the company.
Tracking and preparation of responses to RFPs and RFQs including reviewing and editing of materials for timely submissions.
Preparing PowerPoint presentations.
Maintenance and updates for marketing collateral including project sheets, resumes, brochures, and newsletters.
Updating client and project databases in CRM environment.
Attending client meetings, industry events, etc. as needed.

The company offers excellent salary and benefits and gives all candidates the opportunity to challenge their abilities in an AGILE environment. Strong growth opportunities exist for the right candidate. Interested candidates should submit a resume and a cover letter that details their experience as well as how they meet or exceed the position's requirements.
AA/EOE/M/F/D/VEV

JobTitle: Enterprise Account Executive - Retail - Tableau Analytics &...
Content_text:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales
Job Details
With changing market forecasts and evolving customer requirements, retailers and wholesalers must turn to data to stay ahead of the curve, especially in this new era. From managing supply chain to providing customers with efficient service and experience, retail leaders are turning to Tableau to transform their data into useful insights. Tableau is committed to helping your organization use the power of visual analytics to tackle the complex challenges and decisions retail companies facing daily.


If you're interested in redefining the way leaders use data to solve problems—empowering people and organizations to make the most of their data, this is the right role for you.


As an Enterprise Account Executive within our Retail-Consumer Goods team, you will sell the effective Tableau analytics suite to our top clients. Expect to champion our solution that combines multidimensional, interactive data visualization with the power of machine learning to deliver insights and data-driven applications for every user. The Account Executive will formulate and execute a Tableau sales strategy within an assigned region, drive revenue growth by penetrating the current customer base, and develop new customers in their segment. You will work in partnership with existing CRM Account owners that carry quota for the Tableau product sales in their region.
Come and be a part of our data revolution!


Some of the things you’ll accomplish in this role …
Influence some of the world’s premier enterprise and high growth retail brands on the full Tableau Analytics suite to promote solutions that will help them reach analytics ubiquity and blaze new trails within their organizations.
Work closely with your customers as a trusted adviser to deeply understand their unique company challenges and goals around data.
Define and execute territory / account sales plans for assigned geographic territory and then meet and exceed sales goals (quotas) through prospecting, qualifying, managing and closing sales opportunities.
Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect and assess sales and move a large number of transactions simultaneously through the sales pipeline.
Manage and track customer and transactional information in a CRM system (ie, SFDC).
Coordinate resources throughout the sales cycle, including product support and sales engineering.
Provide product demonstrations and general support to prospective customers.
Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues, trends and products.
Practice effective, excellent communication with management, customers and support staff.
Participate in team-building and company-growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts and customer care.
Travel to customer locations in support of sales efforts.
And last but not least, you will contribute to our business growth in a fast paced, collaborative and fun atmosphere, as a valued member of our Ohana.
Who you are… We’re growing all the time, and looking for a good mix of skills and experience to help us support your success & growth:
At least 5-10+ years of quota carrying software or technology sales and account management experience; ideally selling to retail & consumer goods
Highly driven individual with a focus on execution and a strong sense of urgency and a belief in our Tableau mission. You can go beyond relationship management.
A mix of business curiosity combined with a technical ability to truly address customer data challenges and earn trust
Solution selling mentality: develop a plan and solution, articulate value, and navigate complexities of our customers to drive revenue
Work well within a team of various partners (client directors, solution engineers, executives, etc.)
Experience with analytics, data, databases, predictive modeling, or business intelligence preferred.
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world
Open to all locations in the US.
For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $116,350. You may also be offered incentive compensation, bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/
*LI-Y
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .
Posting Statement
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .
Salesforce welcomes all.
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Our Vision:  To make New York City the global model for inclusive innovation and economic growth, fueled by the City’s diverse people and businesses.Our Mission:  To create shared prosperity across New York City’s five boroughs by strengthening neighborhoods and growing good jobs.The Initiatives Department within NYCEDC seeks to understand the rapidly changing landscape of NYC’s key economic sectors and develop and implement innovative initiatives that address specific challenges and opportunities in them.Initiatives as a department creates, launches and manages portfolios of projects that partner with and impact the following industries and sectors: media, tech (e.g. AR/VR, cybersecurity, AI, Blockchain), urban innovation & sustainability, life sciences, healthcare, fashion & design, and industrial & manufacturing. Initiatives projects are agile, strategic and impact focused.Position Overview: The Vice President of Creative & Applied Tech will join NYCEDC’s industry Initiatives Department, responsible for creating and implementing economic development programs, engaging the private sector, government, and academic leadership to grow key strategic industries, ensure New York City remains a global leader in innovation and technology (“tech”) and that these opportunities are accessible to all New Yorkers. The Vice President of Creative & Applied Tech is responsible for assisting in creating and implementing a tech strategy and related programs focused on economic development. These strategies can include both ongoing and pre-launch projects including cybersecurity, broadband, VR/AR, blockchain, artificial intelligence and big data, space tech commercialization, quantum computing, and others. The right person should have expertise in building tech programs at scale, specifically those focused on cybersecurity and broadband and can act as a generalist who can be flexible and adapt to opportunities to develop an economic growth strategy for an equitable and diverse tech ecosystem in New York City. The position also requires being creative with limited resources. This is a critical role within the industry Initiatives team at NYCEDC and is a unique opportunity to help lead a team, provide thought leadership, create initiatives that grow jobs, and deliver tangible impact in NYC. The VP will report to the SVP of Creative & Applied Tech.*Essential Duties & Responsibilities: *Work with Creative & Applied Tech team to organize roundtables, 1:1s and ecosystem events.Help lead current and new programmatic initiatives to drive innovation and inclusive growth in tech sectors. Maximize the impact and scale of current programs in these sectors.Develop tech strategies with the SVP, including but not limited to, cybersecurity and broadband, as well as artificial intelligence and overarching tech strategies in the City.Provide direction and management to project teams in framing problems and identifying key issues/questions.Provide direction for development of project work plans, including study scope, timelines, specific analyses to be completed, and individual responsibilities.Oversee project teams, and the work of external consultants/partners as needed.Provide direction in development of program recommendations, ensuring they are feasible impactful, and coordinated within and across teamsBe creative with limited resources, and proactively identify and pursue funding opportunities through grants, philanthropies, and other means.Oversee the creation of and deliver PowerPoint presentations or memos for key stakeholders (e.g., NYCEDC senior staff, City Hall, external partners).Work within the Initiatives department, across other NYCEDC departments and with City Hall to coordinate needed reporting.Maintain, develop, and expand NYCEDC’s relationships with private sector partners, particularly leaders in the tech ecosystem, academic institutions, and private funding entities. Form strategic collaborations with these partners to develop and drive results within NYCEDC and across city government.Engage NYCEDC executives, leaders from partner organizations and City Hall on critical outreach and policy advocacy matters. Promote a collaborative, high performing organizational culture that fosters passion for our mission, program excellence, teamwork, and a shared purpose.As needed, serve as spokesperson, representative, and ambassador of the Creative & Applied Tech programs to a wide variety of constituencies.Other duties as assignedQualifications: Strong advanced communication skills (written, oral communication and presentation skills).Entrepreneurial and leadership ability; organized and results oriented.8+yrs relevant work experience, including managing operations, growing teams, and providing strategic leadership experience in a demanding analytic environment.Strong track record in converting ideas into action plans and driving results.Extensive project management experience including ability to manage projects against tight timelines and apply a collaborative style that works well in teams and empowers staff.Deep understanding of the tech sector.Able to look at the big picture and search for insightful, creative solutions.Ability to facilitate constructive debate and effectively negotiate, persuade, and reach consensus.Able to attract, hire, develop, and retain top talent.Managing people and investing in staff, including providing professional development guidance.Prioritizes effectively among competing needs and opportunities and manage multiple projects at the same time.New York City residency is required within 180 days of hireAs of August 2, 2021, all new hires must be vaccinated against the COVID-19 virus as defined by the CDC, unless they have been granted a reasonable accommodation for religion or disabilityAbout Us: NYCEDC is New York City’s primary vehicle for promoting economic growth in each of the five boroughs. Our mission is to create shared prosperity across New York City’s five boroughs by strengthening neighborhoods and growing good jobs. We do this by developing, managing, and implementing expansion and redevelopment programs that encourage investment and strengthen the city’s competitive position.NYCEDC is dedicated to the creation of a dynamic, equitable, and sustainable urban economy. We are making sure that whatever happens next, happens right here in New York City—and that all New Yorkers are a part of it.NYCEDC offers many unique advantages for an exciting and fulfilling career. As part of our team, you’ll enjoy:The unique opportunity to make an impact on New York CityWorking on diverse, unique, and challenging projectsWorking closely with teams of creative, highly motivated, and passionate peopleLearning opportunities designed to enhance the practical skills and business knowledge of our employeesExcellent benefits, including company-paid 401(a) pension plan, 457(b) tax-advantaged retirement savings plans, medical, dental and vision benefits, generous paid family leave and paid time off, and other perksThe New York City Economic Development Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our diversity and inclusion mission is to attract, retain, and engage a diverse workforce comprised of talented people. NYCEDC employees can expect to work as part of a highly engaged, passionate and inclusive workforce where everyone’s contributions are valued, respected and make an impact on one of the best and most diverse cities in the world!For more information, visit our website at edc.nyc.Job Type: Full-time

Materialize is the streaming SQL database company that makes it easy for any developer or analyst to understand streaming data, answer complex questions and build intelligent applications using standard technology. Whether it's delivering personalized experiences, accurately identifying fraud, building predictive AI, or discovering new business opportunities, the ability to run complex queries on multiple streams of data and keep their answers up to date is critical to making better decisions about the changing world around us.

We are focused on bottom-up developer adoption, our core software is free to use and source available, our business model is a cloud product that handles management of Materialize and lets businesses focus on building value. We have a vibrant developer community on Slack and as much as possible we work in public on GitHub.

Who We Are:
The Materialize team includes engineers who were early employees of Cockroach Labs, Flink, Dropbox, and YouTube. Our work builds on top of Timely Dataflow and Differential Dataflow, both created by our co-founder Frank McSherry, a world-leading computer scientist with decades of award-winning research in all aspects of data.

Investors:
Kleiner Perkins, Redpoint Ventures and Lightspeed Venture Partners. Additional investors include executives from Cockroach Labs, Datadog, and Rubrik.
What does a Senior Technical Writer at Materialize do?

As a Senior Technical Writer, you will directly report to the Head of Developer Experience (Developer Experience sits independent of Marketing and Product) and own the content that developers use to learn and make the most out of Materialize.

You will do that by becoming an expert on our technology, and acting as the spokesperson for our Documentation, organizing our process, building our style guide, and collaborating with other Technical Writers on the team to support them.

Work will vary across documenting features, creating conceptual overviews, writing guides about solving specific problems with Materialize, and even coming up with SQL and code examples that illustrate how developers can be more successful in working with Materialize.

You will also collaborate with Product Managers, Product Designers, Developer Advocates, and Engineers to build an understanding of the initiatives we're pursuing, and the kind of learning materials which would make them more impactful.

You will be able to work fully remotely, using GitHub and Markdown extensively as writing and collaboration tools.

What are the requirements

We believe that the right person would have the following:

Experience in structuring a writing practice by maintaining the process and supporting tools, along with coaching other Technical Writers
Context about working with developer tools in the data space: e.g. databases, message brokers, ETL tools, data warehouses, general SQL, or other data products.
Ability to convey complex technical concepts in a concise way
Taste for consistent writing, by adopting and evolving a style guide
Good understanding and experience working with GitHub for collaboration (pull requests and reviews)
3+ years of proven experience writing about technical topics, whether this be blog posts, specs, or formal employment as a Technical Writer

The following would also be super helpful:

Hands-on experience building applications or scripts involving a database
Ability to build simple prototypes for testing features to better understand how they work
What's it like to work at Materialize?

You are likely to be a great addition to our team if you:

...have an ownership mindset. As part of a small team, you'll have an outsize impact on decisions and the way things are executed.

...stay nimble. As a growing startup, the team and strategy evolves quickly. Be ready to re-calibrate often and stay flexible.

...be kind and collaborative. Come in ready to share your ideas and listen to feedback.
Remote Work

We are a remote first organisation with an office based in New York City. Whether you work remotely, or from the office in NYC is entirely up to you! We offer generous relocation assistance if you prefer the latter.

What's in it for you
The opportunity to take the lead on key strategic objectives of Materialize and to exercise outsize impact on the overall direction of the organization
Competitive compensation including a commensurate Stock Option Package
401K, or similar retirement funding for non-US residents
Medical Cover, including Dental and Vision (or equivalent for non-US residents)
A generous tech-budget to get you all the latest hardware and software that you need
What is the process like?

Our recruitment process roughly follows the structure below:

Introductory call with the Recruiting Team
First interview with our Head of Developer Experience
Technical Writing Assignment (we provide compensation for this)
Second Interview with one of our Technical Writers
Offer
What do I do now?

If this sounds like an interesting opportunity, please apply via our website, and include your LinkedIn profile (or Resume), writing samples, or anything else that you think might give us a good sense of who you are.

We will generally be in touch within 7 business days to let you know the outcome of your application.

We understand it takes a diverse team of highly intelligent, passionate, curious, and creative people to develop the exceptional product we are building. Our dynamic team has incredible perspectives to share, just as we know you do, and we take great pride in being an equal opportunity employer.

General information
Agency: Reprise
Job Function: Data & Analytics
Location: New York, United States
Job Ref#: 4940
Description & Requirements
Position Summary
Reprise, a global digital agency, wants to add an Analytics Director to our Analytics Practice based in NYC. The Analytics Director will report into the VP of Analytics and partner to lead strategic decisions leveraging data, analytics, quantitative and qualitative research, testing and personalization for new and existing clients and drive the growth of the practice across the agency. The successful candidate will also take point in analytics and optimisation business meetings, ensure high standards of professionalism and be responsible for the success of their respective client accounts.
Key Responsibilities
 Lead the Analytics team on data and analytics projects, which may include advanced analytics, tagging and tracking, attribution modelling, financial modelling, propensity modelling, forecasting, reporting, data visualization, activation and personalization
 Assist the UX and CRO team with the development of research and testing strategies, roadmaps, tools, experiments and provide recommendations for ongoing optimisation
 Collaborate with the AI team on projects, including automation solutions, data mesh, cloud infrastructure and report templatization.
 Partner and Represent Analytics within Reprise to further the development and growth of the department.
 Manage client relationships and ensure they are content.
 Deliver high quality work which can be used to promote Reprise’s services
 Explore opportunities across the business with existing and prospective clients to cross-sell data, insights and optimisation services
 Proactively provide ideas for increasing the net profitability and average life value of accountable client projects
 Develop a strategic and technical roadmap for each client and showcase the findings to both internal and external stakeholders
Desired Skills & Experience
 Demonstrative experience in digital marketing and performance reporting
 Ability to define objectives and prepare KPIs as measurable metrics
 Expert in driving solutions using analytics, including auditing, implementation, insights, reporting and delivering actionable recommendations
 Involvement with data science software, database languages, big data technologies and cloud environments.
 Exposure to and understanding of data science techniques, traditional statistical methods, ML, AI and its use in Digital Media.
Demonstrated proficiency in media / reporting platforms and 3rd Party Tools (Google Adwords, Bing Ads, Similarweb, Amazon Advertising, BrightEdge, Facebook, Snapchat, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics etc.)
 Proficient in the design and development of multichannel dashboards, including most efficient data feeds, blending data, summarizing data across a variety of platforms, (i.e Google Data Studio, Looker, Tableau).
 Capable of preparing and setting up experiments, applying targeting rules and audience conditions, launching, managing and reporting on testing activity
 Proficient in building business cases and financial models to support clients investments.
 Confident in presenting insights, opportunities and prioritized opportunities to clients, stakeholders and internal teams
 Effective time management skills and the ability to deliver projects on time
 Experience delivering training considered an advantage

About Us
As the global performance marketing agency of IPG Mediabrands, we are obsessed with Customer Flow, the continuous movement of customers along the path to purchase. Our purpose is to help brands build and accelerate Customer Flow, and we offer deep expertise in digital crafts required to move customers along that journey. We do this by unifying our craft experts which include search, social media, SEO, eCommerce, content creation and strategy under a single operating system.

Our expert team of specialists delivers integrated initiatives that help the world’s leading brands connect to the people who drive their business forward – efficiently and effectively. Reprise is headquartered in New York with over 60 offices around the world and works with brands like Johnson & Johnson, Coca-Cola, Amazon, American Express, Lego & more.

DataDome is a fast-growing tech scale-up, leading the bot protection industry from New York, Paris, and Singapore. Based on AI & Machine Learning, our cybersecurity solution beats illegitimate traffic, so that sensitive data remains safe and online platforms can perform at optimum speed.

We're proud to protect hundreds of customers worldwide, including TripAdvisor, The New York Times, Footlocker, Hanes Brands, Hermès, Rakuten, LVMH, Adevinta and many others.

Our offices gather talents coming from 10 different countries. Our Team Members particularly like our central & modern offices, an accessible management Team, off-sites and other Team Building events.

Want to help us win the war against bad bots? Join our Botbusters team!
WHAT WE OFFER ...

A stimulating working environment with passionate individuals and a first-class R&D team creating a top-quality and innovative solution, making DataDome one of the strongest performers in the bot protection industry
A joyful workplace with many events throughout the year: annual offsite, summer and Christmas parties; drinks, Breakfast every Monday & Friday
20 PTO, including sick and personal days + 10 company holiday
Competitive salary and rewards policy
Medical, dental and vision
401k
Office located in the heart of Manhattan, in Union Square (Part or full remote is allowed)

DataDome has just entered Series B and is now ready to hire a new Solutions Architect to join our team in the US!

The Solutions Architect, will report directly to the Head of Solutions Architecture based in NYC and will play a crucial role in helping prospects understand the value of DataDome for their business.

As a Solutions Architect, you will work closely with Account Managers to explain and implement the DataDome solution to leading enterprises and startups. You will handle all the technical discussions with prospective clients and assist them with understanding how the DataDome solution works and how it can be implemented in their existing architecture.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

Understand complex customer business problems and advise them on how to deploy the DataDome solution
Visualize customer internal systems and information topology
Lead technical discussion with prospects
Prepare and deliver high impact presentations and demonstrations that tell DataDome's differentiated story
Guide customers through the evaluation process ensuring that DataDome's solution meets key business objectives and technical requirements
Configure prospect's instance to enhance bot detection
Work cross-functionally between different sales, engineering, product and marketing teams to promote the adoption of the DataDome solution and share customer feedback

 What we look for:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent experience
At least 5 years pre-sales experience within a mid-market to enterprise level SaaS ecosystem
Deep understanding of how the internet works and HTTP protocols
Hands-on professional experience with AWS
A consultative approach with solving the customer's business challenges and have a track record of successfully overcoming technical and security objections.
Experience in translating technical concepts into language for varied audiences including software engineers, CTOs...
Good understanding of web-based solutions, website development and structured data
Highly analytical mindset, that can manage client relationships as part of a market leading, AI driven organization.
Customer oriented with excellent written and verbal communication skills
If you speak French or Spanish, you will have a great advantage too! (but not mandatory)

What are the next steps?

If your application is selected, our Talent Acquisition Manager will contact you for a first chat
You will then meet with our Head of Solution Architecture (based in NYC)
You will do a 1h work session on typical client situations with our Head of Solution Architecture and a US Account Manager
The final step will be a 1 on 1 meeting with our CTO
Welcome to DataDome!

DataDome is an equal opportunity employer, and proud to be committed to diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age.

JobTitle: Engineering Director: Financial Experiences and Fin Crime/Op...
Content_text:
About Railsbank

Railsbank is the world's leading global open banking platform that gives customers "access to global financial services". The company was founded by serial finTech entrepreneurs who previously founded successful and award winning companies like Evolution and Currency Cloud. Since starting in 2016 in London the company has expanded across Europe, launched in Singapore and is currently extending capabilities in SE Asia, USA and Australia. We are now scaling the company across US, Europe and SE Asia and looking for exceptional people who share the same core values to join team Railsbank.
The team and the role:

We believe that people don't buy car loans, they buy cars. Brands are becoming more immersed in our daily lives and embedding finance to provide more intuitive and meaningful experiences to their customers. Our objective is to make it easier for any business or brand to embed finance into their customer journeys and apps. How? By building turnkey financial experiences (Instant prototyping and developer access, pre-built experiences that customers can embed into their apps and advanced data and analytics to enhance the experience and scale) and turnkey financial crime prevention and operations (as an offering to our Customers as well as automation and internal tooling.).
The Director Engineering role will partner with the The Head of Product for "Financial Experiences" and the Head of Product for "FinCrime & Ops" to manage and deliver their respective global product roadmaps. You will architect a platform (portal) that our customers will rely on throughout their customer journey as they prototype, launch and scale, serving a multitude of personas (business leads, developers, operations ...) and ensure that it can scale across regions and use cases. You will also design pre-built embeddable financial experiences (SDK's) for end customers. You will hire, lead and grow multiple engineering squads to deliver solutions that “our customers love, yet work for our business”.
What you get to do:

Take immediate responsibility for all legacy front-end applications (developer experiences, operations console).
Architect and scale a new platform that works at massive global scale, providing a seamless experience throughout the customer journey.
Automate processes to handle KYC, settlement and reconciliation, servicing, risk and fraud.
Build SDK's (pre-built front-end embeddable components)
Work with Product to ensure Engineering activities are closely aligned with Product Roadmap priorities

Maintain a high level of quality in the product (the right level of resiliency and security)
Work with the CTO to define and communicate the technology vision and culture

Recruitment of in-house engineering teams, and implementing processes for their personal growth
Selection and engagement of suppliers and outsource teams
Working with suppliers and outsource teams to ensure delivery meets our policies, standards, processes and escalating where required
Planning and overseeing activities relating to annual audits, BCP/DR exercises, and certification exercises
Coaching / mentoring Tech Leads, and helping them with coaching / mentoring their teams


What you bring to the role:

Experience building and scaling global front-end applications (ideally a mix of B2B and consumer).

Familiarity with a variety of automation and data science tools in areas of Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence and data visualization to detect and solve complex Fincrime problems
Experience building SDK's with UI components.
Experience operating in complex, highly regulated industries (where compliance and security are key).
Experience running multiple engineering teams, in multiple locations.
Experience engineering for high transaction volumes and scaling.
Hands on experience developing architectural strategies and execution plans for building highly engaging omni channel customer experiences across web, mobile and other smart devices.

Extensive experience building cloud native applications leveraging the right services, tools and security best practices for the problem at hand.
Experience setting up modern Dev ops practices to facilitate frequent and stable product releases on a daily basis
Experience setting up high performing squads from ground up to deliver challenging product.
A passion for collaboration, and collaborative approaches such as specification by example and behavior driven development.


What we deliver in return:

Growth stage software company, validated in the market and a global leader in banking as a service.
Competitive salary, bonus plan, & stock options.

Competitive employee benefits.
Great Company Culture and Work Environment.

A talented team that works hard, enjoys learning from each other, and impacting our customer's businesses - globally.


Role Location and Hours

Our US office is headquartered out of Santa Monica, CA. Remote employment is available for the right candidate. This role is not eligible for employment authorization sponsorship at this time.

Job Category - Product Management, Product Innovators
What We Look for in Our Team Members and Our Values

Being an integral part of the Railsbank team and sharing our values is important to us. The environment at Railsbank is fast-paced, exciting, and dynamic. It suits people that love to collaborate and support one-another. We are all driven by the same values and are looking to welcome new people to the team that share these values. Our values are: excellence, accountability, diversity, work/life balance, trust, fun, inclusive, friendship, noble cause, and respect.
Equal Opportunities Employer

Railsbank is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion or belief, colour, sex or gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, national origin, marital status, or any other basis.

About Conduent:

Through our dedicated associates, Conduent delivers mission-critical services and solutions on behalf of Fortune 100 companies and over 500 governments – creating exceptional outcomes for our clients and the millions of people who count on them.
You have an opportunity to personally thrive, make a difference and be part of a culture where individuality is noticed and valued every day.
Job Description:

The Business Development Sales Executive - Legal Analytics is responsible for pursuit of sales within new and existing client account(s). The position will open new clients for Conduent, leading client meetings and be a respected advisor for clients on their analytics positioning and integrated workflow plans. This role will encompass:
Growing relationships with Conduent's largest Client(s) through cross-selling of new services and capturing new client logos, using consultative selling expertise.
Establish territory plan to sales goals, and provide accurate, complete and timely submission of required pipeline reports and forecasts.
Supporting the development of marketing plans that will appeal to a variety of customers on a global basis in order to support sales and profit objectives.
Representing the organization with executives and clients establishes and maintains effective relationships with internal and external constituents.
Other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
5+ years of demonstrated experience growing and leading a sales portfolio with sales targets of $5 million plus per annum or more and a track record of significantly growing revenue pipeline in legal operations solutions (or compliance/risk operations) with a focus on contract management and analytics, legal spend management, and/or eBilling solutions.
Experience selling across the organization into legal business partners such as procurement and finance.
A strong track record of achieving aggressive business and sales goals; growing and managing a thriving portfolio.
Subject matter expertise in legal, risk, or compliance operations and AI and analytics transformation solutions with demonstrated experience in solution selling to address a complex strategic challenge.
Proven Leadership in account strategy, account planning, relationship strategy.
Closing:

Conduent is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender identity, gender expression, sex/gender, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, use of a guide dog or service animal, military/veteran status, citizenship status, basis of genetic information, or any other group protected by law.

For those using Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox please download the form first: click here to access or download the form. You may also click here to access Conduent’s ADAAA Accommodation Policy.

ComplyAdvantage is seeking a driven and experienced Implementation Consultant, this role will entail working directly with clients to drive new customer implementations of ComplyAdvantage AML, Transaction Monitoring and Payment Screening solutions.

About us

Since launching in 2014, we have been on a mission to neutralize the risk of money laundering, terrorist financing, corruption, and other financial crime on a global scale. In that time, we have raised over $100m in funding, have four global hubs located in New York, London, Singapore and Cluj-Napoca and are backed by Ontario Teachers', Index Ventures, Balderton Capital and Goldman Sachs.

We aim to grow to over 350 employees in the next 12 months, as we continue to fight the good fight against financial crime and help make compliance less painful for our client base of over 500 enterprises across 75 different countries. We're leveraging game-changing tech to help us on our mission as the financial industry's leading source of AI-driven financial crime risk data and detection technology.

No fight against crime is complete without the right values, and we take ours very seriously!

 Focus on the Team - We're Collaborative, Human, and Humble

 Kaizen - We're Curious, Proactive and Agile

 Deliver Results - We're Tenacious, Accountable and Focused

We can only defeat financial crime if we have the right people with the right values in place to do so, and we're committed to investing in passionate people who are experts in their field. Our culture and working environment is second to none - Don't believe us? See what our employees have to say on Glassdoor.

Understand a client's technical landscape, working with them to define a solution approach and integration plan that fits with its intended operating model
Manage projects with top-down oversight throughout entire execution to ensure success as defined by adherence to standards of scope, budget, and timeline.

Monitor project progress continuously and make detailed scheduled reports on measurable items, such as milestones and deliverables.

Experience with AML and Client Onboarding solutions is a big plus but not required.

We are looking for a Data Engineer who is ready for the next step in their continuing journey toward excellence. In this role, you’ll work with a team of Data Engineers and Analysts across R&D to help design and build the next generation of our data infrastructure. This entails building ETL pipelines to combine disparate data sources in a unified data lake, creating tools to automate processes and workflows, and developing Machine Learning algorithms to drive growth, efficiency and impact the bottom line.

What you'll do:
Design and implement data storage structures and scalable, distributed ETL pipelines to bring disparate data sources into a unified data lake
Develop and enhance internal reporting platform
Develop and design procedures, systems and measurement tools to improve business processes
Identify and improve upon current internal processes through automation and optimization
Replace legacy systems with more modern and up-to-date services
Help the organization grow and scale by enhancing customer engagement, understanding customer behavior and automating user outreach.
Our Core Values
Collaboration: We believe that individuals do their best work when working together in diverse, inclusive, and cohesive teams.
Excellence: We believe in doing things the "right way" rather than the "fast way,” and holding ourselves to a higher standard of work ethics and excellence.
Growth: We believe individuals do their best work when they are constantly growing, learning, and changing.
Communication: We believe in combining empathy with openness and honesty to set clear expectations and hold each other accountable.
Impact: We believe we're making the world a better place by empowering marketers to really help their customers rather than just sell stuff.
Who you are:
You have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
6 years of experience in a data engineering role
Experience with Python; familiarity with Go, Java, Scala or similar language a bonus
Experience with SQL and Database technologies
Experience with APIs and data transformations
Experience with Cloud computing technologies: AWS (S3, SQS, EC2, Athena, etc.), Google Cloud Platform, etc.
Experience with Data Quality/Quality Assurance
Familiarity with modern containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
Familiarity with technologies such as Spark, Kafka, etc.
Familiarity with AI/ML techniques
Why You Should Join

Conductor is a People-First and Customer-First company. We are looking for engaged and passionate technology leaders that can raise the bar. We have built a highly collaborative culture of technical excellence with tremendous opportunity to have an immediate impact in the day-to-day life of our employees and customers and drive the company's success and growth. We all share the same values, innovate and motivate each other to attain ambitious goals, and celebrate each other’s success.

We are made up of a diverse group of people from all backgrounds. Wherever you are from, you will find a common ground here to accelerate your career and make a difference in the organic marketing industry.

Conductor, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

About Conductor

Conductor’s search and content intelligence platform helps marketers create and optimize content to improve visibility online.

The technology generates customer intent insights that lead to compelling content, increased traffic, and higher organic marketing ROI. Customizable dashboards and workflows guide marketers through the content creation process, empowering them to measure, refine, and demonstrate the effectiveness of their SEO and content marketing efforts.

In addition to its SaaS platform, Conductor offers a suite of services and support including site audits, site migrations, and managed services that empower in-house marketing teams and digital marketing agencies to drive results and put their customers' needs first.

Conductor's forward-thinking customers include leading global and emerging enterprise brands.

Organization Overview:
Citi Markets Operations is currently at a pivotal point in its evolution and journey to implement a target operating model. We take pride and are passionate about our People and our culture. We are invested in our People and their development. We are transforming and simplifying our operating model, creating an exciting environment which encourages diversity of thought and inclusion.
We are a dynamic, global, and diverse Organization, with a presence in over 60 Countries; covering all front post execution Operations teams including product aligned Middle Office groups, Settlements, Margin, Asset Servicing, Listed Derivative & Commodities Operations. We support an extensive range of Capital Markets products and services including Fixed Income (FX, Rates, Credit, Muni, Cash and Derivatives) where Citi is consistently a dominant top 3 player in the market, Equity (Cash, Derivatives, Prime Brokerage, Futures, Listed Derivs, FXPB) where Citi has a significant growth program to continue to build out its capabilities and services; and Syndicates where we support both FI and EQ new issues and IPOs.
Our Operations groups are core to the success of the Markets business and have significant impact across the lifecycle of a trade. We partner extensively with a range of internal stakeholders including Front Office Sales and Trading Desks, Compliance, Legal, Finance and HR; alongside having significant interaction with our external client base, playing a key role in the overall client experience. We have a Client relationship group, dedicated to overseeing the Organizational service performance and strategic partnership for our top tier client base, where we play a key role in supporting our global clients to ensure they have a first-class experience when doing business with Citi.
Our Business Intelligence and Process Re-engineering group works alongside our Operations teams delivering automation solutions to solve for operational challenges. We partner with Citi’s innovation labs to drive optimization, and overall play a pivotal role in enabling us to transform to achieve our target operating model.
Our Technology partners develop and implement a wide range of applications that support the Operations, Change, Design and Implementation groups in providing innovative products and solutions. We have re-imagined how to provide technology and service in our domain through the alignment of our team vision, culture, and aggressive retirement plan for legacy applications and adoption of a micro-based containerized cloud environment. We encourage our people to create, explore and be adventurous whilst taking measured risk, adopting safe practices to protect the firm. Data lineage and optimization is core to how we develop our eco system. We are growing our capabilities using artificial intelligence, natural language processing and machine learning.
Our roles entail ensuring we operate in a robust control environment, whilst in a fast-paced workplace. We comply with global regulations and internal policies and adopt a proactive approach to identifying opportunities to reduce risk through the continuous evaluation of our controls; to protect our clients, the firm, and our reputation.
We work closely with our external global peers, partners, and regulators, and play an integral part in leading an agenda at the forefront to optimize and streamline processes and drive strategy across our industry.
Operational Client Experience Lead- C13
We are looking for enthusiastic and energetic team players, with a strong work ethic, who will join Markets Operations. You will play a pivotal part in helping to run with our Client Service Strategy of ~7000 clients and to work closely with Business partners, external clients and internal stakeholders. The Operational Client Experience Lead is responsible for maintaining, strengthening, and growing the ongoing relationship with Citi Markets Clients by implementing the strategic client experience strategy to provide a tier level of client service to all clients. This role integrates subject matter and industry expertise across operations. It requires an in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the entire function. Communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Has responsibility for volume, quality, timeliness and delivery of end results of an area.
Responsibilities:Exhibits knowledge and expertise in the products and capabilities of the business.Develops strong relationships across all stakeholders at Citi, along with external clients.Accountable for the ongoing data remediation and the underlying client satisfaction of those data points.Provides both tactical and strategic solutions on complicated and unique situations.Improve the service offered to Citi Clients.Lead strong governance and controls.Present cohesive client strategy updates to senior management.Provides in-depth and sophisticated analysis with interpretive thinking to define problems and develop innovative solutions.May be responsible for a number of clients by owning the client experience relationship end to end across geography and product.Directly impacts the business by influencing strategic functional decisions through advice, counsel or provided services.Ensures essential procedures are followed and contributes to defining standards.Partners with Sector, Vertical & other business partners to ensure alignment of service experience with business strategies.Appropriately assess risk when decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards.
Qualifications:6-10 years prior financial services experience required with exeperience in performance measurement related work.Ability to identify and communicate risk issues, concepts, and mitigations/solutions effectively.Expert in MS Excel and MS PowerPoint.Lead change in an effort to continually improve client reporting processes Can make decisions and strategically execute.Strong writing and verbal communication skills are a must to effectively communicate to all levels of management, stakeholders and clients.
Education:Bachelors/Univeristy degree,
