About BrightTALK - discover your journey with BrightTALK here!
BrightTALK brings professionals and businesses together to learn and grow. Over 10 million professionals engage with 100,000 free talks and 1,000 online summits to discover new technologies, learn from trusted experts and grow their careers. Thousands of businesses acquire and inspire their ideal audience with BrightTALK's AI-powered content and demand marketing platform.
The Originals team creates content series for our audiences across a dozen strategic communities in the Technology, Financial Services, HR and Marketing industries. Leveraging BrightTALK’s webinar and video platform, the team plans and executes content strategies to grow and re-engage key target audiences, while providing clients with opportunities for sponsorship. The Content Manager is a leadership role on the team, helping to drive team KPI achievement and shaping the editorial direction of BrightTALK communities to provide content our audiences want.
As a Content Project Manager, you will be the driving force planning and executing the content and monetization strategy for one of our communities. You will identify key demographics within your community and develop content for their interests through audience research, industry expert recruitment and strategic industry partnerships. Each content manager will use this plan as the basis for the creation of BrightTALK Originals and BrightTALK Customer Originals. This role requires strong project management skills and a keen sense of editorial and commercial acumen to develop the most compelling Originals content that drives bookings growth.


Qualifications
2-3 years’ content creation (specifically in copywriting) experience in a B2B environment - preferably within an agency setting
Excellent writing skills, with demonstrated experience in writing for a business and technically-minded audience
Responsibilities
Identify high-value target audiences within your community and their pain points and interests through audience surveying and research
Develop an Originals content strategy leveraging webinars and videos that drives audience growth, engagement and monetization with original content, series, curated playlists, etc.
Develop a social media presence for your Originals series
Ideate, test and roll out new formats to drive audience engagement
Recruit and manage the relationship of world-class presenters to present and be ‘the face’ of your series
Manage your audience inventory and work with Sales to identify opportunities for sponsorship to drive bookings growth
Manage strategic partnerships for Original series development
Lead and complete cross-functional projects that positively impact bookings and revenue growth, in particular in the creation of Summit content and calendars.
We are dedicated to learning and growing, going after big dreams, taking ownership, remaining open and honest while recognizing we are in it together. We are committed to hiring individuals with a diversity of perspectives, backgrounds, and beliefs who can use their passion to help us build a world changing audience and thrive along the way. Join BrightTALK and experience a collaborative and engaged team who works together to provide learning and growth opportunities for businesses and professionals.
BrightTALK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

Yext (NYSE: YEXT) is building the next big thing in AI search, and the next big thing is answers.

With the explosion of information and data online, search has never been more important. However, while the world of consumer search has innovated over time, enterprise search has not. In fact, the majority of enterprise search is powered by outdated keyword technology that only scans for keywords and delivers a list of hyperlinks rather than actually answering questions. Yext, the AI Search Company, offers a modern, AI-powered Answers Platform that understands natural language so that when people ask questions about a business online they get direct answers – not links.

We have a big, audacious mission to transform the enterprise with AI search. To achieve that, we need bright minds and diverse perspectives to join our growing company and help us continue to disrupt an industry. Does this sound like you?
Yext is seeking an E-commerce Industry Leader who will lead Yext's strategy for the CPG and D2C/Retail Verticals within the United States. The ideal candidate will be a creative thinker, with the ability to work cross-functionally in order to develop scalable solutions for their clients, as well as their teams. They will build the retail vertical messaging and develop Yext product offerings. They will also be the lead public evangelist for retail for the company and will include public speaking, blogging, and other forms of media. We are looking for a self-starter entrepreneurial type leader who has demonstrated success building up an offering in the retail vertical. Ideal candidates will have management experience in a consultative sales environment, as well as extensive experience marketing digital marketing solutions.

What You'll Do

Define and own the strategic direction of the Yext Retail, D2C, and CPG offerings.
Become Yext's Chief Evangelist in the Retail, D2C, and CPG verticals which would include speaking at conferences, webinars, thought leadership articles and PR.
Define, execute, and own an engagement strategy for key prospects, as well as a go-to-market strategy, in partnership with Product Marketing.
Build trust based value added partnerships, both internally and externally, while supporting team members selling to Retail, D2C, and CPG prospects.
Maintain open communications and collaborate heavily with cross-functional partners, including Direct Enterprise Sales, Client Services, Product Management, Consulting and Marketing, to ensure timely and appropriate client solutions.
In conjunction with customer success organization, create and foster referenceable customers for purposes of sales and marketing activities.
Develop specific revenue and qualified target account plans for sales teams, as needed, to ensure growth in all products/services categories.
Guide the creation of persuasive presentations and stories that demonstrate the value of Yext to clients.
Identify, develop and implement best practice sharing amongst the team to reinforce executable selling behaviors that are indicative of over overachievement.
Remain keenly aware of the competitive landscape and create awareness to both team members and executives regarding how our products and clients fit in.
Participate in sales team meetings, sales management meetings and quarterly business reviews for key customers and prospects.

What You Have

Experience driving revenue growth with emerging opportunities and established partnerships.
Comfortable in solving both performance based and branding objectives.
Skilled storyteller with experience communicating the benefit of marketing opportunities to brands.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills with an emphasis on translating insights, product information, and data into client value.
Ability to perform well in a highly dynamic, rapidly changing environment
Proven ability to forge relationships with top marketing decision makers at targeted brands.
Demonstrate success as a leader of change, achieving operational excellence by introducing new performance measures, processes, and systems.
Extraordinary skills in the areas of people leadership, sales, planning, forecasting, and prioritization.
Strong understanding of technology and trends that are changing the digital landscape.
BA/BS degree or similar level college education. In lieu of degree, relevant skills or equivalent experience.
Ability to travel.

 Bonus Points

Experience in a marketing performance environment, with a solid understanding of SEO and SEM SaaS, CMS, Site Search, Local, Display and/or Search market experience. Practitioner preferred.
Yext currently employs over 1000 amazing people around the globe. Our headquarters are in the historic Flatiron District in New York City, with additional offices in Chicago, Dallas, London, and Washington DC.
Yext offers the following exceptional benefits: competitive compensation, 401k, unlimited snacks, daily meal allowance, flexible hours / paid time off, and excellent health / dental / vision insurance.
Our mission is to help people go places—both consumers to our customers' doorsteps and our employees to new heights in their careers. We treat our employees well and offer tremendous growth opportunities. Challenging work pushes our people to be creative in a casual environment that is caring, fun, and collaborative. We believe that when you have smart, happy people working together you can produce something special.

We believe in equal employment opportunity and welcome employees and applicants of all races, colors, ethnicities, religions, creeds, national origins, ancestries, genetics, sexes, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientations, genders (including gender identity or nonbinary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), ages, physical or mental disabilities, citizenships, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. You will likely be a recognized technology and data science leader in AI/ML and have proven success and hands-on skills in applying AI/ML to the most demanding machine learning and engineering challenges. You are also a great communicator and can build and maintain relationships with other senior business and technology leaders.


Degree in machine learning or related technical disciplines or equivalent industry experience
Deep expertise and practical hands-on skills in multiple machine learning techniques such as Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Reinforcement Learning, or Predictive Analytics
In-depth knowledge and practical hands-on architecture skills in designing enterprise-grade ML platform that meets the most stringent security, compliance, performance/scalability, and operational requirements
Practical hands-on coding skills (e.g., Python, SQL, Java) in developing advanced machine learning algorithms or key components of enterprise-grade machine learning platforms
15+ years of total related industry experience, with 5+ years in leading large-scale machine learning engineering or data science initiatives in a large enterprise setting
Public speaking experience at leading industry AI/ML conferences
Practical hands-on experience with industry-leading ML services/products (e.g., AWS AI/ML services)
Practical hands-on experience with multiple industry-leading ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, MXNet, Keras, Scikit-Learn)
Experience with public clouds
Excellent domain knowledge in one or more industries
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to work with senior executives effectively and navigate complex organizational structure

Are you passionate about Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Deep Learning? Are you passionate about helping customers build solutions leveraging the state-of-the-art AI/ML/DL tools on Amazon Web Service (AWS)? Come join us! At Amazon, we’ve been investing deeply in artificial intelligence for over 20 years, and many of the capabilities customers experience in our products are driven by machine learning. Amazon.com’s recommendations engine is driven by machine learning (ML), as are the paths that optimize robotic picking routes in our fulfillment centers. Our supply chain, forecasting, and capacity planning are also informed by ML algorithms. Alexa is fueled by Natural Language Understanding and Automated Speech Recognition deep learning; as is Prime Air, and the computer vision technology in our new retail experience, Amazon Go. We have thousands of engineers at Amazon committed to machine learning and deep learning, and it’s a big part of our heritage. Within AWS, we’re focused on bringing that knowledge and capability to customers through three layers of the AI stack: 1) Frameworks and Infrastructure with tools like Apache MxNet and TensorFlow, 2) Machine Learning Platforms such as Amazon SageMaker for data scientists, and, 3) API-driven Services like Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Comprehend, and Amazon Rekognition to quickly add intelligence to applications with a simple API call.

AWS is looking for a Principal Machine Learning Solutions Architect (ML SA), who will be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for helping customers design solutions that leverage our ML services. As part of the team, you will work closely with the largest AWS customers in different industry verticals (Financial Services, Media and Entertainment, Manufacturing, Technology, Health Care and Life Sciences, Retail, etc.) to enable large-scale use cases, design ML pipelines, and drive the adoption of AWS for the AI/ML platforms. As a Principal AI/ML Solutions Architect, you will lead the technical customer engagement strategy at the most senior level to help transform their businesses. As an industry and technology expert, you will think holistically and design machine learning solutions for the most demanding industry use cases that cut across a wide range of ML techniques from predictive analytics to Natural Language Processing (NLP) to deep learning, and across a wide range of engineering disciplines from enterprise ML architecture to ML security to ML operations. You will focus on business outcomes and help deliver significant business results for both AWS customers and AWS. As an industry thought leader, you will speak at industry-leading AI/ML conferences and publish content with industry or domain-wide impacts. You will become an expert on a list of AWS AI/ML services to help AWS customers with their successful AI/ML adoption. You will partner with the product leadership to influence the AI/ML product strategy, bringing your unique industry insight and market observations.

A day in the life

About the hiring group

Job responsibilities


Advanced degree (MS and PHD) in machine learning or related technical field
Customer facing experience and track record of helping customers with their AI needs
Prior experience as a senior technology or data science leader
Experience in leading business or technology transformation initiatives

You will be utilizing cutting edge technologies such as Spark MLLib, Tensorflow, Google AI Platform, and Cloud Dataproc to build the required ML pipelines to enhance our customer's experience.

Deep understanding of test analysis

BounceX is an international marketing technology solution that brings a "logged-in" experience to logged-out website visitors across all their devices. A category leader in device identity resolution, BounceX helps companies like Uniqlo, HelloFresh and Tribune Interactive orchestrate real-time, multichannel marketing programs customized for the individual behind each device. They're best known for their impact on triggered email performance and website personalization.

Having raised over $44.9 million in funding from proven firms like Battery Ventures, Cross Creek Advisors and Primary Ventures, BounceX was named the Fastest Growing Software Company in America by Inc Magazine. With headquarters in New York and London, BounceX has been recognized by Glassdoor and Crain's for its exceptional culture and being one of the top places to work in the country. JobTitle: Senior Research Scientist/Senior Director, Policy & Research
CompanyLocation: New York, NY 10012 (Greenwich Village area)+1 location

Content_text:
We are seeking an Infrastructure engineer to build out our highly available infrastructure. Our customers utilize SparkAI in critical real-time applications, which in turn demands world-class infrastructure with minimal downtime and robust performance. You'll support our Kubernetes deployment, new developer friendly features, security and more. If you're excited about tackling challenging infrastructure problems, we'd love to hear from you!
About us
At SparkAI, we are on a mission to accelerate the proliferation of automation and robotics. We've started by addressing the most expensive and pervasive barrier to scale – AI edge cases – with an API-based service that resolves machine learning exceptions live, in production. Our customers are some of the largest and most interesting robotics applications in the world.
We're led by veterans of the autonomous vehicle industry (Zoox, Uber ATG, Apple, Otto) and changing how companies are solving problems on the path to commercialization, empowering the most ambitious teams to deliver groundbreaking automation products faster than ever before. If you believe revolutionary automation and robotics products shouldn't have to wait for the next AI breakthrough, join us on this journey. Our leadership team has deep ties into industry and knows a team is greater than the sum of its parts. We look forward to meeting you!
What you'll do here
Architect, scale, and take ownership of essential infrastructure for a rapidly growing startup
Work with the software and product teams for launch of new products
Grow our high availability (HA), multi-regional infrastructure while maintaining key metrics such as uptime
Perform end-to-end performance analysis, identify areas for improvement and implement with robust solutions.
Work with cloud vendors and external technical support for upgrades and rapid resolution of problems.
What we're looking for
Experience supporting large scalable single-page applications
Programming experience using languages such as Python, Javascript, or similar
Experience with cloud orchestration tools such as Kubernetes and Terraform
Experience with public cloud solutions
Experiences with software design methodologies, information systems architecture, object-oriented design, and software design patterns
Hiring process
Send us your resume and (optionally!) a personalized cover letter
If we think there is a great fit, we'll set up an introductory phone call with you. This is an opportunity to get to know more about us, our culture, and our vision for robotics
From there, we'll set up a remote interview with our team. We understand your time is valuable and will work around your schedule
From the interview, you'll hear from us within a week about an offer or next steps
Even if you don't think you're a fit or the timing is right, we'd love to hear from you! Apply below
Our culture
At SparkAI, we're committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer
We strive to create a high-energy, collaborative and supportive place to work
We believe in a high-trust environment, where every member of the team has a high degree of autonomy
We are fully remote with a flexible workplace
All employees have access to our top-tier benefits package

JobTitle: Edison Engineering Development Program – GE Research – Niska...
Content_text:
Job Description Summary
Unlock your technology passion and kick start your career in the GE Research Edison Engineering Development Program (EEDP). The GE Research EEDP is an early career program designed to grow your technical & leadership skills through challenging R&D rotational assignments, formal training & education, and professional coaching & mentorship. In the GE Research EEDP, you will collaborate with world-class researchers toward achieving our mission: to see, move, and create the future of flight, healthcare, and energy.
Job Description
Essential Responsibilities :
The GE Research Edison Engineering Development Program (EEDP) will prepare you for an exciting career in engineering research that will have real impact on GE’s businesses and customers around the world.
In the GE Research EEDP, you will:Work on at least 3 research projects over 2-3 years in a variety of disciplines.Grow your technical expertise in your chosen field and expand your skills in new areas.Collaborate with diverse teams to develop innovative technologies for aviation, healthcare, power, and renewable energy.Receive technical training, mentorship, and coaching from world-class technologists and experienced technical managers.Participate in leadership development training with GE program members from other businesses and locationsShare project progress internally and externally through presentations, written reports, and IP disclosures.
Current research areas include:mechanical structure analysis and computation (FEA)advanced mechanical systems design and development (bearings, gears, couplings, and rotors)heat transfer/thermal management and computational fluid dynamics (CFD)embedded computing and cybersecuritymodel-based control, advanced control algorithms, and optimizationhigh performance materials - including high temperature metal alloys, ceramics, composites, and energy storageelectric machine design and controlpower electronics and electric power systemsartificial intelligence, machine learning, and computer visionscalable data analytics, cloud computing, industrial software engineeringrobotics and autonomous systemsprobabilistic design and optimization of mechanical systems

Qualifications/Requirements :
Master’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science/Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related STEM discipline.Demonstrated academic excellence (minimum GPA 3.0 on a 4.0 scale)Relocation to Niskayuna, NY; this position is based in the GE Research office in Niskayuna, NY.Permanent legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.
Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen. Rotations in the Edison Program may require an individual to obtain active US Government Secret Clearance with ability to attain a Top Secret Clearance; prerequisite for a security clearance is U.S. citizenship.

Desired Characteristics :
Preference will be given to persons who have:Prior intern, co-op, or research experience.Enthusiasm for a career in technology and engineering research.Analytical and creative approach to problem solving.Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills.Demonstrated commitment to community involvement.Ability to work effectively with diverse teams.High level of adaptability and passion for learning.
GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).
Relocation Assistance Provided: Yes

-COVID-19 Hiring Update-

As the health and safety of our candidates and our employees come first, we're excited to provide virtual experiences for interviews and new hire on-boarding. Currently, reopening of offices is planned for January 2022.
Who we are:

Dataminr puts real-time AI and public data to work for our clients, generating relevant and actionable alerts for global corporations, public sector agencies, newsrooms, and NGOs. Our leading AI platform detects the earliest signals of high-impact events and emerging risks from vast amounts of publicly available information. Our real-time alerts enable tens of thousands of users at hundreds of public and private sector organizations to learn first of breaking events around the world, develop effective risk mitigation strategies, and respond with confidence as crises unfold.

Dataminr is making its mark for growth and innovation, recently earning recognition on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, Forbes AI 50 and Forbes Cloud 100 lists. We also earned accolades for 'Most Innovative Use of AI' from the 2020 AI & Machine Learning Awards.

Join our team and help the world manage risk in real time. You'll work with 800+ talented people across eight offices, united by our passion to collaborate, make a difference, and have fun while doing it!
Who You Are

This position is for an expert-level designer looking to join a highly impactful, creative, and dynamic team.

You have experience designing and shipping successful experiences for enterprise users and/or have the ability to work within a technical and highly complex environment.
You are a quick study who can gain deep knowledge about the contours of our systems, our business goals, and the needs of our customers and can transform those insights into beautifully designed products.
You are a strong interaction designer and demonstrate a deep understanding of visual hierarchy, layout, and information architecture.
You have great communication skills. You can elegantly navigate conversations, facilitate brainstorms, thoughtfully present your solutions to stakeholders, and negotiate with collaborators.
You operate with a human-centered approach. Even though you have a strong intuition, you are constantly looking to hone your design instinct and validate your ideas through user research and feedback.


What You'll Do

As a Principal Product Designer you'd be joining a small, but growing team focused on delivering valuable and intuitive experiences to international newsrooms, Fortune 500's, and enterprise organizations within the public sector.

Lead design visions across the entire product lifecycle and multiple product launches. You'll set the direction for the user experience while collaborating with engineering and product management counterparts.
Operate in an experiment-driven environment. You'll generate multiple ideas and use creative storytelling techniques to inspire.
Solve complex problems at scale and manage multiple projects in a timely manner.
Become an expert about our users and use this knowledge to inform your designs and advocate for their needs.
Define and uphold high standards for visual and interaction design. Inspire other designers, critique their work, and provide guidance based on your range of experiences.
Grow and help manage our design system in a scalable way.

Desired Skills & Experience

10+ years of experience designing web and mobile applications, preferably SaaS products
Mastery of design and prototyping tools
A portfolio that demonstrates experience designing complex user workflows for integrated systems, information architecture, visual design, usability research/analysis
Demonstrated understanding of modern HTML & CSS, and a working knowledge of current engineering approaches to building enterprise products.

Why you should work here:

We recognize and reward hard work with:
company paid benefits for employees and their dependents, including medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance
401(k) savings plan with company matching
flexible spending account for out-of-pocket medical, transit, parking and dependent care expenses
We want you to be your best, authentic self by supporting you with:
a diverse, driven, and passionate team of coworkers who want you to succeed
individual learning and development fund and professional training
generous paid time off; including sick leave and 100% company paid parental leave
remote working friendly perks such as expanded telehealth options for mental and physical well being, virtual yoga, meditation and health and fitness app reimbursements

…and this is just to name a few!

Because of this federal mandate, Dataminr is requiring that all prospective employees hired for this position present proof that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their first day of employment."

Hi, We’re AppFolio.
We’re innovators, changemakers, and collaborators. We’re more than just a software company — we’re a cloud-based, publically traded SaaS organization that creates products to make our customers’ lives easier. We’re revolutionizing the way people do business, and we want your ideas, your enthusiasm, and your passion for helping us keep on innovating.
We love where we work, and you can, too.
Who we are looking for:
We are hiring a Sr. Full Stack Software Engineer to join our AI Engineering Team and contribute to our rapid product development pace. We work collaboratively to set the technical direction for our SaaS products, developing easy-to-use solutions for our customers. Our engineers find deep satisfaction in building things that customers actually need. We focus on delivering value to customers and understand that this often means delivering code that isn't perfect but meets customer needs.
This is an ideal opportunity for someone who has a passion for building leading-edge software, mentoring other engineers, and is driven to help build a successful SaaS product used by thousands of happy businesses. We foster an environment that empowers small teams to set the technical direction of our solutions collaboratively.
Responsibilities:
Develop scalable, robust, and simple web-based solutions to solve complex business problems
Help mentor and guide other engineers
Formulate, implement, and evaluate algorithms and database queries to support SaaS scalability and stability.
Implement new features and optimize existing ones to drive maximum performance
Use test-driven development, code reviews, and continuous integration to deliver high-quality software and rapidly fix bugs as they come up.
Work closely with, and incorporate feedback from other engineering team members, QA, product owners, and our APM customers.
Leveraging agile practices, encourage collaboration, prioritization, and urgency to develop at a rapid pace
Research, share and recommend new technologies and trends.
You know you’re the right fit if…
5+ years of experience developing web-based applications, preferably in a SaaS environment
Experience working across all levels of the development stack
Strong familiarity with Agile software development processes: Scrum or Kanban
Strong familiarity with Test-Driven-Development
You’ve heard of Ruby and Rails, and have experience working with a language like Ruby, Java, or Python. You may even know enough about Javascript to have opinions about how frequently "the new hot thing" changes.
You love learning about new technologies but understand the value of using something old if it still does everything you need it to do.
You care about the long-term maintainability of the codebase and will learn to advocate for refactoring and clean-ups where appropriate.
You care about work-life balance and want your company to care about it, too; you'll put in the extra hour when needed but won't let it become a habit.
Creativity, ability to solve complex problems without a roadmap
Nice to Have:
Bachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related technical discipline
AI/ML experience
Experience with some areas of our tech like Ruby on Rails, React, Redux, AWS, SOA
If you are interested in creating exceptional SaaS products, working in the AI/ML space, and contributing to a successful company, apply today!
Our Story
AppFolio (NASDAQ: APPF) was founded in 2006 with the mission to revolutionize vertical industry businesses by providing great software and service. Our easy-to-use, cloud-based software helps our customers more effectively market, manage, and grow their businesses. Our software solutions exist in the real estate vertical, including AppFolio Property Manager and AppFolio Investment Management.
To find out more about what AppFolio has to offer, check out appfolioinc.com/careers.

Litify is built on the best-in-class Salesforce Platform and we're seeking to bring an experienced Solution Engineer on board to be an integral part of our Go-To-Market team. This individual will be primarily supporting sales efforts in client-facing meetings, calls, and projects, and to develop and lead custom demonstrations and storyboards.Brooklyn, NY - Wilmington, NC - New Orleans, LA + RemoteWhat is a Solution Engineer?The Solution Engineer (Sales Engineer/Solution Consultant) is responsible for presenting product offerings in a value-driven way to prospects and customers, with the end goal is to instill confidence in the technology and to remove all technical objections in the pre-sales efforts. To accomplish this, the Solution Engineer must have a strong desire to leverage their technical and/or sales skills, including the ability to solicit business requirements, develop a technical sales strategy, configure and effectively demonstrate the solutions that address these requirements and provide business value.Litify is hiring at all levels for the right candidates - beginner or advanced skills/experiencesYou Will Be: Supporting the sales team in their campaigns by helping identify, quantify, and capture Litify's value proposition and best solution that solves the customer's challengesBuild and demonstrating the Litify platform and that align with the customer's needsConducting discovery sessions to potential Litify clients along with our sales teamDirectly engaging internal and external stakeholders in client-facing environments via demos and presentationsConfiguring custom software demonstrations to showcase specific capabilities and enhancing standard software demos for use by internal team membersAttain quarterly and annual objectives assigned by managementAnswer RFP's effectivelyAbility to travel domestically (as needed)Minimum QualificationsSolid oral, written, presentation, and interpersonal communication skillsAbility to work as part of a team to solve technical problems in varied environmentsPreferred QualificationsB.S. or equivalent work experienceKnowledge of related applications, relational databases, and web technologySalesforce Experience and/or Salesforce CertificationsPrevious experience as a solution/sales engineer for a CRM company or similar technologyUnderstanding or exposure to the legal industryWhy Litify?Litify is led by an experienced executive team, including one of the world's most influential and successful lawyers, well-known VC's, and software visionaries. Litify will transform law firms into high-performing businesses and will radically improve how legal services are delivered - connecting the firm and the client with newer more efficient apps. Litify will use artificial intelligence to predict the outcome of legal matters, changing the economy of law. Litify.com will become a household consumer name for getting legal assistance and make legal advice dramatically more accessible to the people.Job Type: Full-time

Minimum qualifications:

4 years of experience in data analysis.

Preferred qualifications:

About the job
Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

Our team consists of excellent user trust experts. We cultivate thought leadership, domain expertise, and a cross-product perspective to promote trust in Google Cloud and help Google deliver trusted experiences to Google Cloud users.
We are a small team with a big vision. We are curious innovators, out-of-box thinkers, and creative problem solvers who love to use data and technology to build and deliver enterprise-ready industry-leading solutions that enhance user trust in Google Cloud.
At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.
Responsibilities
Identify and understand the business problems to initiate and drive data-driven solutions and strategies to solve them.
Identify the right data sources and analyze large volumes of data from heterogeneous sources and formats to derive deep and valuable insights and develop analytical solutions.
Lead the ideation, design, and development of analytical solutions to drive the team’s mission.
Create the correct goals and metrics for programs which, by their nature, sometimes focus on harder-to-measure intangibles (such as measuring user’s trust) and, using this data, make informed decisions on subsequent actions.
Strengthen global partnerships with senior stakeholders, across and beyond Trust and Safety (T&S), to identify and advance common goals and be a reliable domain expert for stakeholders.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

What You Will Do:
Development on Informatica tools: Informatica Power Center, Informatica Cloud and other tools.
Develop ETL workflows using Informatica for data loads from source to target databases.
Determine appropriate translations between source and target, capture metadata, load and transform data from data sources into target.
Design and implement appropriate error handling procedures.
Monitor performance, troubleshoot and tune ETL processes.
Work closely with the architect and engineers to design systems effectively reflect business needs, security requirements and service level requirements.
Research and investigate any Informatica issues. Develop a deep understanding of the relationship between various business process, systems, and the underlying data.
Create mapping /requirement document, ETL design documents, Unit Test cases, code repository and other relevant documents. Coordinate with application team and develop all ETL processes.
Skills and Experience You Will Need:
Bachelor degree or equivalent work experience
Who We Are:

About GalaxE.Solutions

Company: Corning

Corning is the world leader in specialty glass and ceramics, building and manufacturing keystone components that enable high-technology systems. Corning’s history is filled with breakthrough technologies that have played a meaningful role in the way the world works. We thrive on solving difficult, commercially relevant problems through a creative and collaborative research and development process.
Corning succeeds through sustained investment in R&D, more than 160 years of materials science and process engineering knowledge, and a distinctive reciprocal culture. Corning's Manufacturing, Technology and Engineering division (MTE) is recognized as the leader in engineering perfection & innovative manufacturing technologies by providing diverse skills to Corning’s existing & emerging businesses. We anticipate & provide timely, valued, leading edge manufacturing technologies and engineering expertise. We partner with Corning’s businesses and the Science & Technology division. Together we build and sustain Corning’s manufacturing as a differential advantage.
Corning Incorporated focuses on building a diverse global workforce where differences are celebrated, and employees feel safe bringing their “whole selves” to work. Our Diversity Network hosts 18 active and distinctive Employee Resource Groups. Employees have access to Allyship resources, podcasts, an internal video channel, digital learning series and trainings, all focused on building and celebrating global diversity and inclusion. Corning has been recognized as a leader in this regard and has been consistently recognized as a national employer of choice.

Scope of Position:
Provide leadership and strategic direction for Manufacturing 4.0 critical skills development.
Lead a cross-functional team to identify and develop the emerging capabilities that are needed for successful M4.0 projects, within existing disciplines such as manufacturing process engineering, analytics/ data science, modeling, data engineering, software development, controls, programming, systems engineering. Identify curriculum and methodologies to upskill and augment existing skill set, both within specific M4.0 projects and for more general use.
Work with modeling and data scientists to improve the speed and efficiency of applying advanced data analytics methodologies to solve critical manufacturing challenges.
Identify opportunities to apply advanced analytics, modeling and machine learning by understanding the business needs and developing project proposals to solve critical problems.
Lead impactful Manufacturing 4.0 and analytics-based projects across multiple business groups
Day to Day Responsibilities:
Lead cross-functional manufacturing & engineering projects that include the application of data analytics, machine learning, software development, and modeling.
Interface with internal customers to identify areas of opportunity, define project specifications, and work with industry experts within and outside of Corning to expand our expertise in key emerging technology areas.
Develop and implement strategies and programs to enhance skill sets that are and will be needed for M4.0 deployment and scale-up across Corning business divisions.
Work independently or as part of the team on data preparation, machine learning model development and testing and/or software development & modifications in support of Corning products and manufacturing processes at different stages.
Write and maintain relevant presentations, technical reports and support documentation, prepare and deliver relevant user training, and mentor new engineers and scientists.
Required Education:
MS or PhD in engineering, computer science, mathematics and statistics, or a related discipline with specialization or industry experience in manufacturing 4.0 key technologies such as data analytics & machine learning.
Required Years and Area of Experience:
15+ years of work experience in development and deployment of machine learning models, such as data mining, time series modeling, computer vision, natural language processing, to solve both academic and business problems.
Experience demonstrated through industrial leadership, academic research projects, compelling open-source project contributions or an impressive Kaggle scoreboard
Required Skills:
Strong background in applying machine learning techniques to solve industrial problems, using traditional machine learning algorithms, time series & sequential event models with recurrent neural networks, convolutional neural networks, and reinforcement learning, etc.
Good working knowledge of the work required to prepare data for machine learning purposes, performing exploratory data analysis, mathematical and programming skills such as Python, R and/or MATLAB.
Comfortable working with Windows and Linux parallel processing clusters.
Ability to communicate and understand the complex requirements of scientists, engineers and professional staff in the development and deployment solutions and to bridge gaps between “domain” language (engineering, science) and “computing solution” language.
Strong interpersonal & presentation skills and ability to work as a leader, team player, or individual contributor.
Must be a proactive and solution-oriented problem solver.
Ability to lead projects, embrace and drive change
Desired Skills:
Broad background in Manufacturing 4.0 capabilities such as IIOT, Edge/cloud computing, data lakes/ pipelines, manufacturing systems and advanced ML/AI and computer vision.
Knowledge of emerging technologies and algorithms in computer vision and/or machine learning in general, such as attention algorithms, few-shot learning, etc.
Experience working with cloud-based services such as AWS and/or Azure.
Knowledge of any other programming languages for scientific computing in Windows and Linux environments (such as C/C++, C#, Java).
A foundation in software design principles and knowledge of MPI, OpenMP, or other parallel/distributed computing paradigms.
Clear dedication to excellence and advancing beyond the current state.
Strong personal motivation.
Travel Requirements:
Individual may travel multiple times per year for one to two weeks per visit to other Corning locations or customers (domestic and international) or to pursue training opportunities (conferences, classes).

Socure is looking for a Staff Software Engineer to join our US engineering team and lead one of our new product initiatives.


In our mission to become the single, trusted source of identity verification and eliminate identity fraud from the internet, collecting quality signals is core to what we build. It's how we innovate and how we offer the most accurate Identity Verification on the market.

With the company growing very fast and our customer needs even faster, the only way for us to succeed in our mission is to significantly scale how we work with data.


We are in the early days of designing a high throughput ingestion system to capture real-time rich signals about user behavior on the web for correlation against fraud. We would love for you to join us and lead the way.
What You'll Be Doing:

You will work in close collaboration with our Engineering, Data Science, Infrastructure and Product teams to define the strategy and roadmap of Behavioral Biometrics Product.
Own the end-to-end delivery of all projects related to the initiative, from conception and design to development and production monitoring.
You will own the technical roadmap to execute on scalable and real-time ingestion APIs for capturing all of the facets of a user's behavior
Work closely with our Data Science team to convert streams of user input into data points for use in machine learning
Partner with frontend and mobile engineers to ensure smooth integration with our client libraries
Lead the team and all technical activities to design, build and operate real-time ingestion pipelines for aggregating and processing behavioral signals


What You'll Bring:

You are comfortable owning strategic initiatives end to end and working cross-functionally to ensure technical alignment.
You like to think at scale and design, develop and operate production services that meet goals of low latency, high availability, resiliency, security and quality.
You develop with empathy for people and how they use your work.
You have experience designing highly scalable systems that securely process a high volume of data and have likely used technologies like: AWS Kinesis, Kafka, Spark, DynamoDB or Elasticsearch.
You use your technical experience to educate your peers in scalability and backend engineering & best practices.
Exposure or familiarity with securing processing and storageof sensitive data.
6+ years of practical experience in building high scale, production distributed systems.


Who we are:

Founded in 2012, Socure is the leader in high-assurance digital identity verification technology. Named to Forbes' 2019 AI 50 list as one of America's most promising AI companies, a recent winner of API World's Best Data API and named to Inc. Magazine's Annual List of Best Workplaces 2020; Socure's technology applies artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques with trusted online/offline data intelligence from email, address, phone, IP, social media and the broader Internet to verify identities in real-time. Our fast growing list of customers include three of the top five U.S. banks, seven of the top 10 U.S. card issuers, as well as the majority of leading digital banks, lenders and insurers across the U.S. We are funded by some of the world's best investors and entrepreneurs including Scale Venture Partners, Commerce Ventures, Work-Bench, Santander InnoVentures and Two Sigma Ventures.
Perks & Benefits:

Competitive base salary
Equity - every employee is a stakeholder in our enormous upside
A tech-first company culture driven by entrepreneurial thinking and talent
A great team working in unison towards the same mission
Transparency is what our product is built on—and so is our culture
Generous medical, dental and vision benefits for employees and their dependents
Flexible PTO
401K with company match
Free meals

About DelphixDelphix is the industry leading data company for DevOps.Data is critical for testing application releases, modernization, cloud adoption, and AI/ML programs. Delphix provides an automated DevOps data platform. Delphix masks data for privacy compliance, secures data from ransomware, and delivers efficient, virtualized data for CI/CD and digital transformation.Delphix provides essential data APIs for DevOps, including data provisioning, refresh, rewind, integration, and version control. Delphix supports all apps from mainframe to cloud native across the multi-cloud, including SaaS, private and public clouds. For more information, visit www.delphix.com or follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook.The RoleWe are looking for someone who can converse effectively with technical customers, internal teams, business process owners and executives. This will include working with Support, Product Management (i.e. roadmaps) or others as neededEnsure client referenceability to support the Sales organization in the prospect closing processesFacilitate executive-level engagements such as value assessment and realization, product strategy and executive briefing workshopsMeasure and monitor customers' achievement of critical and key performance indicators, reporting both internally to Delphix Account team and externally to Customer Sponsors and ExecutivesProvide feedback and insight to help evolve the Customer Success approach and offeringsKnow the market and maintain a good knowledge of all key competitorsQualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, related major, or comparable education and work experienceHistory of success as a customer success manager, consultant, pre-sales, technical account management or equivalentTrack record of leading technical conversations and persuading others to take action based on requirements and value provided by solutionsExperience working in a development, testing or data management environmentUnderstanding of DevOps, Test Data Management, Agile, CI/CDMust work within a team environment with sales, field services and delivery teamsUp to 30% travel is possible, but less is generally anticipatedJob Type: Full-time

Work and performance of all teams in the area are directly affected by the performance of the individual.

About DearDoc
Let’s face it, finding great healthcare today is hard. DearDoc is transforming how patients engage with doctors by introducing innovative technology in practices everywhere. Doctors are juggling a lot - our technology allows them to take a step back, breathe, and focus on what they do best - care for patients. At DearDoc, we believe doctors should be doctors. That's why DearDoc takes a holistic approach by helping them attract new patients in many different ways. We've utilized Artificial Intelligence to provide "WOW' experiences for patients and doctors alike.

We're serving thousands of doctors since our founding in 2018. Along the way, we cultivated an incredible work environment — where people love to come to work everyday.

Our culture of customer obsession guides all our decisions, and our ability to think differently helps us serve doctors in a unique and creative way. We believe imagination only gets better after use, and we use our imagination everyday to create WOW moments for every customer we have.

We are a collection of young, talented, and ruthlessly passionate professionals focused on making a dent in the healthcare space. It’s a big challenge, and we’re up to it - are you?

How you will contribute:
The role of the Customer Success Manager is paramount to the success of DearDoc as a whole. As the bridge between our customers and our product, the Customer Success Manager is key in soliciting feedback from our customers about our products and platform. You will be the Voice of the Customer (VoC) to bring feedback to DearDoc. The Customer Success Manager will work directly with client accounts to manage the relationship and strategically grow revenue. Our customers are comprised of small to mid-sized private practices and you will be instrumental in their success on the DearDoc platform. You will also work cross-functionally with multiple departments across the organization to provide top-tier service and ensure customer satisfaction. Renewals are paramount to any SaaS company’s success and the work you will do as a CSM is hypercritical to the longevity of the organization. Your diverse experience will contribute to our collaborative environment and finding success not only as an individual but as a team.

Skills you’ll bring:

Minimum of 1-2 year experience in a customer success or account management role
Proven ability to manage a large book of business - you are not intimidated by 100+ accounts
Ability to deepen the relationship with clients through consistent upsell/cross-sell opportunities - you’re not afraid to advocate for DearDoc products and sell additional tools/products to help our practices accomplish their business needs!
Success in a high-growth environment and adaptable to change
Ability to ensure client satisfaction, balance customer expectations, and negotiate successful resolutions
Experience collaborating with various internal teams to push projects through completion in a timely manner
Manage customer renewals conversations
Meet and exceed Book of Business net churn goals
Drive customer advocacy with reviews, testimonials, and case studies
Strong project management with a strict attention to detail
Deep customer empathy and emotional intelligence
Keen eye for opportunities to increase revenue
Impeccable attention to detail to perform the highest quality of work
Great interdepartmental communication skills
Understanding of customer experience with a product
Resilient and hardworking (GRIT)
A positive, polite, confident, sincere and friendly disposition
The ability to solve problems & to think dynamically
Adaptability – we’re growing and evolving, and the rocket ship is about to take off
Ability to think differently
Team Player

In Your First 90 days You Will:
Interact cross-functionally with internal teams to understand how key functions work together and influence your role. You will master growth strategy calls and performance reviews with clients. Refine skills to probe and respond appropriately to customer requests. Have full accountability in managing 100+ accounts while achieving your upsell quota, maintaining renewal and churn rates, communicating with clients on a regular basis while driving customer outcomes along with product adoption, and ensuring customer satisfaction though NPS.

What Perks do You Receive:

Generous Compensation Plans
Gym Memberships
Happy Hours
Great Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Packages
Unlimited Paid Time Off
Team Night Out
401K Match
CitiBike Membership
And Much More

In Azure AI, we’re partnering with OpenAI to bring the next generation of language models into the hands of developers everywhere. We are focused on providing powerful, yet easy to use ML developer services based on generative language models like GPT-3 that can be used readily out of the box and further customized to our customers’ unique needs.
On the Responsible AI team, we work to ensure that each new product or technology we build is developed and used responsibly. In this role, you will drive Responsible AI product experience and implementation to enable developers to successfully and safely use OpenAI models in real-world applications.
This role requires a deep understanding of NLG-powered use cases and Responsible AI and a keen sense of product to define developer (and UI) experiences to let customers harness rapidly evolving technologies.
#microsoft #responsibleai #OpenAI #GPT-3 #cognitiveservices
Responsibilities
As a program manager for Responsible AI, you will build and drive state of the art products that enable customers to apply AI responsibly. Your responsibilities will include:
Develop a deep understanding of OpenAI’s API, customer use cases, and responsible AI practices.
Spend significant time with customers, homing in on successful patterns and trends to drive new product design and development.
Use creative product thinking to synthesize successful solutions into scalable cloud services.
Partner closely with engineers and scientists to build models, APIs, services, and complex systems at scale.
Be an evangelist for the technology – showcasing successful applications with blogs and demos.
Qualifications
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
5+ years in a product management role, designing and shipping complex products for developers, ML professionals, or similar.
3+ years of experience in machine learning and/or AI
PREFFERED QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience with OpenAI API and GPT-3.
Deep understanding of NLU/NLP/NLG and language models
Experience in Responsible AI or Content Moderation
Master’s degree or PhD in Machine Learning, NLP, or Computational Linguistics.
Primary Location: New York, New York.
Seattle, Atlanta, or Silicon Valley also preferred.

About Pagaya

Shape the Future of Finance

Pagaya is building a leading artificial intelligence network to help our partners grow their businesses and better serve their customers.

Pagaya powers a leading artificial intelligence network that enables banks, fintechs, merchants, lenders, and other B2C businesses to provide their customers with greater access to financial services. We help partners grow their customer base while managing risk, all with a seamless customer experience.

Pagaya’s network enables our partners’ customers access to credit across Auto, Credit Card, Personal loans, and Point of Sale markets. We are also developing products in insurance, real estate, and more. Our network is fully automated and operating at scale - with the support of the Pagaya network, our partners have processed millions of applications, with a new application typically analyzed every second.

Let's create better outcomes together!
About Pagaya

Help Shape the Future of Finance

Pagaya is a financial technology company working to reshape the lending marketplace, for investors, by using machine learning, big data analytics, and sophisticated AI-driven risk analysis. With its current focus on consumer credit and real assets, PAGAYA’s proprietary suite of solutions and pipelines to banks, fin-tech lenders and others was created to actively find greater value for institutional investors. PAGAYA’s models create additional value to that pipeline as well, by increasing liquidity and, in turn, increasing opportunities for access to credit.

We move fast and smart, identifying opportunities and building end-to-end solutions from AI models and unique data sources to new business partnerships and financial structures. Every PAGAYA team member is solving new challenges every day in a culture based on collaboration and community. We all make an impact regardless of title or position.

Our Team

The company was founded in 2016 by seasoned finance and technology professionals, and we are now 400+ strong in New York, Tel Aviv, and LA. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, smart, and kind leaders and teams—people you can be proud to work with!

Our Values

Continuous Learning: It’s okay to not know something yet, but have the desire to grow and improve.
Win for all: We exist to make sure all participants in the system win, which in turn helps Pagaya win.
Debate and commit: Share openly, question respectfully, and once a decision is made, commit to it fully.
The Pagaya way: Use first principles thinking to support our needs, but is unique to Pagaya.

Role Description

We’re looking for an organized, smart, motivated, and proactive executive assistant.

The primary responsibilities of this role are to maintain schedules, coordinate with internal and external stakeholders, provide logistical and travel support with detailed itineraries, work on operations-related projects, be proactive with evolving business needs, and be a trusted partner to the C-Suite.

Key Responsibilities

Provide proactive and strategic administrative partnership - you will act as the gatekeeper, advocate, and liaison
Time management - You will constantly tackle, block, and prioritize how an executive is spending their time with the ultimate goal of enabling them to do their best work
Build cross-functional relationships between internal and external stakeholders
Assist with day-to-day administrative support as needed
Coordinate travel and all associated logistics with global meetings and projects
Champion and build team culture by tracking, celebrating, and highlighting important team and employee milestones
Liaise and build relationships between several executives across the organization
Requirements
Previous experience directly supporting C-Level Executives
Strong organizational, project management and creative problem-solving skills
Superior verbal and written communication skills, with experience in creation and management of executive-level communications
High level of integrity; ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion
Previous experience working in a fast-paced, ever changing environment
Demonstrated ability to structure calendar cadence to support long-term business objectives
Ability to build presentation decks in PowerPoint
High attention to detail
A strong sense of direction around sensitive scenarios and confidential information
Experience implementing new processes to optimize leaders’ time
Experience with Visio a plus
Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit - Pagaya is growing incredibly quickly, meaning each employee will be given significant responsibility and autonomy. This will mean hard work, but will also mean room for innovation in developing processes and/or programs that could benefit the company

Benefits

Generous paid time off policy
Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
When onsite: Unlimited snacks and beverages
Covid-compliant environment
A diverse and inclusive culture

Our Team

Pagaya was founded in 2016 by seasoned research, finance, and technology entrepreneurs, and we are now 500+ strong in New York, Los Angeles, and Tel Aviv.

We move fast and smart, identifying new opportunities and building end-to-end solutions from AI models and unique data sources. Every Pagaya team member is solving new and exciting challenges every day in a culture based on partnership, collaboration, and community.

Join a team of builders who are working every day to enable better outcomes for our partners and their customers.

Our Values

Our values are at the heart of everything we do. We believe great solutions are built through a great community.

Continuous Learning: It’s okay to not know something yet, but have the desire to grow and improve.
Win for all: We exist to make sure all participants in the system win, which in turn helps Pagaya win.
Debate and commit: Share openly, question respectfully, and once a decision is made, commit to it fully.
The Pagaya way: Break systems down to their most foundational element, and rebuild them unique to Pagaya.

More than just a job

We believe health, happiness, and productivity go hand-in-hand. That's why we're continually looking to enhance the ways we support you with benefits programs and perks that allow every Pagayan to do the best work of their life.

JobTitle: Senior Associate, Product Management - AI & Machine Learning
Content_text:
The KPMG Advisory practice is currently our fastest growing practice. We are seeing tremendous client demand, and looking forward we don't anticipate that slowing down. In this ever-changing market environment, our professionals must be adaptable and thrive in a collaborative, team-driven culture. At KPMG, our people are our number one priority. With a wealth of learning and career development opportunities, a world-class training facility and leading market tools, we make sure our people continue to grow both professionally and personally. If you're looking for a firm with a strong team connection where you can be your whole self, have an impact, advance your skills, deepen your experiences, and have the flexibility and access to constantly find new areas of inspiration and expand your capabilities, then consider a career in Advisory.
KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate, Product Management - AI & Machine Learning within KPMG Lighthouse - Center of Excellence for Advanced Analytics to work on our Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) products and solutions.
We are looking to rapidly expand our ecosystem of AI solutions to enable our clients to solve complex problems at scale on cloud infrastructure utilizing cutting edge ML techniques. You will play a vital role collaborating with the engineering, data science, and client-facing teams to define and prioritize the capabilities that will drive these products and solutions forward. This is a unique opportunity to help grow and expand our technology portfolio further into new and existing markets.
Responsibilities:
Establish and maintain relationships with global solution owners and go-to-market teams to understand market and user requirements and priorities.
Manage the creation and iteration of new and existing services, solutions, or products, from idea generation, design sprints, prototype, and MVP, to user stories, production build, acceptance testing, and quality assurance.
Build roadmaps & backlogs through managing client & user feedback, identifying priorities, creating themes, and aligning to the vision.
Lead efforts to collect feedback through evaluations, online forums, or interviews; work with stakeholders to understand the business value, and priorities.
Help identify and work through issues with risk, legal and intellectual property.
Cultivate user communities by managing communication channels and working with the product, sales, and delivery teams to surface priorities and trends.
Evangelize, promote, and provide education on upcoming features and offerings to the product community and increase user/client adoption.

Qualifications:
Minimum of two years of prior Product Management experience preferably in professional services, Digital Services, or Artificial Intelligence; Minimum two years experience working with senior-level stakeholders
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university preferred
In-depth and hands-on knowledge of the ideation and product development life-cycle
Strong active listening skills, a willingness to ask for clarification, and ability to form empathy with users and business problems that need to be solved
Proficient in industry standard best practices around product, such as Design Sprints, Lean Product, and Agile Methodologies
Strong verbal/written communication skills, with ability to effectively interact with individuals at all levels of responsibility and authority and understand key points and themes.
Ability to travel up to 20%; must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship of a VISA

KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
The Responsible AI Expert Manager plays a critical role leading interaction with our AI product teams to ensure alignment with our Responsible AI principles and standards as well as supporting the design and execution of the overall Responsible AI program.
YOU'RE GOOD AT
Working in a fast-paced environment where you engage with a myriad of AI product teams who are working across client/industry contexts to help them identify Responsible AI risks and develop mitigation plans. Using your passion for Responsible AI to look for ways we can continually improve our program, coordinate with stakeholders across BCG, and contribute to our thought leadership. The Responsible AI Expert Manager will work with BCG Gamma’s Chief AI Ethics Officer and the Responsible AI Committee to:
Provide Responsible AI expert support to AI project teams, including conducting independent product reviews, responding to ad hoc support requests, and facilitating workshops
Oversee execution of the Responsible AI risk monitoring processes (e.g., identify & assess risks, oversee development of mitigation plans, escalate issues, recommend path forward)
Coordinate Responsible AI Committee meetings and help refine Committee procedures
Help coordinate across Legal, Compliance, Security, and other related groups
Maintain and update the Responsible AI program content, structure, and processes
Develop and integrate Responsible AI tools and frameworks into AI product delivery
Create, update, coordinate, and deliver Responsible AI training content for technical and non-technical audiences at all levels of seniority
Contribute to Responsible AI thought leadership, technical tutorials, and tool development
Monitor emerging global AI regulatory frameworks and policies and help translate into required Responsible AI program updates
Engage directly with client teams on Responsible AI-related issues
Remain up-to-date on the emerging frameworks, standards, technical approaches, and related issues by participating in workshops, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
3-5+ years of experience in project management and team leadership
3-5+ years of experience in Responsible AI/AI ethics, including directly engaging with AI product teams
Strong written and verbal communication skills across technical and non-technical audiences
Strong problem-solving and risk identification/mitigation in business contexts
Knowledge of Responsible AI issues, trends, frameworks, and best practices
Working knowledge of emerging AI regulatory frameworks
Based software developing/coding abilities preferred
YOU'LL WORK WITH
You will work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging, product-oriented environment where we push the thinking on operationalizing Responsible AI. You will engage with a diverse set of stakeholder, including product developers, product managers, legal, compliance, security, and senior executives.

We are:
Accenture’s Oracle practice, and we make the new happen now. Every day, we imagine the future and bring it to life using design thinking, agile development methodologies, and new smart tech like IoT, automation, and AI. We even built our own platform, myConcerto, that mixes the best parts of Accenture and Oracle to help companies come into their own as digital leaders. Ready to find genius answers to seriously hard business challenges and work with some of the best Come join a team that feels personal even though it’s over 54,000 strong. As a Global Cloud Elite and Platinum member of the Oracle Partner Network with over 145 awards, we’re proud the industry is taking notice of our work, too. Visit us here to find out more about Accenture's Oracle practice (https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/oracle-index.)
You Are:
A transformation maven with the skills to help clients meet the challenges of digitization. Your human superpower? Using your know-how, creativity, and analytical powers to solve clients’ most complex business problems to help their companies do more. You’re as comfortable leading projects and teams as you are diving into the details of workstreams and configuring Oracle solutions. Or you specialize in one or the other, our practice covers the functional & process side of Oracle as well as the technical development & technical architecture. Additionally, you have the communication and people skills to inspire teams to bring their A-game.
The work:
Help clients understand leading business processes so they can transform their business with Oracle
Spot strategies, risks, and options, and then recommend approaches that sidestep problems and help clients and functions meet their needs
Lead, coach and advise a small project team in addition to managing their performance (depending upon the structure of a project)
Give clients options for designs using prototypes
Set up, document, and test the Oracle system; understand and apply Oracle methodologies
Work with clients and stakeholders to make sure they get where they want to go
Gain the trust of your client, teammates, and managers to make sure projects get delivered
Keep growing your skills to help your team with business development and sales efforts
Stay in the know on leading industry trends and Oracle features to give your clients the best solutions for their needs
For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.
Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts

Demonstrated experience implementing or maintaining applications using Oracle Database 10g or higher
